La socia es la Sra: Vicentina, la socia tiene  34 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 3 hijos la socia alterna su actividades del hogar con la artesanía, ella aprovecha del bello atractivo turístico que es la capilla Sixtina de Cusco y de las callecitas típicas del pueblo de Andahuaylillas para hacer de este una oportunidad de trabajo la socia vende artesanía que compra al por mayor  y ella vende en la plaza principal del pueblo a todos los turistas que viene a conocer su tierra. La socia requiere l crédito para invertir en la compra de artesanía al por mayor para la venta al por menor, La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de artesanía.

La socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
This communal bank is named “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS DE ANADAHUAYLILLAS” (The Entreprenuers of Andahuaylillas).  The bank is loacted in the town of Andahuaylillas, which belongs to Quispicanchis Province, Cusco Department.

The member is Sra. Vicentina.  She is 34 years old, married and has 3 children.  She divides her time between household duties and her handicraft business.  Sra. Vicentina takes advantage of both the beautiful tourist attraction, the chapel of Sixtina de Cusco, and the traditional alleyways of her town to find opportunities to work.  This member sells handicrafts, which she purchases wholesale, in the main square of the town to all the tourists who come to visit her land.  Sra. Vicentina  needs the loan to invest in the purchase of wholesale handicrafts, which she sells at retail.

The member is grateful and wants to express that she will be disciplined in the repayment of her loan.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of handicrafts.

loans.name: Push We Group

texts.en:
Mariatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mariatu was born in Port Loko town, about 45 years ago. She is married to a businessman and the couple has three children. One is in primary school and two are in secondary school. 

For 15 years now, Mariatu has been selling cooked rice, vegetables, meat and fish. This is not the first loan that Mariatu and her group member have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. However, with the help of this new loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Mariatu will use her share of the loan (SLL 1,500,000) to expand her business. She will buy rice, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), groundnuts, fish, etc., in order to produce more cooked rice for sale.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm oil, groundnuts, fish, etc., in order to produce more cooked rice for sale.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramón es un padre de familia de 34 años  de edad, vive junto con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con sólo el servicio de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza porque los pobladores desarrollan la actividad agricola, ganadería y artesanía.

Ramón se dedica  a la agricultura hace varios años, tiene sus propias tierras de cultivo donde  siembra limón que cosecha semanalmente y luegolo comercializa en los diferentes mercados de la zona, producto que se consume mucho en los alimentos diarios de todos los pobladores, con los ingresos que obtenga en la venta de su limón podrá mejorar la calidad de vida  de toda su familia.

Ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para la compra de fertilizantes para abonar sus tierras de cultivo y asegurarse de tener una muy buena producción de limón para poder pagar el préstamo brindado como incrmentar sus ingresos y darles lo que necesita su esposa e hijos.  Ramón se le conoce por ser un hombre responsable y trabajador en el lugar donde vive, todo el esfuerzo que demanda su trabajo es con la meta de sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Ramón is a 34-year-old father who lives with his wife and children in their own home. The only service he receives is electricity. He resides in the District of Tambogrande, which is part of the Department of Piura. This area is known for its people who engage in businesses involving farming, livestock breeding, and making handicrafts.

Ramón has been a farmer for several years. He has his own farmland on which he grows lemons. The fruit is harvested weekly and then sold to different markets in the area. This product is widely consumed since it is part of the daily diet of all the local residents. With the income he generates from the sale of his lemons, Ramón has been able to improve the quality of life for his entire family.

He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN in order to buy fertilizers to apply on his farmland so that he can obtain a good crop of lemons. This will allow him to repay the loan, increase his earnings, and provide for the needs of his wife and children.

Ramón is known locally as a responsible and hardworking man. He strives to meet the demands of his job so that he can move his family forward.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cartons of pans, dishes, and cooking utensils for her business inventory.

loans.name: Msimamo Group

texts.en:
Kadala is in her early 50s and is married with one grown-up child. She has been running a food vendor business for 13 years now. She works from 6am to 3pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This is her 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the items which were out of stock.  She has paid back her loan successfully.  She hopes for a loan to buy 50 kilos of rice, a small bucket of cooking oil and 50 kilos of beans.  Her dream is to one day buy a plot of land.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Msimamo" which has a total of 16 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy 50 kilos of rice, a small bucket of cooking oil, and 50 kilos of beans.

loans.name: Rosa Estaña De Damian

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen D. la Asunción”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia D. Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno, tiene 53 años D. edad, es viuda y tiene 5 hijos, 4 D. ellos independientes.  Rosa estudió la primaria.
Trabaja con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 32 ciclos, su primer préstamo fue D. S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó para compra D. animales caseros.
Actualmente  se dedica a la venta D. mana (cereal).  Paralelamente se dedica a la venta D. repuestos D. bicicleta.
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/ 3000.00 nuevo soles, comprará nueve sacos D. maíz y fideos para tostarlos y producir mana para venderlos en la ciudad D. Puno, en el negocio le ayudan su hija, su nieto y un empleado que ha contratado para que realice el traslado D. la mercadería.  
Su sueño es tener más capital para mejorar el negocio.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es el ahorro y el seguro D. vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Community Bank "Virgen D. la Asunción", which is located in the district and province of Yunguyo, in the Department of Puno.  She is 53 years old, and is a widow with 5 children, 4 of whom are financially independent. Rosa attended primary school.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 32 lending cycles.  Her first loan was for 300 New Soles, the money was used to purchase household animals.

Currently she works selling mana (a type of sweet popcorn).  At the same time, she works selling bicycle parts.  With her new loan of 3000 New Soles, she will buy nine bags of corn and noodles for roasting and producing mana to sell in the city of Puno. She is helped in the business by her daughter, her grandchild and an employee whom she has hired to transport the merchandise.

Her dream is to have more capital to improve the business.  What she likes about the Community Bank are the savings and life insurance.

loans.use: to buy nine sacks of corn and noodles.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 9 children. 

Jessica has a retail shop that sells fish, like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell.

Jessica is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Jessica hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Angelina has a retail shop that sells hypo or cleansing agent per liter. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to buy raw materials for making hypo or cleansing agent.

Angelina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Angelina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making hypo or cleansing agent

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn is a 37-year-old married woman who lives in the town of Banga, in the province of South Cotabato. She does not have any children yet and prays that she will have one soon.

Edelyn is a farmer. She and her husband own the land that they till together. They grow rice, corn, and vegetables for sale. Edelyn also runs the couple's small sari-sari (convenience) store. She sells items such as vinegar, sugar, soap, and shampoo.

Edelyn has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and other farm inputs. She hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es:
Shirley ésta aplicando a su segundo credikiva  el cual será invertido en insumos para aumentar su producción de ariquipes;  con su anterior credikiva compró implementos de trabajo y materias primas, con las cuales logró un nuevo aumento en su producción. Su mensaje a los financiadores es el siguiente: “Les agradezco mucho, ya que gracias a su créditos he logrado sacar mi negocio adelante, y poco a poco se convertirá en el negocio que espero tener “. “Que me sigan apoyando” Si usted quiere leer la historia de Shirley ingrese al siguiente enlace:
http://kiva.org/lend/228791
texts.en:
Shirley is applying for her second Kiva loan that will be invested in ingredients to increase Arequipes [Colombian caramel candy] production.  She used her previous Kiva loan to buy work tools and raw materials with which she attained a new increase in production.  

Her message to lenders is the following:  “I’m very grateful to you because thanks to the loans I’ve been able to move my business forward and little by little it’s going to become the business I hope to have.  Please continue to support me.” 

If you’d like to read Shirley’s story, please click on the following link: 
http://kiva.org/lend/228791

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make arequipes [Colombian caramel candy].

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is married with 3 children. Gina is 37 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.
Gina sells barbecued meat to earn a living and has had this business for 4 years. She has requested a loan of 4,000 to purchase meat, the main ingredient for her barbecue business.
Gina has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Gina hopes to have several barbecue stalls in town.

loans.use: To purchase meat for her barbecue business.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en: Bosco is 31 years old and has 2 children, aged 4 and 3. He works with his wife, mixing different paints and selling them. He has done this business for the last 8 years. From the profits, he has managed to build a family house. He would like a loan to buy more tins of paint in order to increase his capital. He would then like to buy another piece of land and continue to support his family.

loans.use: to buy more tins of colored paints to sell.

loans.name: Salud

texts.en:
Salud is 67 years old and lives in Lobogon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has two children. Salud has a shop where she sells cosmetics. She has had this business for 15 years. She earns 8,000 PHP a month. She requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase skin-care creams, lotions, powders, perfumes, lipsticks, fingernail and toe nail polish, eye and facial makeup, and towelettes.

Salud has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Salud hopes to have a big cosmetics store.

loans.use: to purchase skin-care creams, lotions, powders, perfumes, lipsticks, etc.

loans.name: Afepeb (Missebo)1 Group

texts.fr: AFEPEB (MISSEBO)1 est un groupe constitué de cinq personnes et dont la représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommée Gwladys Olivia Afiavi. Les membres du groupe résident dans le même quartier. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Gwladys Olivia Afiavi est âgée de 30 ans et est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Hubert. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leurs charge. Gwladys Olivia Afiavi vit avec sa famille et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges du ménage. Gwladys Olivia Afiavi a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Depuis une dizaine d’année, Gwladys Olivia Afiavi  mène comme activité la vente de chaussures à son domicile. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à contribuer aux dépenses familiales. Gwladys Olivia Afiavi achète ses produits au Bénin et au Togo. Ce troisième prêt permettra certainement à Gwladys Olivia Afiavi et aux autres membres du groupe AFEPEB (MISSEBO) 1,de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
AFEPEB (MISSEBO)1 is a group made up of five persons whose representative (the one raising her hand in the photo) is named Gwladys Olivia Afiavi. The members of the group all live in the same neighborhood. Wishing to grow their working capital, this group is asking for a loan from ALIDé for the third time. Gwladys Olivia Afiavi is 30 and is married to a carpenter named Hubert. The couple are raising two children, both enrolled in school. 

Gwladys Olivia Afiavi lives with her family and shares the responsibility of supporting their family with her husband. She left school at the secondary level. For some ten years, she has been selling shoes out of her home. This business brings in money that she uses to contribute to covering family expenses. She buys her products in Bénin and in Togo. This third loan will certainly allow Gwladys Olivia Afiavi and the other members of the group called AFEPEB (MISSEBO) 1, to raise the level of their businesses and grow their clientele and their revenue.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Yagamahoro Group

texts.fr:
Anastasie est une commerçante âgée de 33ans qui habite la localité de Kibimba de la Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Elle fait le commerce d’articles divers de boutique (haricots, riz, sucre, savons, biscuits, huile de palme…) depuis 4 ans. Elle faisait le commerce de bananes avant de commencer cette activité. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 5e année primaire. Elle est mariée a Jérôme ; un commerçant des articles de boutique ; et ont ensemble  5 enfants dont 3 étudient. 
 Le crédit Kiva  de 300,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités d’articles divers de boutique (haricots, riz, sucre, savons, biscuits, huile de palme…)  à revendre  afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« Yagamahoro»
texts.en:
Anastasie is a 33-year-old merchant who lives in the town of Kibimba in Gitega Province, in the middle of the country. She has been doing commerce in a variety of store goods (beans, rice, sugar, soaps, cookies, palm oil...) for four year. She used to deal in bananas before beginning her current business. 

Anastasie attended school and reached the 5th grade. She is married to Jérôme, a store keeper. Together they have five children, of whom three are students. 

The Kiva loan of 300,000 Burundi francs that Anastasie obtained has enabled her to increase her capital to buy large amounts of various goods (beans, rice, sugar, soaps, cookies, palm oil...) to resell, so as to make a large profit. 

She is a member of the community group "Yagamahoro".

loans.use: to increase her capital to buy large amounts of various shop goods (beans, rice, sugar, soaps, cookies, palm oil...) to resell in order to make a large profit

loans.name: Rayito De Sol Group

texts.es:
Rayito D. sol se llama el comité formado por 12 mujeres D. la ciudad D. Mariano Roque alonso. Ellas son todas amigas y vecinas D. esa ciudad, tienen como objetivo primordial, la ayuda mutua, para que D. esa forma puedan salir adelante y mejorar su estilo D. vida.
Maria, una D. las integrantes, se dedica a la costura, en lo cual trabaja desD. hace un tiempo, nos comenta que gracias a su trabajo y a su esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante y crecer. Tiene ya una clientela bien formada debido a que hace buenos trabajos y es muy conocida en el barrio. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora, luchadora y emprendedora.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. telas e hilos, con lo cual pueD. abastecer su negocio y D. paso cumplir con la demanda D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
'Rayito D. Sol' (Little Ray of Sunshine) is the name of this committee of 12 women from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.  They are all friends and neighbors from the same city whose main goal is to help each other so that they can get ahead and improve their lifestyles.

Maria is one of the group's members.  Her business is sewing and she has been in this business for some time.  She tells us that, thanks to her work and her effort, she has managed to make progress and grow her business.  She has a well-established customer base owing to the fact that she does good work and is very well known in her neighborhood.  She describes herself as a very hard-working, tenacious and entrepreneurial woman.

Maria is requesting a loan to buy fabric and threads so that she can stock her business and satisfy her customer demand.

loans.use: to buy fabric and threads for her sewing workshop

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos Enrique tiene 30 años de edad vive en unión libre no tiene hijos, vive con la esposa en el cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

La VRC LUCHANDO JUNTOS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Zapotal nuevo, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a Labores Comerciales en su mayoría. 

Carlos es maestro vulcanizador, arregla llantas de vehículos hace 11 años de edad las compras lo hace en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para ponerse un negocio de llantas para todo vehículo. Con la ayuda del crédito habrá un beneficio en el negocio y mejorará el estilo de vida de la familia.

En los tiempos libres le gusta trabajar más.
texts.en:
Carlos Enrique is 30 and in a common-law marriage. He and his wife live together in the Ventanas canton, Los Rios province, and have no children.

The Luchando Juntos communal bank is located in the Zapotal Nuevo district, belonging to the Ventanas canton. The majority of the group members are merchants.

Carlos has been a master tire repairman for eleven years and makes his purchases and sales in Ventanas.

He is requesting this loan to start a tire business. This loan will benefit his business.

In his free time he likes to work more.

loans.use: to start a tire business

loans.name: Amigos Triunfadores Group

texts.es: Norma es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “Amigos Triunfadores” grupo conformado por 11 socios que llevan trabajando 08 meses con el Programa – Prosperidad. Norma tiene 54 años de edad es  madre soltera, tiene 05 hijos, actualmente sigue apoyando al menor de ellos. Desde hace 20 años Norma trabaja en una avícola en el área de reparto de pollos, aparte tiene un negocio de venta de productos de belleza, también realiza tejidos como chompas, guantes, pantalones, entre otros la cual trabaja sobre pedidos obteniendo así un ingreso extra para su hogar, gracias a estas actividades Norma ha  podido brindarles una mejor vida a sus hijos ya que han sido su motivo para seguir adelante. Con el fin de seguir superándose solicito el préstamo para invertir en sus productos de belleza comprando talcos, perfumes, cremas y así tener un stock guardado. El sueño de Norma es  de instalar un bazar y de esa manera asegurar su vejez. Norma junto a la Alcancía Comunal “Amigos Triunfadores” agradecen el crédito  brindado y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien.
texts.en: Norma is a member of the Amigos Triunfadores Communal Bank, which is made up of 11 members who have been working with Programa Prosperidad for eight months.  Norma is a 54-year-old single mother with five children who currently still supports her youngest child.  For 20 years, Norma has worked at a poultry farm distributing chickens.  Aside from that, she has a business selling beauty products and she also sews items like sweaters, gloves, and pants, among other things, when she receives orders.  This offers her extra income for her household.  Thanks to these business activities, Norma has been able to offer her children a better life, as they have been her motivation to get ahead.  With the goal of continuing to better herself, she is asking for this loan to invest in her beauty products by buying powders, perfumes, and creams in order to have a reserve of stock.  Norma's dream is to set up a store that would provide for her in her old age.  Norma and the Amigos Triunfadores Communal Bank are thankful for the loan that has been offered them and promise to continue working hard.

loans.use: to buy powders, perfumes, and creams

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children.
 
Clarita has a shop that sells snacks and fruit such as mangoes and apples. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy snacks and fruit to sell.

Clarita joined HSPFI in 2011. In the future, Clarita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks and fruit to sell

loans.name: Sharafniso

texts.ru: Шарафнисо 36 лет, замужем и имеет 2 детей. Сотрудничает с нашей организацией с 2008 года. Имеет среднее образование. После того как окончила школу  и начала работу с матерью и через несколько лет вышла замуж. Несколько лет сидела дома по уходу за детьми. Восемь лет назад ее родственница предложила работу продавщицы в магазине. Проработав год , она решила сама начать свой бизнес, муж поддержал в этом предложении и теперь у нее свой бизнес. Более 5 лет она торгует на рынке своего района. Прибыль от бизнеса Шарафнисо тратит на семейные расходы и на своих детей. Настоящий кредит Шарафнисо получает на пополнения своего прилавка на новый год конфетами и кондитерскими изделиями. Надеется на высокую реализацию на праздничные дни. Благодарна "Арванд"-у за поддержку.
texts.en: Sharafniso is 36 years old, married and has two children.  She has been partnering with our organization since 2008.  She has a secondary education.  After graduating from school, Sharafniso started working with her mother and then got married several years later.  She stayed home for a few years and took care of the children.  Then, her relative offered her a salesperson job at a store eight years ago.  After working for one year, she decided to start her own business.  Her husband supported her decision, and now she has her own business.  Sharafniso has been selling at her district market for over five years.  She spends the profit from the business on family expenses and her children.  Sharafniso is requesting this loan to refill her store inventory with candy and confectionery goods.  She hopes to have high sales during the holidays.  She is grateful to "Arvand" for the support.

loans.use: to purchase candy and confectionery products

loans.name: Stephen Mulwa

texts.en: Stephen Mulwa is a 42-year-old businessman who runs a grocery store in the village of Voi. He is married and has earned a living for the last nine years by operating a grocery store. He is applying for his first loan from KADET and will use it to buy more potatoes, tomatoes, cabbage and kale to sell to his customers. He will use the additional income earned as result of this loan to expand his business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
This is Imelda, resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines.  Her husband is Francis, a seaman.  She manages their household while operating the business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income to meet their everyday expenses.                             

Imelda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages in small quantities in the local neighborhood.  It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHPs-worth of cooking oil or a single egg.  Imelda earns money by purchasing supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece.  Her store is located adjacent to her house.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community.  She earns a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a increase in her business income as she expands her business. 

Imelda hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business.  She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners and/or clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To boost up the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to buy a water tank

loans.name: Masooda

texts.en: Masooda is taking a loan for his brother's cosmetics shop. His brother is 23 years old and lives in District 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is single and lives with  8 members of his family. He has a cosmetics shop that sells cosmetics and stationery materials. With this loan from AFSG he will expand his business and buy cosmetics. Since is the worker in his family and he supports them financially, he wants more success.

loans.use: Buying materials

loans.name: Yusif

texts.en: O. Yusif is 43 years old,  married and has 4 children. He is a successful animal breeder and businessman. He opened his small farm in 1999 from money  lent by his friends and used the money to buy his first cow. In 2006, with a loan from Aqroinvest CU, he purchased his second cow. Now, his aim is to purchase calves for meat purposes.

loans.use: Purchase 1 cow and 1 calf

loans.name: Aybaniz

texts.en:
Aybaniz is an Internally Displaced Person from the Aghdam region of Azerbaijan. She currently lives in a hostel in Baku. She is married with three children. Aybaniz owns a workshop where she is engaged in tailoring and has 4 other employees working with her. She has been in this business for 10 years. She takes orders and makes clothes according to her clients' tastes.

Aybaniz is currently requesting an $800 loan from the Normicro Baku branch so that she can purchase enough raw materials to fulfil her orders.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her tailoring shop

loans.name: Ydi Esmeralda

texts.es:
Ydi and Jaime are a young husband and wife who are 20 and 22 years old, respectively. They are very entrepreneurial and hardworking, with innumerable plans for their future life. They currently live in a small rented room in their hometown. Their dream is to build their own house so that they can live in comfort and safety with their son, Edy, who is one year old.

In order to make their dream a reality, Jaime has had to leave their town to look for a stable and decent-paying job. Ydi decided to become a street vendor of gasoline in order to contribute to the household solvency until her beloved husband can establish himself in another city. She begins work at 5:00am and finishes at 6:00pm. She has also decided to increase her income by cooking various meals to sell in the evenings to people in the community; she is certain this business will go well for her because she is an excellent cook and patient.

Ydi is very hopeful about this business and it is up to each of you because you can extend your generous help and make sure she has the money she is requesting for her new occupation. With these funds, she will be able to purchase kitchenware that will help her to do her work in a clean and orderly manner. Let’s make it possible for this new dream become reality, for the benefit of little Edy.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Ydi y Jaime conforman una pareja de esposos jóvenes de 20 y 22 años de edad respectivamente Se caracterizan por ser muy emprendedores y trabajadores con innumerables planes e ilusiones para su vida futura; actualmente viven en una pequeña habitación alquilada de su ciudad natal y el deseo que tienen es construir su propia casita para que puedan cobijarse cómodamente junto a su hijo menor Edy de 1 añito. Para hacer realidad sus anhelos Jaime tuvo que salir de su pueblo en busca de un trabajo seguro y rentable; por su parte Ydi decidió dedicarse a la venta de combustible en forma ambulatoria para contribuir con la solvencia de los gastos que genera su pequeño hasta que su querido compañero se establezca totalmente en otra ciudad. El desempeño de su labor la inicia a las 5:00 de la mañana y la culmina a las 6:00 de la tarde, adicionalmente ha decidido incrementar sus ingresos preparando diversos platos para ofrecerlos durante las noches frías para deleite de su comunidad; negocio que está segura le resultaría muy rentable por su excelente sazón y paciencia. Con mucha esperanza de poner en marcha este nuevo deseo recurre a cada uno de ustedes a fin de que puedan extenderle su mano generosa y pueda conseguir la cantidad de dinero que solicita para el financiamiento de su nueva ocupación. Con el podrá adquirir enceres de cocina a fin de que su labor sea llevada a cabo con mucha limpieza y orden. Hagamos posible que este nuevo sueño se convierta en realidad para beneficio del pequeño Edy.

loans.use: To buy kitchenware outfit Ydi's new business

loans.name: Naka

texts.fr:
Naka P., age 45, is unmarried and a hairdresser by training. Often faced with competition, she really wants to renovate her salon to attract more customers and to sell beauty products, hair extensions, and braids. However, her means for fulfilling her plans fall far short. She is requesting a loan of $400 that will enable her to gain customers and also to increase her income.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 45 ans, Mlle P. Naka est coiffeuse de formation. Très souvent confronté à la concurrence, elle veut plus aménager son salon de coiffure pour attirer plus de clientèle et vendre des produits de beauté et des mèches. Ses moyens sont très insuffisants pour la réalisation de ce projet. Elle sollicite un crédit de $400. Ceci lui permettra d’avoir plus de clients et aussi augmenter ses revenus.

loans.use: To renovate a beauty salon

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 42-year-old father of 4. He lives with his family in the Beirut suburbs. Hussein sells vegetables to the neighboring inhabitants. He is the sole provider for his 4 children. Hussein needs to develop his business and respond to the clients' demands. He therefore wants to buy more provisions in order to sustain his commerce.

loans.use: To buy expanded inventory for his little vegetable stand

loans.name: Yadira Mercedes

texts.es:
Yadira Mercede M. is a single mother of two children; the oldest is of school age and the second is recently born. Yadira's business is the sale of vegetables in the Chinandega Municipal Market's fruit sector since 15 years ago. She is a role model. Thanks to her efforts, she has been able to put her children through private school and is making way on her dream of her little ones graduating eventually with a university degree.

Mrs. Yadira is currently in need to invest and purchase vegetables, but she does not have enough money to make the purchase. This is why she approached CEPRODEL for a credit she'll use to purchase her products and then re-sell them. She has a record of 21 credits.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Yadira Mercede M., es dama soltera y con 2 hijos uno de ellos en edad escolar el otro es recién nacido. El negocio de Yadira es la venta de verduras desde hace 15 años en el sector de las frutas en el mercado municipal de Chinandega. Es una dama digna de imitar debido a que sus esfuerzos han hecho que pueda mantener a sus hijos en el colegio y lograr así su gran sueño de que sus pequeños coronen una carrera universitaria.

La necesidad que atraviesa la señora Yadira es que debe de invertir en la compra de las verduras y actualmente no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para realizar dicha compra. Es por tal motivo que acude a CEPRODEL para obtener créditos que le sirvan para la compra de sus productos para luego comercializarlos. Ella tiene un record de 21 créditos.

loans.use: Purchasing Vegetables

loans.name: Maheera

texts.en: Maheera lives in the Saatli region in the village of Soltanabad. She is 42 years old. Maheera is married and has 4 children. Maheera established her business in 1995 and since then has been successfully managing it together with her husband (shown in the picture). They breed cows and then sell them to the local cattle market. Maheera wants to buy more cows and expand her business.  Maheera has applied to the Saatli branch of Normicro for a $600 loan for a period of 12 months

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. is a trader who sells slippers. She is a single parent with seven dependents. Business is going very well. But she wishes to increase her income to enable her meet the family needs.

She is asking for $525.00 so that she can buy more slippers and other items that are of high demand in her area.

loans.use: To buy more slippers and other high-demand items to sell

loans.name: Jasmina

texts.en: Jasmina is from a small village Čajno, near the town Visoko. She is 30 years old and married. Jasmina and her husband are buying metallic and non-metallic raw materials and then resell it to the recycling factories. They want to expand this business with this loan in order to increase their monthly income.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials.

loans.name: Félicienne

texts.fr:
Born February 10, 1972 in Allada, in the Atlantique department, Mrs. Félicienne A. G. is a married mother of five children. She sells onions and fresh eggs. Due to the great increase in the number of cafeterias in Cotonou, demand has greatly increased, and she quickly runs out of her stock of fresh eggs. To meet her customers’ needs, Félicienne A. G. is requesting her third loan in order to purchase onions and fresh eggs.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 10 février 1972 à ALLADA dans le département de l’ATLANTIQUE, dame A. G. Félicienne est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle vend de l’oignon et des œufs frais. En raison de la multiplication des cafétérias dans la ville de COTONOU, elle écoule très vite son stock d’œufs frais. Ainsi, la demande est elle devenue plus importante. Pour répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle, dame A. G. Félicienne sollicite son troisième crédit afin de s’approvisionner en oignon et en œufs frais.

loans.use: Purchase of five bags of onions and 500 fresh eggs

loans.name: Dora Wilma

texts.es:
Dora is hardworking and responsible person of humble origin who sells clothing at the 16 de Julio market. Her husband is in Brazil, so she is raising her two children, with another one on the way.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Es una persona Humilde de clase sencilla vende en la feria 16 de julio, su esposo esta en el brasil, ella saca adelante a dos hijos y uno por nacer, es muy esforzada, muy responasable

loans.use: Purchase this season’s apparel

loans.name: Yuhusa's Mapinduzi Group

texts.en:
Yuhusa is 45 years old, married and has one child who is 15 years old. She also cares for another child who is four years old. In 2003, she went into business selling food. Every day, she works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. and can earn a profit of about $65 a month.

Yuhusa has applied for a loan to buy more food to sell. She will share this loan with the other members of her group, who need inventory for businesses they run that sell clothing, vegetables and charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Aby

texts.fr: Aby D. est mariée et mère de 07 enfants avec 02 autres en charge. Elle veut avec ce prêt pour renforcer son activité de vente de fruits locaux comme les mangues et les melons. Elle souhaite améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants et leur assurer une bonne scolarité. <b>Elle compte rembourser en une seule échéance au bout de six mois <b/>.
texts.en:
Aby D. is married and the mother of 7 children with 2 additional children in her care. With this loan, she would like to bolster her business selling local fruits such as mangoes and melons. She hopes to improve living conditions for her children and assure them of a good education. She intends to reimburse this loan in one single repayment at the end of 6 months.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and sale of local fruits

loans.name: Cissy Nakanga's Group

texts.en:
Cissy, 35, is the leader of a four-person group. She is married and has three children between the ages of 4 and 14. All of her children go to school. She resides in and owns a five-room house where she is staying with five people. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. Cissy is looking after three orphans of her late brother.

The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. For 10 years, Cissy has run a restaurant and bar in Bwaise one of the city suburbs. She sells to an average of 20 people a day, and works seven days a week. She rides a bicycle between home and work. Cissy's monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

Cissy's main challenges are seasonality and con men. She bought a money detector in order to detect fake money. Cissy has been with MCDT for many years and this is her sixteenth loan with the same group of women. She wants to use this loan to increase stock in her business and is aspiring to open another restaurant in Kawempe.

loans.use: To boost her business

loans.name: Hanumica

texts.en:
Hanumica was born in 1946 and lives in Doboj, Bosnia. For most of her life, she worked as a housewife. Now she is a widow and lives alone, surviving largely on payments from her late husband`s pension plan. These payments provide her with barely enough income to meet her basic needs, so she has started selling skin-care products on the side. The skin-care products are natural and environmentally friendly, and are popular in Bosnia and Croatia.

Hanumica requests a loan of 1,000 KM ($700 USD) through Women for Women International. She will use the loan to purchase make-up products, expanding her product offering beyond skin care. She expects that this will help her to attract new customers. This will be her sixth microfinance loan, all of which she paid back successfully in the past.

Hanumica says that the income she receives from selling skin-care products is not significant, but even the small amount of income helps. And like most women, she likes the free products she gets from the job.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic products

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel O. sells clothing for men and footwear at Ewim in Cape Coast. Daniel has received Senior High education.  He is not yet married and has no children. Daniel has been selling clothing for men and footwear since 2001. He is responsible for paying utility bills, clothing and other personal expenses. His loan will be used to increase the sale of the clothing and shoes. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to plough back into this growing business.

loans.use: to increase the sale of the clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Tulituuka Group E

texts.en:
Cheerful Rose is the 50-year-old mother of three grown children and the wife to a commercial truck driver. Rose is a farmer. She grows cassava, matoke, beans and sweet potatoes and sells them at Kampala’s busting Nakasero market, two hours away by lorry, on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. Her customers, mainly loyal repeat buyers, are families, grocery shops and restaurants. She provides service to her customers with honesty and friendliness and good prices. 

This is Rose’s fourth loan cycle. She uses the loans to buy produce from other farmers in her village, then she sells at Nakasero as a way to boost her income. Before becoming a Pearl member, Rose could only sell small quantities of produce she grew herself, and she had to depend on friends to sell it because she could not afford to travel to Kampala. Now she’s able to earn about 30,000 Ush a week. Traveling by lorry is difficult. It confines Rose to a fixed schedule and lorries are crowded, unsafe and uncomfortable. She wants to earn enough to afford a private lorry to give her greater capacity and flexibility and thus, earning power. Her personal goal is only to live a long and happy life.

Other members of her group have similar goals and needs.

loans.use: Buying produce from other local farmers to sell alongside her own.

loans.name: Yelba Marbellys

texts.es: Yelba Marbellys es madre soltera, tiene 3 niños menores de edad, labora como docente en el Ceta INATEC Nueva Guinea desde hace 5 año, está solicitando su 7mo crédito a AFODENIC para mejorar su vivienda con la reparación de piso y cambiar una poco el techo el cual se encuentra en malas condiciones, con este crédito va  comprar los materiales de construción, ella es una mujer con alto espitud de superación, siendo una profesional que desde muy joven se ha desarrollado en el campo laboral, se ha caracterizado por ser muy responsable, honesta; Yelba con los crédito que ha recibido a traves de AFODENIC ha realizado poco a poco las mejora de su vivienda, sueña con tener estabilidad laboral, salud  y una vivienda  digna en su comunidad para brindarle comodidad a su nucleo familiar que son sus hijos por los que ella se sacrifica.
texts.en:
Yela Marbellys is a single mother and has three children under the age of 18. She has worked as a teacher at Ceta INATEC Nueva Guinea for 5 years. She is requesting her 7th loan from Kiva partner AFODENIC so she can improve her home by repairing the floor and repairing the roof a bit, which is in bad condition. She will buy construction materials with this loan. She is a woman with a great spirit to overcome, as she has been a professional since she was very young, and has developed herself in the labor market. She is a very responsible and honest person. Yelba has improved her home little by little with the loans that she has received through AFODENIC. She dreams of having a stable job, good health, and a dignified home in her community so she can give her nuclear family comfort. She sacrifices to give these things to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair floor and roof of home

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
El Sr. Bernardo tiene 53 años de edad, esta casado hace 30 años con la Sra. Angelina Santacruz de 54 años. La pareja tienen un  único hijo, ya casado y que actualmente se encuentra viviendo con ellos.

Don Bernardo posee su negocio de autoservice hace 9 años, el cual comenzó con un pequeño capital que su señora le proveyó,  ya que ella tiene una boutique desde hace 16 años hasta la actualidad, que le genera ingresos.

Hoy día don Bernardo ya cuenta con una clientela bien formada, gracias a la buena atención personalizada que él les otorga y por la variedad de productos de buena calidad que les ofrece.

El cliente solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como: pollo, chorizo, fiambre, morcilla, arroz, y queso ya que son estos productos los que presentan mayor demanda en su negocio.
texts.en:
Bernardo is 53 years old and has been married to Angelina Santacruz, who is 54 years old, for thirty years. The couple has just one son who is married and currently living with them. Bernardo has owned a food market for nine years, which he started with a small amount of capital provided by his wife who has had a boutique for 16 years which generates income. Today, Bernardo counts on a well-established customer base thanks to the personalized attention he provides and for the variety of good quality products he offers. The customer requests a loan for the purchase of merchandise such as: poultry, chorizo, cold cuts, sausage, rice and cheese, as these are the products in most demand at his business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase poultry, chorizo, cheese, cold cuts, sausage, rice, yerba, sodas, crackers.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 19-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon. Alaa has been working as a house painter since 2006. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Alaa has requested a loan.

Alaa is speciA. in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he faced the lack of cash. Alaa decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Alaa will use the loan to purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha C. is a married woman with five children (ages 34, 33, 30, 27 and 19). She also cares for two other dependants. She owns and operates a small home products shop in the Ilala neighborhood of Dodoma. She is a member of the Darajani loan group (Group code 2020). Every day she works for 15 hours at her business.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more commodities for her business. More specifically, she is hoping that this loan will enable her to: generate an increase in her profits; expand her business; provide more food for her family; pay for her children's school fees; and save money for future use.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional commodities.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is sixty years old. She is divorced due to a misunderstanding that ensued between her and her husband, and she has remained a single parent ever since. Mary is a mother of three children, all of whom are adults and living independently. Currently, she lives with some of her grandchildren in an old family house in a fishing community called Elmina, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Mary runs a provision store. She procures products such as sugar, tins of milk, milo, bread, etc. from Cape Coast, the regional capital. She has been in this business since her youthful days. Mary also owns a vegetable milling machine in her community, apart from the provision shop. She wants a loan to procure more goods.

loans.use: To procure provisions

loans.name: Metrihon

texts.ru: Свой новый займ Мехрихон собирается потратить на обновления ассортимента весенней одежды. Она планирует съездить за товаром на потовый рынок, и поэтому подала заявку, чтобы покрыть часть своих дорожных расходов. Чтобы иметь хорошую реализацию сейчас, когда экономический кризис и торговля не такая как раньше нужно привозить только те товары, которые востребованы рынком. Мехрихон и собирается сделать это.
texts.en:
Metrihon plans to use her new loan to renew the assortment of the spring clothing. She plans to travel for the merchandise to the wholesale market and has applied for a loan to cover part of her travel expenses. To have a good turnaround of goods right now when there's an economical crisis and the sales are not as good as before, she has to bring only the merchandise which the market demands. Metrihon plans to do exactly that.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for the business travel expenses

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores C. has been a member of ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) for almost two years. She is a 50-year-old woman and hails from the town of Pandan, in the province of Antique. She is married to Manuclito C., a farmer and also a jeepney driver. She is mother to two daughters. Her eldest daughter is 24 years old and a college graduate. The youngest is 20 years old and also a college graduate.
Selling cooked foods around the village was Dolores’ previous source of income. When she decided to join ASHI, her first loan was used as starting capital for her variety store. Now, on her second loan, she proposes the amount of PHP10,000 as additional capital for her general store business. 
Her greatest aspiration is to make the business grow and so that her children will have stable jobs and be out of poverty.

loans.use: Additional capital for general store.

loans.name: Ulugbek

texts.ru: Улугбеку – 26 лет. Женат и отец 2-х детей. Он занимается продажей разных видов ковров. Он торгует на рынке  «Джума-базар», а в воскресенье на рынок «Якшанбе-базар». Улугбек закупает товар из Турции, а часть товара он закупает из местного производства Кайракумского Коврового Комбината. Он ездит за товаром 1 раз в месяц. Улугбек за свой кредит хочет закупить еще товара для увеличения ассортимента.
texts.en:
Ulugbek is 26 years old, married and has 2 children. He is involved in sales of various types of rugs. He sells at the Djuma-bazar market and at the Yakshanbe-bazar on Sundays. Ulugbek buys his merchandise from Turkey. Some of his merchandise is manufactured locally at the Kayrakum Rug Factory. He travels for his goods once per month. Ulugbek wants to use this loan to purchase more merchandise in order to increase his product assortment.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding product assortment

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites has managed a general store business for more than a year now. She is already 29 years old and married to Benjie D. M. who operates a tricycle transport business. They have two children; her eldest is already in the first grade of elementary while the second child enters kindergarten. She hope to improve her business in a different way to become productive said Marites. 

In her store, Marites is able to generate a weekly income of PHP 1,000. Aside from that, Marites also operates a school canteen every school day and earns an added income of PHP 150. Her desire to have a progressive and sustainable business motivates her to seek financial assistance from KIVA lender requesting the amount of PHP 13,000 as additional working capital. She knows it is of big help to her business towards the fulfillment of her children’s dreams for the future.

loans.use: Business Capital.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet O. is a thirty-eight-year-old business woman. She is married with four children. Currently, the four kids are in school. She is a seamstress and has been sewing for ten years. She sews all forms of women's wear with various kinds of styles that suit the taste of her customers like ‘kaba’ and slit, funeral clothes, etc. She also sells waakye (cooked rice and beans) alongside her sewing business.

Janet wants to use the loan to buy increased supplies of sewing materials like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency. Janet hopes to double her savings to provide her children with quality education.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and sewing accessories

loans.name: Koudjoukalo

texts.fr: Cette femme est une résidente du quartier de démakpoè, elle est célibataire et pour subvenir à ses propres charges elle a appris le métier de la couture, elle a ouvert un atelier qu’elle a appelé « Couture la GRACE »,elle y fait aussi le commerce de pagnes et de tissus. Elle tire beaucoup de revenu du commerce de pagne et de tissus, elle veut agrandir son stock de pagnes, pour cette raison elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 10 pièces de pagnes  05 tissus et divers.
texts.en:
This woman is a resident of the neighborhood of Démakpoè, she is single and in order to provide properly for those she cares for she teaches the subject of making clothes. She opened a workshop, which she called "Grace Fashion". She also stocks and sells "pagnes" (colorful wax cloths) and fabric. She gains a lot of revenue by selling "pagnes" and fabric. She wants to increase her stock of "pagnes", for this reason she is requesting a loan to buy 10 sets of "pagnes", 5 sets of fabric and a variety of other items.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy "pagnes" (colorful wax cloths) and fabric

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
La señora Rosa María, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 38 años y 03 hijos, 02 de ellos que aun dependen de ella.

Deseando ver profesional a sus hijos, y tener sus propios ingresos para poder lograrlo, decidió emprender su propio negocio. Nos cuenta que en su vida paso por altas y bajas, su carácter emprendedor que le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante, le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de comidas prepararas. Rosa María, vende sus comidas en su misma casa, en un local acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. Poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes que son sus vecinos, amigos y familiares por su buena sazón y sus ventas le van muy bien,  lo ofrece en las mañanas y en las tardes.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprara insumos para sus preparados como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, pollos y huevos en javas, plátanos en racimos, fideos y aceites en docenas, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  

Rosita, como le dicen de cariño, se siente con muchas fuerzas todavía para seguir con sus ventas de comidas, posteriormente desea implementar mas su negocio con un Restaurant bien acondicionado para brindar a sus clientes un mejor servicio y atención. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa María belongs to the "Holy Rose of Lima" Communal Bank in the District of Juanjui, Province of Marshal Cáceres, Department of San Martin. She lives in a shared home and is 38 years old with 3 children, 2 of whom still depend on her. She hopes to see her children become professionals and to have their own income. To be able to achieve this, she decided to undertake her own business. She tells us that her life has had it's highs and lows. With the enterprising nature that has characterized her and her desire to do well, she has been able to start her own business selling prepared foods. Rose María sells her foods in her own home, in an area setup to attend her clients. Little by little she has grown in recognition among her clients, who are her neighbors, friends and relatives, for her flavorful seasonings. Her sales go very well. She offers her foods for sale in the mornings and afternoons. With this loan of 1,000 Soles she will buy supplies for preparing her foods, such as: bags of rice and sugar, chickens and eggs in cartons, bananas in bunches, noodles and oils in dozens, and also kitchen utensils in order to offer quality service. Rosita, as they say with affection, feels motivated by many forces to still continue with her food sales. In the future she would like to augment her business with a well-laid-out restaurant in order to offer her clients better service and attention. She gives thanks to the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to the realization of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for preparing foods for sale.

loans.name: Kossivi

texts.fr: Soudeur expérimenté et maîtrisant les rouages de la forge depuis 2001, cet homme marié et ayant 02 enfants à sa charge sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour acheter 21 tôles, 50 baguettes et 30 tubes pour agrandir ses activités. Il a sa forge située à Agoè Anomé, l’un des quartiers périphériques de Lomé. Il est très apprécié de sa clientèle qui lui fait beaucoup confiance pour son travail toujours bien fait et conçu
texts.en:
Kossivi A. is married and the father of two dependent children. He works in his own smithy located in Agoè Anomé, a suburb of Lomé. He has been an experienced blacksmith since 2001 and perfectly knows the workings of his forge. His customers appreciate and trust him very much for his good and well designed work.

Kossivi applies to WAGES for a loan to expand his activity. He will buy 21 iron sheets, 50 metal bars and 30 pipes.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy iron sheets, metal bars and pipes for his smithy

loans.name: Yie Die Group

texts.en:
Christiana is fifty – five years old. She is married and has given birth to six children, all in school. She works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Yie Die’, meaning success. The members of the group are engaged in commercial activities such as food vending, provision selling, clothes selling, etc. Some of them hawk to sell their products while others trek to nearby communities to sell on their market days. 
They procure their stocks from Kumasi and nearby towns. The experience some of these traders have amassed over the years has given them the urge to expand their businesses, hence the need for the loan to buy goods in bulk to realize this dream. The group leader, Christiana is seated in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie S., age 55, manages a general store business in her house in Bagong Tanza Aurora, Isabela. She is requesting the amount of PHP 16,000 so to have added business capital for the improvement of her business. For the seven years she has run her store, Tessie has been able to contribute a great deal to their family necessities and has ensured the education of their children.

Tessie is blessed with three children. Some of the profits are used for business maintenance, but many of her store profits are used to support them in their studies and to pay their tuition. She actively encourages her children to finish their studies and to work very hard for their future.

Tessie is hoping to become a productive entrepreneur. To further attain her goals in life, she is patient and hardworking.

loans.use: To obtain added business capital for the improvement of her business

loans.name: Ayoyoé

texts.fr: A. Ayoyoé est née  vers 1949 à Ganvié, village lacustre situé au Sud du Bénin. Mariée et mère de trois enfants,  Ayoyoé n'a jamais fréquenté, et fut initiée très jeune à la vente de poissons frais et fumés qui est la principale activité de la région. Ayoyoé a continué avec la même activité jusqu’à ce jour.  Ayoyoé s'approvisionne en poissons dans les poissonneries de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Ayoyoé fume ces poissons avant de les vendre à ses clients. Ayoyoé avait déjà obtenu deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Ayoyoé sollicite auprès de ALIDé un troisième crédit pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Ayoyoé A. was born around 1949 in Ganvié, a lakeside village in southern Benin. She is married and the mother of three children. Ayoyoé, who never attended school, was a very young girl when she learnt the trade of selling fresh and smoked fish, the main economic activity in the region. She has always been active in this trade. Ayoyoé gets her supply in fish shops in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She smokes the fish and then sells them to her customers.

Ayoyoé had already two loans with Alidé, which she repaid on schedule. Now, faced with an ever increasing demand from her clientele, she came to Alidé and applied for a third loan to bolster her business.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fresh fish

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 20-year-old single man living with his parents and 5 siblings. He has owned a car mechanic shop since 2007 and has 6 years of experience in this field. He wants to borrow US$ 800 to buy new tools instead of his used ones to be able to continue his work properly.

loans.use: buy new tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишер Бобиев проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 28 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Алишер по специальности "юрист". Работал по специальности 1 год. После он начал заниматься торговлей. Алишер имеет собственный магазин, где торгует продуктами питания. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 3 лет. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Alisher B. lives in the town of Vahdat. He is 28 years old. He is married and has two children. His wife is a housewife. Alisher is a lawyer by profession. He has worked in this field for one year. He then started a sales business. Alisher has his own store where he sells groceries. He has been in this business for more than three years. He is asking for a loan to increase turnover.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase turnover

loans.name: Crisolito Group

texts.es: El grupo estas conformado por 11 PERSONAS, todos viven en la misma zona, tienen su actividad económica en la misma zona donD. se realizan las reuniones D. cobro. Además una gran parte D. estas personas empezaron a tener experiencias con créditos con nuestra institución, ya que nunca antes habían sacado créditos en otra institución financiera. Como mencionaba anteriormente existen 3 varones en el grupo, los cuales se dedican: sastre y confección D. trajes, sacos para varón, otro es taxista con coche propio, y el ultimo es contratista D. construcciones por la misma zona. Las mujeres que componen este grupo una gran mayoría se dedican a la comercialización D. frutas, abarrotes, y una D. ellas es costurera D. pantalones jeans en una industria la cual ella gana por producto terminado. Las personas componentes D. este banco comunal le ponen mucho empeño al trabajo que desempeñan tratando siempre D. entregar al mercado un mejor servicio para así tener más ingresos. Las que se dedican a la comercialización D. frutas utilizan el dinero para viajar y traer en camiones frutas las cuales las venden en los mercados D. su zona, las que se dedican a la venta
texts.en:
This group consists of 11 members, all who live and work in the same area where they carry out their meetings. The majority of the members started their loan experiences with Kiva partner Fundacion AgroCapital, and none of them has taken out loans from other institutions. As mentioned in previous descriptions, three of the members are men, and one makes a living as tailor making suits and sports coats for men, while another drives his own taxi, and the other is a construction contractor. The majority of the women in the group make a living selling fruits and groceries, and one of them is a seamstress at a jeans factory. The members put a lot of effort into their work and are always trying to deliver a better service so they can increase their income. The members who sell fruit will use to the loan to travel in trucks and bring in the fruit to sell at the area's markets.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Kanda Mama

texts.fr: Kanda Mama D. est âgée de 28 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 4 ans et demi et a eu 09 bonnes expérience avec le crédit. Elle possède d'un réfrigérateur pour la fabrication et vente de glace et de jus de fruits naturels. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de prendre en charge sa progéniture et de soutenir son mari dans certaines charges familiales.
texts.en:
Kanda Mama D. is a 28 year-old married woman with four children. She has been a member of the village bank for the past 4 ½ years and has had nine previous loans. She owns a refrigerator that she uses make and sell ice cream and natural fruit juices. Her revenues allow her to support her children and help her husband meet some of the household expenses.


Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her business

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Fifty-year-old Epifania is living in Norala, South Cotabato. She has a hog-raising business and a rice-farming business. She started her businesses in 1982. She can have a good harvest, but sometimes fails due to pest attack. Her businesses really help in providing for the basic needs of her family.

Requesting a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., worth 12,000 Philippine pesos, she will be able to buy farm inputs and feed for the pigs.

loans.use: Farm inputs and feed

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 38 años, es madre soltera y pertenece al banco comunal “Las hijas de Maria” de la Asociación Arariwa. Juana apoya a su hija Caty que estudia Turismo. Juana alterna sus actividades del hogar con el negocio de fabricación de artesanía  de tipo muñequería. Juana es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que requiere el préstamo para implementar el restaurante que esta abriendo en la Av. Collasuyo en el distrito de Cusco pues va comprar ollas y cubiertos. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Juana is 38 years old, a single mom and belongs to the community bank "Las hijas de Maria" (Maria's daughters) from the Arariwa Association. Juana supports her daughter Caty who studies Tourism. Juana alternates her housework chores with her craft business making dolls. Juana is an entrepreneurial and hardworking woman that requires a loan to implement a restaurant to be opened at Collasuyo Avenue in the district of Cusco, she needs to buy pots and cutlery. The member is grateful for the opportunity and commits to meet the repayment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pots and cutlery

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
Esta clienta tiene un hijo a su cargo  y este se  encuentran en edad escolar, es madre soltera, es el cuarto crédito que a Trabajado con CEPRODEL, y estos los ha invertido en mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con los Créditos otorgados por CEPRODEL.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, hierro y mano de obra para la construcción de un muro en la parte de atrás del patio de su casa de habitación para  darles una mejor condición de vida a su Familia. 

Ella dijo que gracias a los prestamos otorgados por ceprodel a podido mejorar su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
This client is a single mother who has one dependent child attending school. This will be the fourth loan she has received from CEPRODEL. All of her previous loans were used to improve her living conditions. The loan she is currently requesting will be used to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, and iron, and pay for labor to build a security wall in her backyard. This will provide better living conditions for her family. She expresses her thanks to CEPRODEL for providing loans that allow her to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for materials & labor to build a security wall.

loans.name: Chagnaadorj

texts.en: Chagnaadorj is 56 years old and lives with his wife and their two children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a rented ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. They have been living in their current home for two years. Their youngest daughter attends a vocational training center. Chagnaadorj's wife operates a sewing business at their home. In 2001, Chagnaadorj started manufacturing wooden products, and his family has been very supportive of him and his business. Since Chagnaadorj started his business, the family's quality of life has improved. When the business first started, its working capital was only 50,000 tugrugs (~ 35 USD). However, as a result of his hard work and determination, the working capital of the carpentry business has grown to 300,000 tugrugs (~ 211 USD). He has been planning to expand his business in the future. Chagnaadorj is a very hardworking person and he has great communication skills. He says, “I would like to continue to grow my business so that I can help my children as they get married and eventually start families of their own.” Chagnaadorj is requesting a 600,000-tugrug loan to purchase planks for the wooden products that he manufactures.

loans.use: To purchase more wooden planks

loans.name: Elmie Fernandez Group

texts.en:
Elmie F., 20 years old, is from the village of Taboo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are each collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Elmie F. Group.

Elmie is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Elmie operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Elmie has been engaged in her business for one year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Elmie joined PMPC to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elmie is requesting her first loan from PMPC, for 7000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support her family.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel L. is from the village of Talakag Bukidnon. He is 29 years old. Ruel is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Ruel owns & operates a business selling snacks like fish balls and tempura in the local community. Ruel has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Ruel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruel is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ruel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support his children's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Soutoura  (Prendre Soin De Soi) Group

texts.fr:
Soutoura est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien car elles  vivent ensemble dans le même quartier, dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et coépouses. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins 3 enfants.
Ce groupe Soutoura fait l’achat et la vente de produits cosmétiques, d’habillements et de condiments alimentaires.
 Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a deux ans. 
Sali Traoré  qui est un des membres fait l’achat et la vente des condiments alimentaires de toutes sortes (huile, oignon, Sounbala, tomates, cubes magies, ail, épices etc.) Elle est très sollicitée car elle occupe une bonne place au cœur du marché sous le hangar des bouchers.
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une importante quantité de condiments alimentaires. Elle se procure de ces marchandises au  grand marché de Koutiala en gros pour les  revendre en détail et au comptant à une clientèle essentiellement féminine.
Tandis que Les autres membres du groupe Soutoura comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105 000FCFA chacune au  cours de ce cycle, Sali Traoré  elle,  compte réaliser 120 000 FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour pouvoir diversifier  leurs activités.
texts.en:
Soutoura is a group of women from Koutiala who know each other well because they live together in the same district, in large traditional families with their husbands, children and co-wives. They are, on average, 35 years old, married and have at least three children each. The Group Soutoura buys and sells cosmetic products, clothing and food condiments. To grow their business, the members of the group decided to get involved with the credit institution Soro Yiriwaso two years ago. Sali Traoré, one of the members, buys and sells all sorts of food condiments (oil, onion, Sounbala, tomatoes, Maggie bouillon cubes, garlic, spices, etc.). She is very much in demand because she occupies a good place in the heart of the market near the butchers. She plans to use her loan to buy a considerable quantity of food condiments. She gets her merchandise in bulk at the main market in Koutiala and resells it at retail for cash to a clientele composed mainly of women. While the other members of the group Soutoura plan, on average, to clear a profit of 105,000 FCFA each during this loan cycle, Sali Traoré plans to clear 120,000 FCFA. In addition to repaying the loans, they use a part of their income to meet daily family expenses. They hope to strengthen this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so that they can diversify their business activities.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food condiments

loans.name: Unidas Para El Futuro 4 Group

texts.en:
Elipadia is the coordinator of her group Unidas para el Futuro (United for the Future), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally — many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the slums north of the capital, an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She in a simple structure as a single mother with her three children.

Epiladia is excited to be taking out her first loan with Esperanza to invest in her business, which sells silver jewelry, by purchasing more anklets, bracelets, rings and necklaces. She will use the profits to save towards owning her own home and helping her daughters. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Silver jewelry to sell

loans.name: Saquio

texts.en:
Saquio B. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. He is 65 years old. Saquio is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Saquio owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Saquio has been engaged in his business for over 7 years and earns approximately 16,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Saquio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Saquio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used  to purchase additional products to sell. Saquio is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Saquio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying firewood and charcoal

loans.name: Big Five Group

texts.en:
Peter Z., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Big Five.  He is 38 years old, married and has four children who range from five to 20 years old.  He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support.  

For five years, he has been charging mobile phones to make a living, on Johnson Street in Monrovia, Liberia. 

Peter plans to use his 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more mobile phone chargers. 

He describes himself as very gentle.  Peter's goal is to improve his business, build a house and continue to educate his children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: Buy more mobile phone chargers.

loans.name: Dionesita

texts.en: Dionesita P. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 68 years old and has five adult children. Dionesita owns and operates a business raising pigs to fatten them for sale. She also farms and plants rice crops. Her children help her maintain the farm and sell the harvest. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years. Dionesita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.
