texts.es: Oved Avisai A. A. de 35 años de edad reside en el departamento de San Salvador, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos de 10, 6 y 2 años de edad. Oved  cruzo hasta el nivel educativo de básica, pero posee un talento nato en la confección, oficio el cual le ha permitido sostener a su familia, el hace todo tipo de ropa a la medida, también diseña variedad de estilos de cortinas y accesorios textiles para el hogar, el crédito que solicita Oved es para ampliar la producción de sus cortinas, juegos de cama, ropa,  y para ello tendrá que comprar mayor cantidad de tela.
texts.en:
Oved Avisai A. A. is 35 years old and lives in the department of San Salvador with his wife and three children (ages 10, 6, and 2). Despite having a basic level education, he possesses a natural talent for sewing. This skill has enabled him to support his family. Oved produces all types of clothing. In addition, he creates a wide variety of curtains and home accessories.

Oved will use his loan to buy fabric in bulk so that he can increase his production of curtains, bedding, and clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric in bulk

loans.name: Dios Es Mi Pastor 2, 3 & 9 Group

texts.en:
Ysemitha, 26, is a borrower who lives near San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Dios es mi Pastor (God is my Shepherd), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Ysemitha and the other borrowers in Dios es mi Pastor live in Boca Chica, a small town between San Pedro and Santo Domingo, the capital of the Dominican Republic. Boca Chica has unreliable electricity at best, and it has no potable running water. It also suffers from the pollution of its two large neighbors. Ysemitha lives with her husband and two children, 3 years and 3 months old, in a small concrete home.

Ysemitha will use this loan to purchase new and used clothing to sell to her customers. She has successfully repaid three loans, and she is excited to be taking out her fourth. Ysemitha’s business is run through her home, which she currently rents. Her dream is to one day own her own house using the profits from her clothing sales. Thank you for lending to Ysemitha and the Dios es mi Pastor group!

loans.use: To purchase new and used clothing

loans.name: Salud

texts.en: Salud Bacaltus is a fish vendor. She earns income from selling fish in her village. She has nine children. She dreams of having more capital to support her fish-selling business. She plans to buy more fish from other fishermen. She will sell the fish to other towns for income. She needs a loan of 21,000 Philippine pesos to realize her plan. The loan that she will receive will not only provide a livelihood to her family but education to her grandchildren as well.

loans.use: To buy additional fish to resell

loans.name: Nena

texts.es:
Nena es una mujer activa y entusiasta en el trabajo, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, región D. Ucayali. Ella tiene 58 años y es madre D. cinco hijos(4 D. ellos mayores D. edad e independientes). Nena se dedica a la venta D. comida todos los días por las tardes desD. su casa y cuenta con el apoyo D. una nieta, pues su esposo se encuentra delicado D. salud.
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Rosas” desD. hace dos años y empezó su negocio con un crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles que utilizó en la compra D. golosinas para la venta desD. su casa. 
Actualmente necesita un crédito D. 1000.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados para la compra D. arroz, aceite, condimentos, azúcar y otros productos necesarios para su negocio. 
Su meta es tener un lugar donD. ofrecer sus comidas y seguir generando ingresos para seguir apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Nena is an active woman and enthusiastic in her work. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 58 years old and mother of five children, 4 of whom are now older and independent Nena is dedicated to selling food every day in the afternoons from her house and counts on the support of a granddaughter, since her husband is in poor health. She has been part of the Las Rosas Community Bank for 2 years and started her business with a loan of $125 which she used in the purchase of sweets to sell from her house. Currently she needs a loan of $350 which will be used for the purchase of rice, oil, condiments, sugar and other products necessary for her business. Her goal is to have a place to offer her food and continue to generate profits to continue to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, oil, condiments, sugar and other products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Diribash

texts.en: Diribash F. is a 58-year-old man on a pension. He owns a petrol station on the road between his village and Imishli City. He has about 5-6 clients a day. His business is stable and brings good income to his family, which consists of his wife and 4 children. He has more that 20 years in this business. His petrol pumps are getting old and sometimes break, so Diribash has applied for a loan of 1600 AZN to purchase better petrol pumps.

loans.use: To purchase new petrol pumps

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca, 50 years old, is a rice farmer.  She owns a farm that she hopes will provide her family with enough income to buy adequate food, clothing and other basic needs.  She has eight children.  Her eldest is 31.  She wishes that someday she will be able to buy more farms to be able to support all of of her family's needs.  

She is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 through Kiva partner Community Economic Ventures, Inc.  She will use the loan to buy farming necessities for growing her crops.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies

loans.name: Say's Group

texts.en: Mr. Say N. is 47 years old. He is the leader of a group village loan, which consists of four people. They are located in Pump Edth village, Takeo province. Mr. Say N. is a farmer who owns a 2.5-hectare field used to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Pheav Koem, plants crop (corn, vegetable, bean, etc). In order to support his farming and his wife's plantation, Mr. Say N. is requesting a loan to buy a water machine and fertilizer. Mr. Say N. is has seven children. Two of the children are employed in the garment factory, four are students in the local school and one is too young to study or work. Mr. Chhorn N. and Mr. Eam N. did not take a loan but their wives are taking the loan instead of them.

loans.use: To buy a water machine and fertilizer

loans.name: Alfonso Andres

texts.es: Alfonso Andres de 38 años de edad habita en la comarca Calderon jurisdiccion de El Ayote junto a su esposa la Sra. Julia Perez sus 3 hijos de 14,10 y 8 años respectivamente.  Alfonso es pequeño productor que se dedica a la siembra de granos basicos, musaceas, tuberculos y raices, los cuales comercializa y usa para consumo de su familia, pero ademas se dedica al cuido de ganado, esta solicitando su primer credito con el objetivo de comprar 6 terneros de desarrollo, para engordarlos y posteriormente venderlos a un mejor precio en donde obtenga ganancias que le permitan mejorar un poco la situacion economica de la familia.  Cuenta con el apoyo de su familia y con la experiencia necesaria para esta actividad.
texts.en:
Alfonso is 38 years old and lives with his wife and three children, ages 14, 10, and 8, in the in the Calderon region of the El Ayote jurisdiction. He is a small producer of basic grains, tubers, and root vegetables, which he sells and also uses to help feed his family. He also raises livestock. He is requesting his first loan in order to be able to buy six calves to fatten up and resell for a profit so that he can improve his family’s financial situation a bit. He has the full support of his family and the necessary experience to be able to accomplish this.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy calves

loans.name: Melvely

texts.en:
Melvely J., 47, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Tomas J., a family driver, and the couple is blessed with two children. Melvely helps her husband earn a living so that their family can have a better life.  She has been selling assorted varieties of biscuits and breakfast fare for quite some time now.

Melvely has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends the group's weekly fellowship meetings and consistently pays her weekly dues. Because of her good repayment performance with previous loans, she has been able to borrow four times from CCT’s cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her food business.

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use this added capital for her expanding business by buying more quantities of biscuits and buying raw ingredients for her breakfast fare.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can branch out  into other types of business.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.

loans.use: To buy more biscuits and raw ingredients

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira C. spends most of her time working at her farm. She helps her husband maintain their rice farm, which is located in their hometown in Agusan Del Sur. She has nine children and the oldest is age 27. She said that with a big family like hers, she has to double her effort to be able to earn. Despite all the challenges, Elvira is determined to succeed in her ventures.

Elvira is a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She is applying for a loan of 14,000 PHP. With this amount, she will be able to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs she needs.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia invested in a hog-raising business more than a couple of years ago. She has continued her business because, as she said, it helps her provide for her family and sustain her children’s education. She dreams for her two children to finish college and find decent jobs for themselves. She also hopes for her family’s living conditions to be improved.

Eufemia is asking for a loan of 11,000 PHP, which she would use to buy additional piglets and feed. This loan will help sustain her business.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a hardworking old lady who aged 85.  She has been practicing mixed farming.  She grows tea, keeps dairy cows and also sells soaps and detergents to earn a living. She has been saving part of her income with her group in Faulu Kenya called Wendo, which guarantees loans to its members.  Her business has really grown since she joined the group because she can access loans.  She hopes to grow her business into a large-scale business and improve her living standards in the future. She has requested a loan of Kes 70,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy another dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lucia Santos

texts.es: Lucia Santos G. D. M. D. 40 años D. edad, es una señora muy responsable y trabajadora  la  cual cuenta con muy bueno valores, razón por la que es muy respetada y querida. Vive en la ciudad D. Soyapango junto a su esposo quien trabaja como zapatero, manera a través D. la cual aporta a su hogar, así mismo vive en junto a tres hijos D. 16, 14 y 11 años D. edad, y junto a su suegra quien ayuda con los quehaceres del hogar. Lucia brinda el apoyo financiero necesario a su esposo, a través D. una tienda D. productos perecederos y D. primera necesidad, la cual les permite contar con una vida estable, en la cual pueden suplir a sus hijos con muchos esfuerzos D. todo lo necesario. Lucia solicita un préstamo a través del cual le pueda brindar la ayuda necesario a su esposo, ya que las maquinas con las que él repara los zapatos se ha descompuesto, por lo que necesitan contar con el dinero necesario para repararlas, esto es D. mucha urgencia para ellos ya que esta es la única forma en la que él se gana la vida, así mismo Lucia solicita dicho préstamo a Integral con el deseo D. poder surtir más la tienda y así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Lucia Santos G. D. M., 40, is a very responsible and hard-working woman who has good values which make her very respected and well-liked. She lives in the city of Soyapango with her husband who supports his family working as a cobbler. They have three children who are 16, 14 and 11 years of age. Her mother-in-law also lives with them and she helps with household chores. Lucia helps her husband support the family with earnings from a small grocery store; this allows them to have a stable life in which they can proviD. their children, though much effort, with all they need. Lucia is asking for funding to help out her husband because the machine he uses to repair shoes is broken and they need funds to repair it; this is urgent because this is his only source of income. Lucia is also asking Integral for funds with which to stock her store so that her profits will be greater.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy replacement parts for shoe repair machine and to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is 37 years old and married with two children, 15 and 17. Both children attend school.

Zipporah is a hard-working farmer from Eastern Kenya near Nkubu town. She has been practising mixed farming for 19 years and her main products are milk, potatoes, tomatoes, carrots, and cabbages that she sells in the local market. She also raises poultry. Her biggest challenge is pests and diseases that affect her produce, resulting in poor prices.

Zipporah recently completed her previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES.45,000 and has requested this new loan for KES.70,000 to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help educate her children and improve her family's standard of living. In the future, she hopes to acquire three more dairy cows producing at least 30 litres of milk daily, and increase her chicken stock to 200.

She is grateful of Juhudi because it is helping her acquire a dairy cow which will positively change her life.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Vladimir Alexander

texts.es: Vladimir Alexander J. S. de 25 años de edad, es un joven emprendedor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y forjarse una vida mejor. Él es un estudiante universitario, el cual vive junto a sus padres y su hermana la cual también se dedica a estudiar. Vladimir posee un cibercafé el cual esta ubicado en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Ilopango, lugar en el cual posee muchos clientes los cuales llegan a diario a hacer sus tareas, investigaciones por Internet o simplemente a pasar el tiempo y distraerse con algunos juegos. Así mismo posee una pequeña venta de diferentes tipos de papel, CD’s, folders, lapiceros, cuadernos y otros más, también imprime trabajos a colores o blanco y negro. Vladimir es una persona muy responsable quien se esfuerza mucho por mejorar su negocio y al mismo tiempo pagar sus estudios universitarios. Él solicita un préstamo con el deseo de poder comprar más computadoras, ya que las que posee no dan abasto en muchas ocasiones, así mismo para comprar audífonos, quemadores, cámaras, y más papelería, cuadernos y otros productos más los cuales poseen mucha demanda. Con todo esto Vladimir espera poder darle un nuevo impulso a su negocio y de esta forma mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Vladimir Alexander J. S., 25, is a young enterprising man with a great desire to get ahead and create a better life for himself. He is a university student and lives with his parents and his sister, who is also a student. Vladimir has a cybercafe located in their home in the municipality of Llopango, where he has many customers who come every day to do homework, internet research or to just pass the time and have fun with some games. He also runs a small business selling different types of paper, CDs, folders, pens, notebooks and other items; he also prints documents in colour or black and white. Vladimir is a very responsible person who works very hard to improve his business and also pay for his university studies. He is requesting this loan with the desire to buy more computers, since the ones he has can't cope with the work a lot of the time. He also wants to buy headphones, burners, cameras and more paper, notebooks and other products that are in great demand. With all of this, Vladimir hopes to give his business a new boost and thus improve his profits.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Computer accessories and paper

loans.name: Ildephonse

texts.fr:
Ildephonse N.  est âgée 46 ans, née à Gisenyi, province de l’Ouest du Rwanda.Il est marié et possèdent trois enfants, le moins âgée a 2 mois et le plus âgée à 12 ans, deux sont allés a l’école. Ildephonse avec sa famille habite Gisenyi.

Concernant son activité, il est commerçant des produits alimentaires qui est la farine de maïs, il a une expérience de 10 ans dans ce domaine de commerce et il a fait des épargnes qui lui ont aidé d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.il épargne dans ACB avec laquelle il est client, il y a 4ans. Le prêt qu’il vient de contracter, c’est pour acheter dix sacs de farine de maïs, appelé communément FUFU. Il les vend en détaille et en tirer les bénéfices et rembourser son prêt. 

Le prêt contracté avec ACB est  le premier, les intérêts  tirés de son business, il les utilisera pour payer le minerval des ses enfants et augmenter son chiffre d’affaires.

Dans l’avenir, après avoir terminé de rembourser le prêt, il pourra augmenter un niveau de prêt, et il deviendra grossiste de cette farine.
texts.en:
Ildefonse N. is 46 years old and was born in Gisenyi, a province in western Rwanda. He is married and has 3 children, the youngest being 2 and the oldest 12 years old. Both go to school. Ildephonse lives in Gisenyi with his family. His business is selling food products such as corn flour and he has been doing this for 10 years. He saves money, which has helped him improve his living conditions and those of his family. He has been saving money with ACB for the past four years. The loan he has just taken out will be used to buy 10 sacs of corn flour, commonly called FUFU. He retails the flour and the profits will allow him to repay his loan. The loan he has taken from ACB is his first, and the profits he will make will be used to pay school fees for his children and to increase the volume of his business. In the future, after repaying his loan, he will take out a larger loan, and will become a flour wholesaler.

Translated from French by Kathy Guis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat pieces de rechanges pour reparer sa moto

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia M. is a 42-year-old mother of four children and a wife to Francisco. She feels privileged to have learned many things from her experiences being poor. She has learned to move on and do something to break the chain that holds her and her family to poverty. 

In 2009, Nelia joined ASHI and requested a loan to buy and sell rice and fish. When she received the amount of her initial request, her planned venture materialized and she has able to have her own income. This has been used to support the needs of her family, especially of her children, three of whom are studying — one in college, one in high school and the youngest in elementary school. 

Nelia aims to grow her business and support the education of her children until they all graduate from college. She also hopes that by increasing her profit, she will be able to start a savings fund for the other needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fish and rice for sale.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samuel O. N. is thirty-five years old, married and has four children aged between ten and two years old. His wife helps him in running the business and they hope to grow the business and create employment for people.

His business is located at Mikindani estate in Mombasa and it is well known by the name Liera Tailoring. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many tourist attraction sites, not forgetting the Indian Ocean's white beaches.

Samuel makes clothes for men and women of all ages. He also makes school uniforms, something he has engaged in for the last ten years.  He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is that he has limited space for his business and the area is also very dusty and this makes clothes dirty and spoils the sewing machine.

This is the reason as to why Samuel is taking a 30,000 KES loan to purchase a new machine and relocate to a new premise.  He hopes to expand his business and employ people whom he will be directing. He describes himself as social.

loans.use: Buy a new sewing machine and pay rent deposit on new premises.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa B. is married to a driver and has three children. She has received senior high education.  Yaa sells second-hand clothes at Takoradi. Yaa uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Yaa will use the loan to purchase extra bales of second-hand clothes for sale. With the new profits from her extended business, Yaa plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: purchase extra bales of second-hand clothes for resale

loans.name: Toem

texts.en: S.,55 years of age, is a widowed woman. In order to provide for the needs of her family, S. sells a few products from her store, next to her house. She has been experienced in this sector for a year and is earning approximately $3 per day. She has two school-aged kids who are dependent on her income. S. requests the money from Kiva in order to accumulate the quantity of products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Hanilyn

texts.en:
Hanilyn L. is from the village of Kanitoan, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 25 years old. Hanilyn is married and has four infant children. To make a living, Hanilyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Hanilyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Hanilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hanilyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Hanilyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Aurora Isabel

texts.es: Aurora Isabel tiene su negocio que es la venta de discos y películas en Dvd, es una joven muy emprendedora que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y salir adelante con su familia. Este negocio fue para sufragar los gastos de su hogar, ella pasa muchas necesidades pues algunas veces no logra vender mucho y no le ajusta para comprar comida para su hogar. Todos los días sale a vender sus diferentes productos. Con el préstamo quiere comprar materia prima necesaria para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener un negocio grande y poder mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Aurora Isabel has a business selling CD's and DVD movies.  She is a hard-working young woman that has always enjoyed working and helping her family move ahead.  Her business began as a means of defraying her household costs and while she even denies many basic necessities, sometimes she doesn't sell enough to buy food for her household.  Every day, she goes out selling her different products.  With the loan, she wants to purchase more merchandise and in the future, she wants to have a big business and be able to increase her earnings.

loans.use: Work Capital

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda A., 37 years of age, is a dynamic and hardworking mother of three children in Barangay Dolipos Alto, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. Erlinda is happily married. Since her husband’s income is not enough to meet their daily expenses, she helps out by selling snacks every day in a nearby school in their municipality.

In 2009, Erlinda became a member of Paglaum MPC and attended training sessions about how to run a business.She wants to obtain financial assistance amounting to PHP 8,000 for house renovations. Someday, she wants to see all her children become successful in their chosen careers. Maintaining her credit worthiness is what she values most.

loans.use: for house renovation

loans.name: Isabel Amos

texts.pt:
Isabel Amos M. nasceu na Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, solteira mãe de 5 filhos de 12 aos 26 anos, três dos filhos é que vão a escola. Não teve oportunidade de estudar pois o seu pai dava mais prioridade aos rapazes, alegando que as raparigas tinham que ir trabalhar na machamba. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta sua mãe enviando dinheiro para bens alimentares.


Isabel sai de Gaza para o Distrito de Namaacha quando seu pai foi transferido para trabalhar na empresa águas da Namaacha. Após sua chegada Então Isabel começa a fazer (mukero) venda de produtos contra bandeada, mas a atividade era de muito risco então implementa uma nova atividade de venda de sacos de amendoim e feijão adquiridas na Suazilândia e revendidas na cidade Capital até então. Por mês tem feito 3 viagens adquirindo 20 sacos em cada viajem sendo 10 de feijão a 1.620.00mt cada, e 10 de amendoim a 1.800.00mt cada e revende a 1.950.00mt e a 2.250.00mt respectivamente. Tem tido um lucro de cerca de 10.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.  

Este é o quarto empréstimo de Isabel na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (feijão, amendoim e outros) para aumentar o volume do seu negócio. Os anteriores créditos foram de (5.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt) todos para a mesma finalidade.

Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do prazo e pedir um novo empréstimo para comprar uma viatura que lhe facilitara na venda dos seus produtos na Capital.
texts.en:
Isabel Amos M. was born in Gaza Province in southern Mozambique.  She is a single mother of five children between the ages of 12 and 26.  Three of the children go to school.  Isabel did not have the opportunity to study because her father gave priority to his sons, saying the daughters had to work on the machamba (small family farm).  She lives in her own house with her family and supports her mother by sending her money for food.

Isabel left Gaza to move to Namaacha District when her father was transferred to work at the Namaacha Water company.  After her arrival, Isabel began selling contraband products (mukero), but the work was very risky, so she began a new business selling sacks of peanuts and beans. She buys them in Swaziland and resells them in the capital city.  She makes three trips per month, buying 20 sacks on each trip, 10 of beans at 1,620 meticais each and 10 of peanuts at 1,800 meticais each.  She then resells them at 1,950 meticais and 2,250 meticais respectively.  She makes a profit of about 10,000 meticais per month, which she uses for household expenses.  She also saves some in her bank account.

This is Isabel's fourth loan with Hluvuku.  She is asking for 20,000 meticais to buy products (beans, peanuts and other items) to increase the volume of her business.  The previous loans were for 5,000 meticais, 10,000 meticais and 15,000 meticais, all for the same purpose.

She is confident that she will pay off the loan ahead of schedule, and she will ask for another loan to buy a vehicle that would make it easier for her to sell her products in the capital.

loans.use: Purchase products (beans, peanuts, etc.)

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia vive en casa de sus padres cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la comunidad Chijipina chico Achacachi. Ella es productora lechera. Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. Ella tiene dos hijos, vive con sus padres, quienes  también son productores lecheros. 
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera. Esto le permitirá aumentar su producción de leche.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en: Antonia and her two children live with her parents in the community of Chijipina Chico, Achacachi.  She is a dairy farmer and this is her main source of income. Her parents are also dairy farmers. The loan will be used to buy a dairy cow.  This will allow her to increase milk production.  This is her first loan with Impro.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow in order to increase milk production.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda D., age 57, prepares and sells cooked food for daily meals. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. She and her husband have two grown children and live in the village of Alimannao, Peñablanca, Cagayan.

Yolanda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda has successfully repaid her most recent previous loan from ASKI. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make her products for sale. This loan will be the tenth loan taken out by Yolanda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase the raw ingredients needed to make her cooked food products for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Remodel the living room in her house

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce N. M. is married with five adult children. Her business is located at the busy Shiro market in Kakamega — a region in Kenya that produces sugar cane, known as the sugar belt region. She sells milk to the local restaurants and residents in the Shiro area. 

Joyce also owns a hardware store where she sells such items as iron sheets, cement, and nails. She has been in this business for fifteen years. She says that her business is profitable and her only major challenge is competition from other people in the area doing the same kind of business. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well and is using her loan of Kes 70,000 to grow her milk business and increase her stock of hardware items. In the future, she hopes to open another hardware store since that business is more profitable. She also sees herself buying a car and a house. Joyce describes herself as hardworking, polite, and generous.

loans.use: Milk and items for her hardware store e.g. iron sheets, cement and nails

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia P., 61 years old, is married and supports her family by operating 2 businesses: a general store and dressmaking. She lives in Prk. Mubentanyo, Brgy. Dungga, Danao City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her two businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.

Cecelia now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. She is now borrowing PHP 13,000 in order to purchase more stock for the general store. This will be her 5th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Cecelia hopes to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Tayler

texts.es: Tayler tiene 37 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y amable, vive en compañía de su esposa y sus dos hijos varones, juntos se encuentran en una casa que le fue heredada por sus padres. A lo largo de toda su vida Tayler trabaja en la carpintería, fabricando muebles para el hogar como: camas, ropero, reposteros, mesas y sillas. Trabajo que es muy solicitado por sus vecinos, que gracias a la experiencia que tiene, han hecho que sus muebles tengan un buen acabo tanto en la pintura como  en el material en el que esta fabricado. Ante esto, su tiempo de trabajo es muy poco, siempre se mantiene ocupado, ya que espera terminar a tiempo los pedidos pendientes que tiene. Lleva 11 años en esta labor; por esta razón piensa tener capacitación en la fabricación de melamina, ya que son de mayor demanda en esta época. Es el 12avo crédito con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues desea obtener mejoras para su negocio. En su grupo comunal, es él líder y  muy responsable y siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de su grupo. De obtener el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de melamina en cantidades numerosas, para abastecer sus pedidos que tiene.
texts.en: Tayler is 37 years old, a very simple and loving man, and lives with his spouse and their adult male sons. They can be found all together in a home that was inherited from their parents. For the majority of his life, Tayler worked in carpentry, making furniture for homes such as beds, closets, pantries, tables and chairs. His work is in high demand from his neighbors and thanks to his experience, his furniture is well painted in addition to being produced from a high quality material. When there isn't much work going on, Tayler always keeps himself busy in the hopes of completing all of his orders on time. He has been working with carpentry for 11 years. Because of this reason, he plans to get trained in the production of melamine, a product in high demand during this time. This would be his twelfth loan with MFP and he promises to pay his payments on time because he wants to improve his business. In this communal group, he is the leader and is responsible and always worries about the well-being of his group. Upon obtaining the loan that he is requesting, he will invest it in selling melamine in numerous quantities in order to meet the orders he receives.

loans.use: To buy melamine.

loans.name: La Garita Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "LA GARITA" ya que la mayoría de los integrantes son de la misma colonia con este nombre. Esta ubicado en la comunidad de Atlacomulco estado de México. El grupo esta conformado por diez integrantes y es la primera vez que solicitan un crédito. Secundina G. R. es una de las integrante del grupo.Tiene 35 años, estudió hasta el sexto año de primaria, se dedica al hogar y atiende su negocio, tiene en total 3 hijos los cuales son varones. Ella se levanta muy temprano para preparar a sus hijos y llevarlos a la escuela todos los dias por la mañana, despues se va a trabajar. Su negocio lo inicio hace 4 años tuvo la necesidad de buscar una alternativa para poder apoyar la economia de su hogar. Solicita el prestamo para poder invertir e implementar otros productos a su tienda ya que sus clientes le solicitando carnes frias. La señora Secundina se siente muy satisfecha y agusto ya que le dan la posibilllidad de hacer crecer su negocio. La señora comenta que tiene planes de seguir invirtiendo para apoyar a la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
This group is called "La Garita" after the colony by the same name which most of the group members belong to. The group are located in the community of Atlacomulco in the state of Mexico. The group is made up of ten members and this is the first time they have requested a loan. Secundina G. R. is one of the group members. She is 35 years old and studied until Grade 6 in primary school. She attends to home duties, her business and her three sons. Secundina wakes up very early every day to get her children ready and take them to school, and later she goes to work. 

Secundina started her business four years ago as she was looking for an alternative to support her family financially. She is applying for this loan to invest in products for her store as her customers are requesting cold meats. 

Secundina feels very happy and satisfied with the possibility of expanding her business. She has said that she has plans to continue investing in her business to provide an education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase cold meats

loans.name: Hernando

texts.es: Hernando, de 25 años; es un hombre soltero y trabajador. Vive en compañía de su papá Heraclio y su mamá Sabina en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de San Juan de la libertad. La vida de este maravilloso joven se centra en el apoyo constante a sus padres a quienes quiere mucho. Hace 8 años que comenzó en el trabajo esforzado de la agricultura; en sus 3 hectáreas de terreno agrícola, siembra papa, arveja y habas, los que después de cuidarlos con el apoyo de sus padres; los comercializa en mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Según afirma, también se dedica en época de campaña a la venta de semillas. Viajando a la costa del país constantemente en esas fechas. Ahora sembrará papa de la variedad “canchan, única y perricholi”, por lo que espera mejorar la calidad de sus productos. Él pertenece al banco comunal “capital semillera”, y este es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde es uno de los integrantes más jóvenes de la asociación. Hernando, se está preparando para la próxima campaña agrícola, por ello con el crédito comprará abono orgánico, guano de isla (fertilizante natural) y semillas de papa de la calidad primeriza para esparcirlos en estos meses.
texts.en:
Hernando is 25 years old, single and very hard-working.  He lives with his father, Heraclio, and his mother, Sabina, in his own home located in the San Juan de la Libertad rural area.  The life of this wonderful young man focuses on giving his loving parents constant support.  Eight years ago he began the hard job of a farmer on his 3 acres of land.  He raises potatoes, peas and lima beans with the help of his parents. He then sells his crop at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma.

He also sells seeds when the time is right, traveling to the coast constantly.  Now he is sewing the seeds for the "canchan, única y Perricholi" variety of potato which he hopes will improve the quality of his products.

He is a member of the "Capital Semillera" (seed capital) communal bank and this is his third loan through MFP where he is one of the youngest members.  Hernando is preparing for the upcoming farm season and plans to use the loan to buy organic fertilizer, guano de isla (natural fertilizer) and top quality potato seeds to sew soon.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer, guano (natural fertilizer) and potato seeds

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita P. is from the village of Salinas Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 57 years old. Carmelita is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Carmelita plants and harvests rice for sale. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for more than 15 years and earns approximately 38,000 PHP every harvest season.

In 2011, Carmelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be Carmelita's first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Chao

texts.en:
From Phnom Penh city, Chao V. sells Khmer noodles to earn a daily income of around 3 USD per day. For many years she has sold Khmer noodles that she gets from her husband. They were married years ago. They have 6 children, one of whom is single, and the rest are married. One of Chao's children works in construction as a building worker, and he often shares his profit with her to help in the family’s needs. 

Chao V.'s house is getting old and it is hard for her and her family live in. She really wants to fix it, but her cash-on-hand is not enough to do so. That is why Chao V. would like to apply for a loan from Kiva to repair her old house. For future planning, the family wishes to enlarge their business, and expand their house.

loans.use: to repair her old house

loans.name: Severina

texts.en:
Severina is 65 years old and married with seven children.

Severina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of products to sell in her sari-sari store.

Severina has borrowed and paid seven previous loans from NWTF. She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Severina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of products to sell

loans.name: Hurelbaatar

texts.en: Hurelbaatar is 41 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger, Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent in Hovd province, Mongolia. His son and daughter, ages 13 and 14, both attend local secondary school. Hurelbaatar manages a coal trading business in his town. He started his business in 2008 with the help of his younger brother. They bring buyers coal from countryside area. In addition to his coal trading business he conducts a vegetable planting business in his town. His two businesses are the main source of income for their family. He is a polite man who says, "I am trying hard to deposit money for my children's education." He is requesting a 500,000 MNT of loan to purchase seeds and some equipment for his vegetable planting business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and some equipment.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
While sweeping the brightly painted floors of a daycare center as a janitor, Susana had an epiphany – she no longer wanted to work in the cleaning industry.  Recalls Susana, “I thought - I want to be a childcare provider! This is what I want to do. This is the job for me.” 

With gusto and determination Susana enrolled in community college, earning her degree in Child Development and passing all of her classes with flying colors—quite a feat, considering she had only attended school through the sixth grade. 

Shortly after completing her education, she opened up a daycare center in her own home and named it—fittingly enough—"Happy Faces". Fourteen gleeful children, ranging from 20 months to five years old, come to Happy Faces Daycare Monday through Friday to sing the alphabet, learn their manners, and play games outside. “It’s very important to teach manners starting at a young age. You can be sure that all of my children [clients] know how to say ‘please’, how to share, and how to wait their turn.”

Susana has no problem ensuring happy faces on her clients. In fact, she maintains such a happy clientele that she didn’t lose anyone during the recession (when many parents lost their jobs and no longer needed or could afford childcare) and Susana currently has a full wait list with the names of children who are still in their mommy’s tummies!

Her daughter Rena noted, “I think my mom has a natural way with children, and when parents come by to pick up their kids they can see that. I know I’m biased, but honestly, I would recommend her to anyone.” Apparently a natural knack for working with children must run in the family—Rena is currently studying to be a teacher. “I saw how much my mom loves teaching and realized that this was something I could really enjoy as well.” 

But Susana wants to make her daycare even better. She requested a microloan, her third from Opportunity Fund, for $10,000 to continue improving her backyard to make it more kid-friendly. While the children currently enjoy playing tag in the front yard, modifying the backyard will not only provide them with a playground but will also be a much safer option.

loans.use: to renovate the backyard of her daycare center.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ESMERALDA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elvira; ella tiene 74 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. maíz y habas, la socia venD. en el mercado desD. las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, por medio D. este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. venta D. maíz y habas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz y habas al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Elvira is a member of the Esmeralda community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Elvira is 74 years old, married, and has five children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling corn and beans.  She sells her produce in the market, from 6.00am to 5.00pm.  Through her business, she gets her children ahead in life.  Elvira would like to expand and improve her business selling corn and beans.  She is requesting a loan to buy corn and beans wholesale.

Elvira is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy corn and beans wholesale

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en: Rahima is married and has six dependents. She sells palm oil at Abura, which she has done for ten years. Her husband is a farmer. Rahima uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of utility bills and other household expenses. She will use the loan to purchase palm fruits to produce oil for sale. She plans to plow her new profits back into her expanded business. The pot on the fire has extracts from the palm fruits being boiled to make the oil.

loans.use: to purchase palm fruits to produce oil for sale.

loans.name: Tunas Rahayu Group

texts.en:
Tunas Rahayu, a group with 10 members, got a third loan. When the loan was granted, all members were present.

Ni Putu, the leader of the  Tunas Rahayu Group,  lives in a rural area predominantly worked by farmers. She lives with her husband, also a farmer and two children are still in school.

In this third loan she received Rp. 1,500,000 to be used to purchase three piglets  at a price per piglet of Rp. 250,000. The rest of the loan is to be used to buy superior quality feed. These piglets are planned for fattening and will be maintained for five months until ready for sale.

Ni Putu hope this partnership will run smoothly until the group is self-sufficient and can finance themselves. Ni Putu is standing in the back, in a grey shirt on the right side.

loans.use: To purchase three piglets.

loans.name: Gueswendbala Tib Songdo Group

texts.fr:
Mme Pauline représente le groupe GUESWENDBALATIBSONGDO. Mariée, elle est mère de 5 enfants. Le plus âgé a 17ans et le moins âgé a 1an.4 vont à l’école et elle a 2 personnes a sa charge.

Elle vend du savon liquide depuis 4ans et parallèlement des condiments. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de paglayiri en ville. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter 4kg de poudre de savon, 1kg de colorant et un demi-sac d’oignon.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle prend soin de ses enfants. Mme ambitionne agrandir son activité et s’occuper de ses enfants pour un meilleur avenir.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pauline represents the  GUESWENDBALA TIB SONGDO group. She is married and the mother of 5 children. The oldest is 17 and youngest is 1. 4 go to school and she is responsible for 2 people. 

For the last 4 years she has been selling liquid soap, as well as condiments. Pauline obtains her supplies at the Paglayiri market in town. Her customers are both men and women. She wants to buy 4 kg of soap powder, 1 kg of colorant and a half-sack of onions. With her profits, she takes care of her children. Her ambition is to increase her business and take care of her children for a better future.

loans.use: to buy 4 kg of soap powder, 1 kg of colorant and a half-sack of onions.

loans.name: Jaime Ignacio

texts.en: Jaime Ignacio is 48 years old and married with four children. His children are 13, 14, 19, and 22. For the past 4 years Jaime has had his own ceviche stand. (Ceviche is a dish composed of raw fish soaked in lime juice, salt, and onions.) Jaime has a small stand in a local market but is hoping to upgrade to his own restaurant soon. With a 1,200 USD loan, Jaime will begin to expand his small stand by purchasing more supplies for his kitchen in order to make more ceviche to sell. He is committed to making all the loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy more supplies to make ceviche

loans.name: Howard

texts.en:
Howard is 58 years old and married with six children. He manages a farming business where he plants and harvests rice to both sell and provide food for his family. 

Howard is requesting a 27,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer and herbicide to use to maintain his farm. He plans to improve his farming practices to increase his profits. Howard says that this will help him cope with the increase in commodity production nowadays and also uplift the living conditions of his family so they will be more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and herbicide to maintain his farm

loans.name: Cheruiyot

texts.en:
Cheruiyot  is a resident and farmer in Litein South Rift Kenya.   He is married with one child, aged 6 years.  He currently employs two farmhands on his farm that produces tea and milk.

Cheruiyot has made a fourth loan request of 70,000 KES with Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase a dairy cow. He says the dairy business will enable him to venture into other businesses and make his family financially more stable and secure.

Cheruiyot is glad Juhudi Kilimo is helping farmers out of poverty.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is married and 42 years old, with three children whom she sends to school. Her husband is a farmer who plants and harvests rice. Gemma runs a sari-sari store (convenience store) in which she sells products like coffee, sugar, breads, and cheese curls.

Gemma requests a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy vegetables such as string beans, eggplant, and bitter gourd for additional products to sell in her village.

Gemma's goal is to gain additional income from her business in order to continue sending her children to school through college. She hopes that the loan could help her attain this goal and see her children wearing professionals' uniforms someday.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as string beans, eggplant, and bitter gourd for additional products to sell in her village.

loans.name: Darlys

texts.es: Darly de 30 años tiene un negocio de tienda, pescadería y ostrería en el barrio Los Olivos, al suroccidente de la ciudad donde vive con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 2 a 7 años. Cuando inició su experiencia de negocios lo hizo en el municipio de Salgar, ubicado a orillas del mar, en el año 2008 con un restaurante vendiendo arroz de mariscos, sopa de  pescado; allí sus primeros clientes fueron los visitantes de las playas. En la actualidad sueña con tener un restaurante  de gran tamaño especializado en comidas marinas y en un local propio. Su mayor desafío es lograr el capital de trabajo suficiente para lograr la meta, por eso se esmera diariamente para poder alcanzarlas. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará víveres, verduras, y frutas para mejorar sus ventas y también sus ingresos. Mientras se esfuerza en lograr sus metas maneja en su negocio una utilidad no menor del 20% y una autonomía del 90% indicadores financieros desde los cuales se proyecta su potencial crecimiento y auguramos su exitosa inversión.
texts.en:
Darly, 30, has a store, and fish and oyster shop in the Los Olivos neighborhood in the southwest part of the city where she lives with her spouse and three children ranging in ages from 2 to 7 years.  When she started her experience in business she did so in the town of Salgar located at the seashore in 2008 with a restaurant selling rice with seafood and fish soup.  Her first customers there were beachgoers.  Currently, she dreams with owning a large restaurant specializing in seafood and located in a space of her own.  

Her greatest challenge is attaining sufficient working capital to reach this goal and this is why she strives daily to be able to reach it.  Her Kiva loan is the first financing she gets from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she’ll use it to buy foodstuffs, vegetables and fruit to improve sales and also her income.  While she strives to reach her goals, she manages the business with a profit margin of no less than 20% and 90% autonomy, financial indicators from which we can project potential growth and augur a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs, vegetables and fruit.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda is married with two children. She is 56 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental.

Minda sells cannned goods, noodles, toothpaste, coffee, and biscuits to earn a living and has had this business for 35 years. Each month, she earns 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14,900 PHP to to purchase additional products to sell in her store.

Minda has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Minda hopes to save money, both for the future and in case of emergency.

loans.use: to purchase additional products for her store, such as cannned goods, noodles, toothpaste, coffee, and biscuits.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is 40 years old and has two school-age children. Her husband is a farmer who manages their rice farming business. 

Due to financial difficulties, they need to earn more income to satisfy their needs and finance the education of their children. 

Zosima wants to improve her variety store's product offerings to increase her sales and profits.  But due to a lack of funds, she is seeking a loan of P10,000 to buy canned goods, beverages, seasonings, breads, soft drinks, rice and gasoline to sell in their village. 

She says the loan will be used to satisfy her customers' needs.  Zosima hopes that through patience and sacrifices, she will increase her income and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, seasonings, breads, soft drinks, rice and gasoline to sell in their village.

location.town: Brgy. Munguia,Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Ranogul

texts.ru: Раъногул жительница района Дангары. Возраст, 43 года. Замужем. Имеет четверых детей. Она занимается разведением крупнорогатого скота. Она  в основном закупает скот, откармливает и через некоторое время продает по более выгодной цене. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 5 лет. Кредит берет для закупа двух коров и теленка.
texts.en: Ranogul lives in the Dangara district.  She is 43 years old, married and has four children.  She is involved in breeding cattle.  She primarily buys livestock, fattens it up and sells it at a more profitable price after a certain period of time.  Ranogul has been in this business for five years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of two cows and a calf.

loans.use: to purchase two cows and a calf

loans.name: Valerio

texts.es: El señor Valerio realiza reparación de calzados se ubica en una zona donde diariamente sale a hacer sus trabajos de composturas, cambios de tapillas  y suelas, cambios de plantas entre  otros, el señor tiene 11 años de antigüedad en este oficio;   no es casado pero convive con su pareja, con la cual  tienen 3 hijos que se encuentran estudiando; con esta actividad trabaja para sustentar a su familia; vive en domicilio propio que se encuentra en la zona sud alto pagador  una zona alejada de la ciudad; el préstamo que solicita es para la compra de una maquina de coser para mejorar sus servicios de zapatería.
texts.en:
Valerio works everyday repairing shoes. He provides services such as replacing heel pieces and resoling, among other repairs. He has done this kind of work for 11 years. 

Valerio is not married but lives with his significant other, with whom he has three children who are currently in school. With his business income, Valerio supports his family. They own their home, located in a zone known as Sud Alto Pagador, which is far from the city.

With this loan, Valerio will buy a sewing machine to improve his shoe repair services.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Fidencio Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Fidencio es un hombre que  decidió iniciar un negocio propio debido a que se quedo sin empleo por un largo periodo, gracias  a  su iniciativa  y perseverancia  de  salir  adelante  día  con día  el empezó a   realizar la venta de galletas y dulces al mayoreo , ofreciendo  sus productos  en  los  micronegocios  de la  localidad,  gracias  a esto   su negocio a  ido creciendo  y  nos  comenta  que   ya  adquirió   un carro en  el  cual  distribuye  sus  productos no solo en la   ciudad  si  no que  también  realiza   la  venta  en ciudades  cercanas,   debido  al aumento  de sus clientes  en este momento  necesita realizar  la compra de  mercancía   es  por ello  que acudió con nosotros para la realización de sus  proyecto.
texts.en: Fidencio is a man who decided to start his own business because he was unemployed for a long period of time.  Thanks to his initiative and perseverance to get ahead every day he started selling cookies and candy at wholesale offering his products to local micro businesses.  Thanks to this his business has been growing and he comments that he has acquired a car that he uses to distribute his products not only in the city but in nearby cities too.  Due to the increase in customers he needs to buy merchandise and this is why he called on us to carry out his project.

loans.use: to buy cookies and candy to sell.

loans.name: Khadim  Rassol

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune qui tient une cantine de vente de pièces détachées automobile.Avant d'ouvrir sa boutique, il a d'abord été apprenti mécanicien.Avec l'aide d'un de ses amis, il s'est lancé dans ce type de commerce qui génère plus de revenus que la réparation des véhicules.Ses bénéfices lui permettent de subvenir à ses besoins et d'appuyer son père dans les dépenses d'entretien de la famille.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un prêt de 250000f pour acheter des pièces détachées diverses.Son ambition est d'élargir sa boutique.
texts.en: This borrower is a young man who has a stall for selling spare parts for automobiles. Before opening his shop, he first was an apprentice mechanic. With the help of a friend, he got started in this type of business that generates more revenues than repairing vehicles. His profits enable him to meet his needs and to support his father in caring for the family. To bolster his business capital, he is requesting a loan of 250,000 francs to buy a variety of spare parts. His ambition is to expand his shop.

loans.use: to buy various replacement parts

loans.name: Fausto Armando

texts.es:
Fausto de 46 años, empezo su negocio de produccion y venta de arroz con la ayuda de dios hace 20 años.

Con la ayuda de su espoza todos los dias recorre los mercados y ferias libres en su vehiliculo desde las 7am hasta las 2pm.

Gracias a dios no ha tenido ningun problema con la delincuencia ya que recorre algunos sectores peligrosos. Quiere el prestamo para comprar una computadora ya que quiere mejorar su negocio con tecnología. 
Su meta alcanza es comprar un vehiculo nuevo para poder distribuir mucho mejor el arroz.
texts.en:
More than 20 years ago Fausto, 46, with God's help, started his business of growing and selling rice.
His wife assists him every day going to the markets and fairs in their vehicle, from 7 am to 2 pm.
Thanks to God he hasn’t had any problems with violence because he goes through some dangerous areas.  He wants the loan to buy a computer so he can improve his business with technology.
His goal is to buy a new vehicle to better distribute the rice.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Consuelito

texts.es:
Doña consuelito  es casada con don Santos  y con quien procreo  ocho hijos quienes ya todos están casados.

    El préstamo que ella solicito es para invertirlo en la compra   y venta de ganados en donde lleva trabajando hace dos años  y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha logrado mejorar mucho sus ingresos en  su pequeño hogar.
 
    Su motivo a esta actividad fue su esposo quien es el que se encarga  de comprar y vender  nueva mente  los becerros  les va bien ya que tienes clientes  los cuales  le compran al mayoreo.

    Lo que  ha logrado  con este negocio  es aumentar más  sus ingresos y  seguir  trabajando    hasta que dios le preste vida.
texts.en:
Consuelito is married to Santos and they have eight children, all of whom are married now.

She is asking for this loan to invest in buying and selling of livestock.  She’s been working in this area for two years and tells us that things are going well for her and she has manages to greatly improve her small household’s income.

Her husband was the reason for this business, and he is in charge of buying and selling the livestock and things are going well, since they have customers who buy from them in quantity.

What she has managed to achieve with this business is increasing her income and continuing to work as long as God gives her life.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Muhayyo

texts.ru: Мухайё занимается растениеводством. Она арендует участок земли, где сеет подсолнух и пшеницу. Этим видом деятельности она занимается десять лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Muhayyo is involved in agriculture.  She leases a plot of land, where she sows sunflowers and wheat.  She has been involved in this type of business for ten years.  Muhayyo is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Sam Ang

texts.en:
Originally from a village located in the Sa Ang district of Cambodia, Sam Ang is a 46-year-old widow with only one child. Being a widow, she has struggled to earn a living by selling Khmer noodles, desserts, and rice soup in her village. She has been in this business for more than ten years, and it is her main source of income. 

Sam Ang received a loan from VisionFund four years ago. The loan helped her to make a better living. With her business growth, she is applying for another loan with VisionFund. She plans to use this entire loan to buy more grocery items, such as ingredients, plates, and casserole dishes, for her business. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her business and earn a larger income so she can set aside some money for the future.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for her food business.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is from Carmen Annex, Ozamis, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Aida is married and has four children. To make a living, Aida owns and operates a cafeteria business, cooking goods and selling them to the local community. Aida has been engaged in her business for over 22 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from these activities. 

Aida is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used for additional capital and to purchase raw materials for her cafeteria. In 2010, Aida joined GDMPC to seek financial assistance as an additional investment in her business. She plans to use the income generated to expand her business and to finish supporting the studies of her children.

loans.use: to use as additional capital and purchase raw materials for the cafeteria.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
As a woman who went as far as junior high school, Abena sells fabrics, body creams, and jewelry in Abura, near Cape Coast. She is married to a petty trader and has three children. 

Abena has been working in her business for six years. The proceeds from her business normally goes toward helping her husband pay for the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. 

Abena's loan will be used to purchase an increased amount of fabrics, body creams, and jewelry to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to set up her own shop and to increase her capital base.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of fabrics, body creams, and jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz María es una trabajadora independiente que ha ejercido la profesión de cría de pollos y comercialización de huevos por más de 20 años con la que pudo levantar un hogar y alimentar sus hijos, es una persona humilde pero debido a su condición de pobreza no pudo acceder a una buena educación por lo que se atoro estos 20 años en un mismo ciclo y flujo de venta de productos nos e daba la oportunidad de progresar pues tiene todas las herramientas necesarias para fortalecer su negocio como la experiencia, las ganas y sobretodo los clientes. Solicita un crédito para la compra de concentrado para el engorde de sus pollos pues su precio se ha disparo y no tiene como alimentarlos su gran sueño es poder constituir un criadero de pollos más grande que pueda tener un flujo de venta alto y realizar reformas locativas y a su hogar
texts.en: Luz María is an independent and hard-worker who has been raising chickens and selling their eggs for more than 20 years.  She was able to build a home and raise her children from this income.  She is a humble person but due to her poor economic condition she was not able to pursue a good education and thus she has spent the last 20 years in the same cycle of selling products.  She is looking to progress since she has all the tools necessary to strengthen her business such as experience, desire and above all customers.  She is asking for a loan in order to purchase feed that will fatten her chickens because the cost of feed has increased dramatically and she doesn't have enough feed.  Her great dream is to be able to build a larger chicken coop so that she can have a higher volume of sales and be able to make better changes to her home.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her chickens because due to higher feed costs she cannot buy all of the food she needs to feed her animals.

loans.name: Mark's Group

texts.en: Mark is 28 years old and married. She is farmer who does rice cropping as the main business and catch fish for resale as supplementary source of income. This is not the first loan for Mark with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid back her past loan completely and now her living condition is getting better than before. Now, she leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy rice seed. She hopes that she can buy a good seed for replanting so as she can make more income better than before.

loans.use: To buy rice seed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To boost up the business.

loans.name: Elnara

texts.en: Elnara is a resident of Sumgayit. She is 29 years old and lives with her family and her five-year-old child in Sumgayit city. She rents a shop where she sells food products. Her business is quite new, having started it one year ago. Elnara is applying for a loan to increase the variety of goods in her store as well as to purchase scales for use in her shop.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods and to purchase scales

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa has 2 years' experience with her restaurant business. She used to have a store that she had to close due to health problems. On her own initiative, she decided to start selling snacks. Her business started growing and now she also sells lunches, and during the weekends she sells “Encebollados”, a traditional dish. She works every day from 6 a.m. to 3 p.m. and the weekends from 6 a.m. to 12 p.m. Her daughter helps serving the clients and her husband helps during his free time.

Rosa wants to use the loan to buy more plastic tables and chairs for her business, the ones that she has at the moment are not enough due to the demand that her food is having.

Rosa is married. She is 47 years old and she has 4 children. Only one of her children is still with her because she is still in school; and one of the married daughters helps her with the business. Her husband works as a painter and as a driver; he helps with restaurant during his free time especially over the weekends. Rosa’s wish is to be able to own a small house, since they are renting where they live now.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa tiene una experiencia de 2 años con su negocio de venta de comida. Ella tenía una tienda la que tuvo que cerrar por problemas de salud. Por iniciativa propia decide comenzar a vender almuerzos. Su negocio fue creciendo que al momento también vende meriendas y los fines de semana encebollados. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 6 a.m. hasta las 3 p.m. y los fines de semana hasta las 12 p.m. Su hija le ayuda con la atención de los clientes y también su esposo cuando esta libre.

Rosa desea el crédito para poder comprar mas sillas y mesas plásticas para su negocio por que con las, que cuenta por momentos no le abastecen por la demanda que tiene de comida

.

Rosa es casada. Tiene 47 años y 4 hijos de los cuales solo una esta con ella ya que todavía estudia. Una de las casadas es la que le ayuda en la atención de su negocio. Su esposo también trabaja de pintor y de chofer. En sus ratos libres sobre todo los fines de semana le ayuda con el negocio. Su deseo es poder tener su casita propia ya que actualmente vive arrendando.

loans.use: Buy tables and chairs for her restaurant

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia has been selling cosmetics for over three years. She is married and has two little daughters. They were recently able to buy their own house. However, mortgage payments are withdrawn from her husband's salary and Claudia's family economy has suffered. This is why Claudia started this business. She started selling products amongst acquaintances and family members and little by little her number of clients has been incrementing and her business has grown.

Claudia needs a US$100.00 loan which she will use to buy more merchandise to be able to provide the products that her clients have requested. She wants to provide a good service in order to maintain her clients preference. She is committed to repay this loan within three months. Your help will be able to better this family's life. They appreciate and thank your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Translator.

Hace más de tres años Claudia se dedica a las ventas de cosméticos, ella es casada y tiene dos pequeñas hijas, recientemente pudieron adquirir su propia casa, pero los pagos hipotecarios son rebajados del salario de su esposo, razón por la que la economía familiar se vio afectada, ante esta necesidad Claudia empezó su negocio, inició sus ventas entre conocidos y familiares pero poco a poco ha incrementado su número de clientes y ha hecho crecer su negocio.

Claudia necesita un préstamo por $ 100 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder surtir los productos que le han solicitado sus clientes, ella quiere ofrecer un buen servicio para continuar con la preferencia de sus clientes y se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Con tu ayuda podrás mejorar la vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Sixto Hernandez

texts.es:
My name is Sixto Hernandez. My principal work is in commerce in a store located in the transport terminal of my city. I have several years of experience in dedicating myself to this type of work. It generates income for me to cover the expenses of my family and my commitments to suppliers. I have a very good clientele and the location of my business is strategic. For that reason, I need to supply a bit more to be able to offer a variety of products to my clients.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

Mi nombre es Sicto Hernandez, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una pulperia ubicada en la terminal de transporte de mi ciudad. tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio, el que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia y demas compromisos con los proveedores, tengo muy buena clientela ya que la ubicación de mi negocio es estrategica, por lo que necesito surtir un poco mas para poder ofrecer variedad de productos a los clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, butter, rice, flour, toilet tissue, soap, sausages, cold meats, and other dairy products.

loans.name: Eam

texts.en: Mrs. Eam O. is 27 years old and a mother of three young children. She lives with her husband and her mother (pictured in the photograph) in Batambong province, Cambodia. To support her family, she runs a small booth selling fruit at an open-air market, where she typically earns around US$4 a day in revenue, while her husband works as a construction foreman, making about US$3 a day. Mrs. Eam O. is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to expand the fruit inventory in response to the growing customer demand.

loans.use: Purchase of fruit for inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in clothes and other items for the holiday season

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en: I am Rubina R. from Lahore, a big metropolis in Pakistan. I am 38, married and a mother of seven. I make plastic flowers on daily wages, and my husband is a carpenter. Last year we took a loan to buy an electric saw for our business, which turned into greater efficiency. But this time I require a loan to start my own business of plastic flowers. I am sure the business will do well because I have enough skill and experience in it.

loans.use: start flower-making business

loans.name: Etibar

texts.en: Etibar is an Internally Displaced Person and was forced to flee his native region of Gubadli as a result of conflict between Azerbaijan and Armenia. He lives now in Sumgait town. His family, which consists of his wife and 3 children support him in his entrepreneurial activities. His business has to do with women's clothing, which he sells at a local marketplace. Etibar applied to Sumgait branch of Normicro for the first time and he needs $600 to increase his business turnover. He wants to take the loan for 12 months.

loans.use: To buy new goods for sale

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Meet 36 year-old Salama A.. She is married with four children, aged 3, 7, 8, and 10.

In 2007 Salama established a general store. She now requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. Salama thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her general store.

loans.name: Erlinda's Group

texts.es:
Erlinda, Estilista y Sarita have been members of the Sonrisa (Smile) Community Bank for three, three, and four months respectively.

Erlinda, a 30 year old woman, shares her home with her four children. She works producing artisian bricks in her small town of Huayllapampa. Additionally Erlinda buys and sells pigs.

Estilista is a 42 year old woman with three children. Estilista rents a small sewing shop in which she produces clothing.

Sarita is a 31 year old married woman with two children. She sells clothing by contract to her family and friends. She also sells wines brought from Ica in stores and the markets.

Erlinda, Estilista and Satira need a loan of S./ 1,600 ($560), S./400 ($150), and S./600 ($215) respectively. These funds will be invested in the purchase of sand, tools, paint, and wine.

The dreams of Erlinda, Estilista and Sarita are to have a larger shop, to provide for their children to attend college and to purchase a piece of land.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Erlinda, Estilista y Sarita pertenecen al Banco Comunal Sonrisa hace 3años, 3 años, 4 meses respectivamente.

Erlinda es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 4 hijos, Erlinda se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales en su pueblo de Huayllapampa. Además Erlinda compra y vende Tara, cochinilla.

Por otro lado Estilista es casada, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, Estilista tiene su taller de confección de prendas de vestir, en un local alquilado.

Mientras que Sarita es casada, tiene 31 y 2 hijos, Sarita vende ropa a pedido a sus amigos y familiares. Además Sarita vende vinos que son traídos de Ica, sus ventas lo realiza en tiendas y mercados.

Erlinda, Estilista y Sarita necesitan préstamos de 1600 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arena, herramientas, pinturas y vinos.
