Los sueños de Erlinda, Estilista y Sarita son tener un taller más grande, que sus hijos estudien en la universidad y comprar un terreno.

loans.use: Erlinda, Estilista and Satira need a loan of S./ 1,600 ($560), S./400 ($150), and S./600 ($215) respectively.  These funds will be invested in the purchase of sand, tools, paint, and wine.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is forty-five years old and she is a married woman with five children. All her children are in school. She sells foodstuffs like cassava, plantain, fresh yams, palm nuts, etc in her village in the eastern region. Janet buys the farm produce from a neighboring village and retails them in Koforidua.

She wants to use a new loan to buy more foodstuffs to expand her operation so that she raises enough income to support her children’s education. She is a member of the group called “Eye Nyame” (meaning "It is God"). Members exert peer pressure on themselves as social collateral to repay the loan.

Janet’s photo was taken at the group’s meeting.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs like cassava, plantain, fresh tubers of yam

loans.name: Šefika

texts.en: Šefika is a 47 years old woman from Ribnica, a small village near the town of Zavidovići. Her huband is working as a woodsman.  Šefika is currently doing vegetable greenhouse production and she also has a few cows. She sells milk to the dairy and milk products at the village. They have 5 children. This is her first loan at MCO WWI.  Šefika intends to use this loan to expand the greenhouse and to expand the vegetable assortment that she sells. By doing this she will improve standard of life for her family.

loans.use: To expand her greenhouse.

loans.name: Cruz Freddy

texts.es:
Mr. Cruz G. is a hard working gentleman that dedicates himself to cattle raising in the municipality of El Sauce in the city of Leon. He dedicates himself to this business with the goal of supporting his three children who are currently of school age.

The necessity that Mr. Cruz is currently faced with is the need to purchase pregnant cows. This is why he is seeking the support of Ceprodel with the goal of being the beneficiary of a loan that will allow him to purchase the cows so that he can sell them and continue to support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Cruz G. es un caballero muy trabajador que se dedica al negocio de la ganadería en el municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León. Se dedica a este negocio con el propósito de mantener a sus tres hijos que actualmente se encuentran en edades escolares.

La necesidad que hoy en día atraviesa el caballero Cruz es que necesita la compra de vacas en estado de preñez. Por eso es que sin duda busca el apoyo en Ceprodel con el propósito de ser beneficiado con un crédito que se permita la compra de las vacas para comercializarlas en su sector y así continuar con el mantenimiento de su familia

loans.use: Purchase of pregnant cows.

loans.name: Lamp Fall Couture Group

texts.fr:
Lamp Fall couture specializes in men’s, women’s, and children’s clothing.  It makes ready-to-wear clothing and also custom-made clothing.  The fight against under-employment creates other difficulties, such as illegal immigration and juvenile delinquency.  It is to avoid these problems that the group invested itself in this business.  We are asking for a loan from Kiva that will allow us to purchase a variety of fabrics (bazin, batik, linen, Givenchy), which we will tailor and sell in fairs or according to orders.  

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva volunteer. 

Lamp Fall couture est spécialisé dans la couture hommes, dames et enfants. Il fait du prêt à porter et de la couture sur mesure. C’est pour lutter contre le sous-emploi qui crée d’autres difficultés comme l’immigration clandestine, la délinquance juvénile que le groupement s'est investi dans cette activité. Nous sollicitons un prêt de kiva qui nous permettra d'acheter beaucoup de variétés de tissus (bazin, batik, lin, Givenchy) que nous allons coudre et vendre par exposition ou selon les commandes qui ne seront faites

loans.use: Purchase materials (fabrics) to tailor and sell

loans.name: Hilda Luz

texts.es:
Hilda Luz is married and is 34 years old. She studied to be a primary school teacher at the Instituto San Marcos in the city of Trujillo. She doesn't practice her profession because she is pregnant and she also needs to get her license. She has 2 children who are currently attending grade school. She lives in the District La Esperanza in the province of Trujillo in the La Libertad quarter.

She used to work in the Nazaret market and she used to help her older sister sell television sets, blenders etc. But the owner wanted to work alone and 2 years ago she changed the business. She runs a jewelry business and finds that there is more demand and it has been going very well. Her mother-in-law encouraged her to become a member in the Nueva Esperanza community bank, as she wanted to invest more money. She decided to start up with Manuela Ramos and with her first loan, amounting to 300 S/., she purchased earrings, necklaces, and rings etc.

This small business owner dreams of one day have a large jewelry store.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Hilda Luz, está casada, tiene 34 años, estudió la carrera de Educación Primaria en el Instituto San Marcos en la ciudad de Trujillo, no ejerce su profesión porque quedó embarazada, además le falta sacar el titulo, tiene 02 hijos, son estudiantes del nivel primario, vive en el Distrito de La Esperanza en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad. Antes trabajaba en el mercado Nazaret como ambulante, ayudaba a su hermana mayor a vender televisores, licuadoras, etc., pero como la socia quería independizarse, hace 02 años cambió de negocio y como le gusta el negocio de los aretes, porque es más rentable, además le va bien. Su cuñada la animó a participar en el Banco Comunal “NUEVA ESPERANZA II” y como quería invertir un poco más, decidió trabajar con Manuela Ramos y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibió compró aretes, collares, sortijas, ganchos, etc. Con este préstamo de S/. 1200.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 04 meses, tiene pensado invertir este dinero en la compra de ganchos, aretes, joyas, etc. En el Banco Comunal al que pertenece tiene el cargo de presidenta. La empresaria sueña con tener una joyería grande.

loans.use: To purchase jewelry

loans.name: Mrs. Long Sinith Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nineteen people in Preak Ta Ten Village in Kandal Province are members of the Village Bank loan, and they plan to use the loan for a variety of purposes. Mrs. Long S., the Village Bank President and a vegetable farmer, is a 54-year-old widow with two children who are employed in a garment factory. Long’s plantation field is currently infertile; in order to solve this problem, she is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers to support her field as well as more pesticides to kill a variety of crop-threatening insects. 

Mrs. Mann N. is represented in the picture by her husband.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to support her field and more pesticides to kill a variety of crop-threatening insects.

loans.name: Anna M.

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 34-year-old Anna M. K. from Tukuyu. She is married with four children, between the ages of 4 and 15. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependant whose parents cannot afford to send her to school. Anna has been running a banana shop since 2000. Her business is selling bananas in batches. She works at the business for 8 hours per day, 7 days per week, and currently earns about 120 USD from her business per month. She is requesting a loan of 325 USD in order to buy at wholesale price from farmers and to re-sell to business people from Dar es salaam. In the future, she plans to sell by going to Dar es salaam herself. Anna thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy bananas at wholesale price from farmers to resell to business people from Dar es salaam.

loans.name: Francisca Elena

texts.en:
Francisca is a member of the Paloma (“Dove”) Village Bank. She is 42 years old and married with five children. Francisca has a store in her home, located in the Artesanos neighborhood, where she sells dry goods, vegetables, chicken and condiments with the help of her husband. Francisca also works as a nurse technician at a local hospital. Francisca needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy rice and sugar. Francisca’s dreams are to have a bulk goods store and for her children to finish school.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Francisca es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma. Francisca es casada, tiene 42 años y 5 hijos, Francisca tiene una tienda en su casa ubicada en la Asoc. Artesanos en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, pollo, condimentos, actividad que realiza con el apoyo de su esposo. Además Francisca trabaja en el hospital como técnica en enfermería. Francisca necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar. Los sueños de Francisca son tener una tienda de venta por mayor y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Rahmonberdi

texts.en: I. Rahmonberdi is 51 years old. He is married with two grown children. Rahmonberdi is a farmer. He has been working in agriculture for 20 years, and in that time has gained much experience and a love for the land. He began cultivating his land through his own efforts and has gradually gotten ahead in life. He has been producing such crops as potatoes, onions, carrots and other vegetables. Each year he produces enough to feed his family and to support his vegetable business.  The business is the family's main source of income. In order to generate a stable income, the business requires considerable funding. Today he is asking for a loan of 1000 Somoni ($300 USD). Rahmonberdi would like to use this loan to buy supplies for the harvest and for improving production.  This will allow him to increase the quality of his yield, along with his earnings at the time of sale. The loan will be repaid in 7 months. Rahmonberdi and his family are counting on your help. He thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan in time.

loans.use: Purchasing mineral fertilizer and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Thol

texts.en: Mrs. Thol H. was born in 1972 and she now lives in Beong Veng village in Kampong Cham province. She is a widow with one child who is attending the local school. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she now faces a small problem because her field is infertile which has a bad effect on her crop. To solve this problem, Mrs. Thol H. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to produce a better crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to produce a better crop

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.es:
Bernarda empezó su negocio para poder sacar su primer préstamo. Es viuda, y antes no trabajaba por que vivía de su jubilación. Sus hijos mayores le envían dinero para su manutención, al igual que su pareja

Su negocio es la cría y venta de pollos y patos, que ella va repartiendo a domicilio en Chosica y Chaclacayo. Además de esto ella se dedica a lavar  ropa. 

A sus sesenta años Bernarda lleva diez años realizando estas labores, pero dice que lo hace porque le gusta, especialmente la cría de animales. Sus planes del futuro son seguir trabajando en lo que hace.
texts.en:
Bernarda began her business in order to be able to take out her first loan. She is widowed and was not previously working because she was retired. Her adult children send her money to take care of her, as does her partner. Her business is raising and selling chickens and ducks which she sells door-to-door in Chosica and Chaclacayo. Besides this she works washing clothes. In her sixites, Bernarda has spent ten years doing these jobs, but she says that she does it because she enjoys it, especially raising animals. Her plans for the future are to keep working at what she does.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Animal feed

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es:
María se dedica a la venta de ceviche desde un puestito que tiene justo en la puerta de su casa desde hace cinco años, pero recién empezó a recibir préstamos de EDAPROSPO, hace  unos meses. 
Anteriormente tenía un puestito en el mercado donde vendía ceviche y otros platos criollos durante cinco años, pero cayó enferma y tuvo que dejar este trabajo.
No obstante, hace cuatro años empezó a dedicarse también a otro trabajo: ser Distribuidora Independiente de Omnilife. En este negocio su padre fue el primero que empezó, y como le iba bien poco a poco casi toda la familia se juntó a la empresa.
Ahora, a sus cuarenta y cinco años le parece que dedicarse 100% a Omnilife sería su mejor opción en el futuro.
texts.en:
María is dedicated to selling ceviche from a little stand that she has just inside the door of her hourse. She has been doing this business for five years but has recently started receiving loans from EDAPROSPO since a few months ago.

Previously she had a little stand in the market where she sold ceviche and other native dishes, but she became sick and had to leave this job.

Nevertheless, four years ago she began to work at another job as an independent distributor of Omnilife. In this business, her father was the one to start in it, and since it has been going well for him, little by little the whole family joined the business.

Now at age 45, it looks as though dedicating herself 100% to Omnilife will be the best option for the future.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in ingredients for her business - ceviche sales

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah O. is a 24-year-old father of two children aged 3 and 1 and a half. He repairs bicycles and when he can afford it sells spare parts. He is looking for a loan because he currently cannot afford the spare parts needed to repair bikes. He wishes that borrowers could come see where he lives.

Jonah recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW he will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of his community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. His work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin-enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: spare parts for bikes

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas 2 Group

texts.en:
Mujeres Unidas in Spanish means "united women," and unity has been key to the success of this group of five. They have successfully received and paid back seven loans with Esperanza International. This will be their 8th loan.

Magalis C. is the group representative. She has 3 young children ages 10, 8 and 3. She has a "fantasia," which is a small store where you can buy accessories, personal care products, and school supplies. Magalis plans to add undergarments to her inventory, and will purchase the new products with this loan. Two other members of the group own grocery stores, and the other two run a poultry stand and a fruit stand.

The business stability they've experienced after taking out loans is, in their words, "incomparable" to their situation beforehand. Despite a worse economy, they feel more at ease and are confident that their hard work will pay off and they will continue to proviD. faithfully for their families. Please help us to continue supporting these entrepreneurs. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase new undergarments inventory to sell in store.

loans.name: Ursulo

texts.en:
Ursulo G. manages a small sari-sari (general) store. He is married and has three children. He wants to grow his business to supply their needs. He works also as a vegetable vendor. He goes out in the streets and sells cabbages, squash, and beans.

Ursulo wanted a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy a new refrigerator for storage of his merchandise. He wants to include selling beverages like Coke and Pepsi in the future. A refrigerator will truly be a help to realize his plans.


CEVI is a non-profit organization and a partner of WorldVision Philippines. CEVI gives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy a commercial refrigerator for use in his sari-sari store

loans.name: Tith

texts.en:
Mrs. C. is 48 years old and a resident of Pursat Province, where she has owned a plot of land since 1979. She grows rice crops, which she plants twice a year. She is a good mother of two children. Both children are single and attend school. Her husband works with her in planting rice.

The family works hard at their business activities every day and never wastes time. Rice growing is the family's main source of income to pay their living expenses and maintain stability and sustenance. Mrs. C. will use the loan to purchase a plot of land to grow crops.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land to grow crops.

loans.name: Kiganda Central Asimwe Sarah Group

texts.en: A. Sarah is 30 years of age, and the single mother of two children, both schooling. She has operated a restaurant, cooking food, for over six years now. She is using the loan to purchase food for her restaurant like bananas, maize flour, millet flour, meat, chicken, milk, drinks, etc. She serves her community and most especially the travelers who check in for the meals. Her dream is to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase food for her restaurant

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Mrs. Julieta E., 46 years old, lives at Capocao Proper, Ozamiz City. She has five children, three of whom are working. The other two are fully dependent and live together with her and her husband. She started her business in 2000 with her own capital. The customers, for her business, are from her neighborhood. Her business maintains good sales up to the present. The meager income supports their daily needs. She wants to take a loan from Paglaum in the amount of PHP 10,000 as additional capital for her sari-sari store. 

And now she wants to develop her business with the help of KIVA financing through Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: Additional capital for her  Sari-sari store.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is 24 years old. She is single and mother to one child who is still breastfeeding. The child's father refused and denied responsibility for the child. She works very hard to take care of her child. She prepares and sells food, such as fried yam and fried ripe plantain, in the community market. She has been in the food production area for three years now. She requests loan support to buy more yams, plantains, vegetables, etc. to prepare the food. She believes that she can save more to provide health care for her child. She also plans to continue her education after her child starts schooling. She has completed senior high school and wants to enter college by next academic year. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy yam and plantain.

loans.name: Lila

texts.es: Lila tiene 51 años, es natural de la ciudad de Piura, al norte de Perú. Llegó a Lima en busca de un mejor porvenir, ahora vive y trabaja junto a su hermana en la venta de productos de belleza. Siendo soltera y sin hijos siempre se ha dedicado a trabajar muy duro, dedicándole todo su tiempo a ello. Sale desde tempranas horas de la mañana a ofrecer los cosméticos de casa en casa de sus vecinas y a cualquier lugar donde tenga oportunidad de venta. A Lila siempre le ha gustado su trabajo, ya que le gusta interactuar con la gente, pues es una persona muy carismática. Ella piensa en grande y quiere progresar, al igual que su hermana, quien es su mano derecha y a quien encontramos en su casa (en la foto) ofreciendo la mercadería de Lila, que generalmente no se le encuentra en casa por las constantes visitas que realiza para ofrecer y cobrar el pago de sus productos. En un futuro cercano, Lila quiere tener un bazar grande donde exhiba toda su mercadería y no tener que salir tanto de casa. Ella es una clienta muy antigua de MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos, además le gusta el trabajo en su banco comunal porque entre todas sus compañeras son muy buenas amigas. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de productos de belleza para tener en stock, para que tanto ella y su hermana puedan seguir obteniendo buenos ingresos a través de este negocio.
texts.en:
Lila is 51 years of age and comes from the city of Piura in northern Peru. She arrived in Lima in search of a better future. Now she lives and works, along with her sister, selling beauty products. As she is single and has no children, she has always been a hard worker and dedicates most of her time to that. She goes out in the early morning hours from house to house and offers her cosmetic products wherever it is possible to sell them. Lila has always enjoyed her work and she likes to interact with people because she is very charismatic. She has high hopes and she wants to get ahead, just like her sister who is her "right hand" and who we see in her home (in the photo) displaying Lila's merchandise. But usually they are not at home because of the constant trips they are making to in order to take orders and collect payments for their products. In the near future, Lila wants to have a large store where she can display her merchandise and not have to go out all the time. She is a long-standing client of Microfinanzas PRISMA and has always been very punctual in all her payments. She also enjoys working with the communal bank because she and all of her partners are such good friends. The money that she is requesting will be used to buy a larger quantity of beauty products to have on hand so that she and her sister will be able to continue receiving a good income through this business.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela P. is currently in the business of selling beer and alcohol at her bar and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell. Manuela is 29 years old and is married with a husband that is a builder. She has 2 children and her children go to school.

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Maria Azucena

texts.es: Maria Azucena Z. M. tiene 43 años. Es cliente de Fundación León 2000 es casada y junto a su pareja tiene 1 hijo que estudia con el esfuerzo de ambos. Conocedora de esta actividad que es muy común como es el destace de cerdo y la venta de nacatamales. Desde hace mas de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de gallinas, pero siempre tenía problemas porque tenía que viajar a lugares muy distantes para ofrecer sus productos ya que esto le resultaba muy cansado y difícilmente podía continuar de esta manera. Y por su hermana decide vender cerdos y  al notar que tenía muy buenas ganancias decide seguir adelante. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdos y ciertos productos necesarios para la elaboración de sus nacatamales. Su mayor sueño es que su hijo tenga la oportunidad de estudio que ella no pudo tener.
texts.en:
Maria Azucena Z. M. is 43. She is a client of Fundación León 2000, is married, and has one son who goes to school through the efforts of her and her husband. She is an expert at a common activity, which is butchering pigs and selling tamales. She has had this business for more than 6 years. She used to sell chickens, but she always had problems because she had to travel to far-away places to sell her products, which was very tiring, and it was difficult to continue on like that. Because of her sister, she decided to sell pigs. When she noticed she made very good profits, she decided to continue doing this. The financing she is requesting is for working capital to buy pigs and products she needs to make her tamales. Her biggest dream is that her son has the opportunity to study that she wasn't able to have.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nogaye

texts.fr: Nogaye  N. est une dame de 57 ans, mariée et mère de 10 enfants. Elle fait de l’embauche ovineet en même temps vend des mangues et des légumes. Son objectif est de renforcer son activité et de subvenir aux besoins sanitaires et scolaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Nogaye N. is a 57-year-old woman, married, and the mother of ten children.  Her work involves fattening sheep and, at the same time, selling mangoes and vegetables.  Her goal is to bolster her business and to provide for her children's health care and education. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For fattening sheep and for commerce in vegetables and mangoes

loans.name: Wasuk

texts.en: Wasuk A. is currently in the business of selling local alcohol at home and is requesting a loan to purchase more brewing materials.  Wasuk is 32 years old and is Married with a husband that is a peasant. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar at the nearby market BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more brewing materials

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin G. who lives in the town of Pulupandan, Negros Occidental, is 58 years old and married to Felizardo G. who helps her in running their business.  They are blessed with nine children who are between 13 and 37 years old. Some of the older children have already graduated from college and have their own families. Jasmin now has nine children, but even when they have their own families, her older children still help support the family. 

Jasmin started her business by selling bananas in their community and other neighboring villages. During that time, she admitted that her business did not fare so well because sometimes she hardly saved or gained extra income due to the needs of her children and family. But when NWTF-Project Dungganon opened in their area, her husband encouraged her to join. In the year 1998, she was able to join and become a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon. When she received her first loan, she invested it as additional capital for her business. After a while, she decided to buy other kinds of fruit so that she could sell not just bananas to her regular customers. With that decision, she expanded her business using her loans as capital, and her business improved a lot. From banana and fruit vending, now she has a permanent place in the Pulupandan market for her general store. She also sells fruits and vegetables. Her business ventures earn a minimum of Php 15,000 per month and some portion of this income is recycled back into the business and used as additional capital, for the education of her younger children, and to pay for their household expenses. All the extra income is saved in the bank for future use. 

For her previous loan, she borrowed Php 10,000 to use as additional working capital for her business. The loan was as usual, fully paid on time without any delays, maintaining Jasmin's good credit record at NWTF-Project Dungganon. For now, she is borrowing Php 15,000 to purchase additional products for her general store and for her fruit and vegetable business.

Her next plan is to improve her general store and buy some additional products to sell in their community. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase fruits & vegetables and additional products to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en:
Mrs. Ahlam, aged 49, is the mother of four children. Her children are all already independent. Ahlam sells provisions in her grocery store. She now has a well-established clientele because of the personalized attention and the good variety of products she offers her customers.

Mrs. Ahlam is requesting the loan to buy merchandise such as sweet bread, beverages in general, rice, pasta, vegetables, fruit, etc. Please help her by financing this loan. Thank you!

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Canal De Bendicion 1-3 Group

texts.en:
Marcelo, 74, is a borrower who lives near La Romana, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, “Canal De Bendicion” (Channel of Blessing), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Marcelo runs a successful small business selling new clothing to her friends and neighbors. The most common form of clothing sales in the Dominican Republic is used clothing, usually from the U.S., but Marcelo has differentiated her business by only selling the newest styles. With this loan, her fourth with Esperanza International, she hopes to continue investing in her business, continually expanding her items offered and keeping up with the latest trends.

Life in La Romana can be harsh – electricity is scarce if available at all, running water is never potable, and the hurricanes that rip through the Caribbean typically hit this side of the island first. Despite these difficulties, Marcelo keeps a positive attitude toward her business. She hopes to continually grow her business, and she is very grateful for the support given to her by Esperanza. Thank you for lending to Marcelo and the Canal de Bendicion group!

loans.use: To purchase new clothing

loans.name: Koeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Koeun H., 53 and her husband, Mr. Son Sut, 69, got married in 1978 and have 8 children: 6 sons and 2 daughters. Three of them are married and live outside the family home; one is a garment factory worker and three others attend school. They are living on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. Her husband is a farmer.

Koeun has been a silk weaver for 40 years. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. She is requesting a loan of US$ 600 to purchase silk materials for her silk weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her silk weaving business

loans.name: Hilda Luz

texts.es:
La señora HILDA LUZ R. B. tiene 35 años, vive en el distrito De La Esperanza , provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad – Perú y pertenece al Banco Comunal Nueva Esperanza. 
La socia presenta estudios superiores de educación primaria pero refiere que no ejerce por falta de vacantes en los colegios nacionales;es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella. 
Hilda se dedica a la venta de aretes, colects, pulseras, pilimiles, juguetes,etc. de forma ambulatoria en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Trujillo.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles comprò aretes, juguetes, pulseras, colects y aumentò su mercaderìa.
Ella solicitarà un crédito de 1,500.00 nuevos soles con los que comprará juguetes para niñas y niños por campaña navideña. 
Ella sueña con alquilar un stand en un mercado donde pueda vender màs tranquila su mercaderìa.
texts.en:
Sra. Hilda Luz R. B. is 35 years old, lives in the Esperanza district in the Trujillo province, in the La Libertad department in Peru. She belongs to the New Hope Community Bank. She has completed primary education but did not progress because of the lack of spots in the national colleges. She lives with another and has two children who depend on her economically. Hilda is dedicated to the sale of earrings, bracelets, toys and other goods in the different markets in the city of Trujillo. WIth her first credit of $125, she bought earrings, bracelets, toys and other goods to increase her stock of goods. She is requesting a credit of $525 with which she will buy toys for girls and boys for the Christmas holidays. Her dream is to lease a stand in a market where she will be able to sell her goods more tranquilly.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of toys

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
El Sr. Gregorio nació en la Paz el 09 de mayo de 1954 actualmente hace 18 años que vive en la Pampa el Coscal el señor es viudo vive con sus hijos.
Su actividad principal es la agricultura produce papa, maíz y maní, para despues comercializar sus productos en el mercado de la zona. El cliente esta agradecido con la institución por el financiamiento.
texts.en:
Sr. Gregorio was born in La Paz on May 9, 1954. He has been living on the plain of El Coscal for the past 18 years. Gregorio is a widower who lives with his children. He is a farmer who grows potatoes, corn, and peanuts and sells his products at the local market.

Gregorio thanks the Institution for providing him with financing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for his farm

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: Sabina, 50 years old, is involved in rice farming. She lives in a town in Agusan Del Sur. She is married and has an 18-year-old child. Currently, she owns a one-hectare rice field. She also tills two hectares, which were pawned to her. She joined CEVI in September 2009 to take advantage of its financial services. She said she likes its programs, especially the low interest rate that is offered. She is now requesting a loan of PHP8,000, which will be used for farm inputs like seeds, fertilizers and others.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Movlud

texts.en: Movlud I. was born in 1969. He is married and has four children. I.'s family live in the Khachmaz region. He is a dressmaker and has been in this business for five years. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Thérèse

texts.fr: Thérèse N. est une femme de 64 ans, elle est veuve et vit avec ses trois petits fils. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de WANGO dont elle est la secrétaire depuis 12 ans et demi. Elle a une très bonne expérience en matière de crédit et dans son domaine d'activité. elle fait la transformation et vente de bouillie de mil. Son objectif est de payer la formation professionnelle d'un de ses petits fils et de subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Thérèse N. is a 64-year-old widow who lives with her three grandsons. She has been a member of the Wango Village Bank, where she is the secretary, for 12 ½ years. She has a lot of experience with loans as well as her own business. She makes and sells millet porridge. Her goal is to pay for the professional education of one of her grandsons and to take care of his personal needs.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To further bolster her business

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida M., 57, is married to Yolemundo Mendes, a laborer/ collector, and they are blessed with five children. She makes sure that her family has enough provision for their daily needs and helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. Leonida is involved in direct selling of popular brand products.
Leonida has been a regular member of Kiva partner, Center for Community Transformation (CCT), for more than a year now. She regularly attends the weekly fellowship meeting* and pays her weekly dues consistently. As she has a good repayment record with her previous loans, she is able to borrow ten times more from CCT's Cooperative. She has been consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her business.
Now, with your help, she would like to apply for a loan of 19,000 PHP. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business, enabling her to make advance orders on her direct-selling lines. Leonida dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can give her family a prosperous life.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To make advance orders on her direct-selling lines

loans.name: King Of Kings Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
The lady in the small photo at the top left of the group photo is N. Daisy as she also appears in the big group photo. 

Daisy is a youthful, energetic and cheerful married mother of one. Like most other Ugandan women, she is blazing her own business trails in Nyenga Buziika in Lugazi.

Daisy’s one-year-old video library business earns her roughly 190,000 Ugandan shillings a month. She, however, has to bear the increasingly competitive nature of her business as more people take root. Her business, she contends, drives a good bargain in a way because of the low prices she charges her clients.

To get a competitive edge in this increasingly competitive cutthroat business, Daisy is seeking a loan of 500,000 shillings to be able to develop her business even further. She hopes to buy more CDs, DVDs, and a computer to invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more CDs, DVDs and a computer for her business

loans.name: Germie

texts.en: Germie has two kids with her husband, Reynaldo. She is 47 years old and lives in Panglao, Bohol with her family. She has a Starex van that she rents to tourists who come to visit her town for a tour. She hopes her business will grow. She said that she’s also thankful because CEVI has trusted her with her loans. She is now applying for a loan of 20,000 PHP. She will use this loan to buy new tires and maintain her van.

loans.use: To buy new tires and for maintenance

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 40 years old and married with six children between the ages of 23 and 1½ years. She sells secondhand clothes to earn a living.  She has   fourteen years of experience and she says that she has many customers due to that experience and to her good customer care skills.  She also rents out her residential houses to earn enough money to support her family and educate her children.  Her wish is to see her children go through college and become professionals.  

Gladys has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Faulu Kenya to buy secondhand duvets for sale. She hopes to grow her business and to build permanent houses to rent in the future.

loans.use: To add a stock of duvets to sell.

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en:
Despite being old, 76-year-old Inocencia D. and her 77-year-old husband are still working hard in a business to survive poverty. Through a loan from ASHI, Inocencia has been able to put up a small eatery. She and her husband are responsible for managing the business. The proceeds are used to support their daily needs, weekly payments to ASHI and their monthly bills. 

Inocencia really wants to grow her business by requesting additional capital through a loan. She wanted to increase the profit of her business to have extra money to support her grandchildren from her three children. Her children are hired laborers and earn a small amount of money. Inocencia also wants to support a small farming business for her eldest 27-year-old child who is presently unemployed. 

Despite being poor, Inocencia and her husband still hope that through the proceeds of the business they are growing, the lifestyle of her children at least will be improved.

loans.use: To purchase cooking ingredients and farm inputs

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 58 years old, married, and has 5 children aged 24-32, one of whom is still attending school.  He is a farmer from Kisii town in Western Kenya. He is also a retired teacher, and is still enjoying the benefits of his pension. For the past 11 years, Isaac has been producing maize, beans, bananas and milk, which he sells to the local market. His main challenges in farming are the unpredictable weather conditions, lack of enough water and proper veterinary services.

Isaac has requested a loan of KES 70,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. The income generated by this loan will enable him to better provide for his family and educate his child who is still in school. In the future, he hopes to expand his farming activities by purchasing 2 more dairy cows and increasing his cereal stocks.

He appreciates the help given and appeals for more funds to boost production.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 55 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, y vive en su casa propia junto a  su esposo y  sus 3 hijos.Hace 5 años tuvo que cerrar su ferretería  debido a la excesiva tarifa de los impuestos que no recompensaban sus ventas. En la actualidad  vende a través de pedidos (delivery), de acuerdo al listado prepara la mercadería de materiales (para soluciones del hogar) y los distribuye personalmente. Sus compradores son sus antiguos clientes, quienes la conocen por la calidad de sus productos, y si tiene la oportunidad de captar más compradores no pierde tiempo. Cuando cerro su negocio tuvo mucha nostalgia, pero con esta modalidad de ventas, se siente más cómoda; ya lleva 4 años realizando la comercialización  por pedido. Su mayor anhelo es ampliar su negocio y cuidar de su salud, ya que alguna vez enfermó y se le complicaron las cosas.Este es su octavo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y sabe que el crédito es importante para aumentar el capital de su trabajo, por lo que se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo. Trata de ser muy responsable y colaboradora con su grupo de trabajo. Para más adelante Rosa tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en comprar más artículos  de ferretería, para lograr atender  los pedidos que tiene  pendientes.
texts.en:
Rosa, 55 years old, is a very hard-working mother of a family and she lives in her own house with her husband and their 3 children. Five years ago she had to close her hardware store due to the excessive cost of taxes that didn't allow compensation for her sales. At present, she sells by means of requests (with delivery). Following order lists, she prepares materials for sale (for home solutions) and distributes them personally. Her buyers are her old customers who know her for the quality of her products, and if she has the opportunity to capture more buyers, she loses no time in doing so. When Rosa closed her business she felt much nostalgia, but with this present type of sales, she feels more comfortable. She has now been selling by request for 4 years. Her greatest hope is to expand the business and care for her health, since she once fell ill and it complicated matters. This is the 8th loan Rosa has had with MFP, and she knows that credit is important to augment working capital. For that reason, she is committed to making all her payments on time. Rosa tries to be very responsible and collaborative with her work group. She plans to invest the present loan in purchasing more hardware items to fulfill pending orders.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MATERIALS TO EXPAND MERCHANDISE IN HER HARDWARE BUSINESS

loans.name: Soutien Plus Group

texts.en:
Charlotte N. is the leader of the group named “Soutien Plus” that consists of 24 members firmly united to receive loans from the MFI (micro-finance institution) HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses.

Charlotte is 53 years old. She is a widow and the mother of nine children between the ages of 16 and 37. Charlotte sells corn and manioc flour. She has been in business since 1971.  

After learning through her friend about Hope’s loan program, she decided to join one of its groups in July 2008. Charlotte has already received six loans from Hope that she repaid correctly. 

Currently, her business brings in a profit of $45 per week. With her next loan she is planning to purchase four 35kg sacks of manioc and corn and two cartons of fresh fish to increase the inventory of her business. 

Charlotte’s dream is to be a provider of those products in her area. She runs her business in the western area of Kinshasa.

loans.use: Purchasing four 35kg sacks of manioc and corn and two cartons of fresh fish to increase her inventory

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
24-year-old Mabel A. is from the town of Bunawan. She is married and has a 7-year-old child. Mabel owns and operates a farming business. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She hopes to be able to save for her child's future.

Mabel joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Mabel has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Mabel is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Mabel from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda T. is from the town of Trento. She is 56 years old. Gilda is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Gilda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Gilda has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

Gilda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gilda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Gilda is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Gilda from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Narantsetseg Y. is a 51-year-old woman who lives with her husband and grand-daughter in Huvsgul province of western Mongolia. The family lives together in a ger, a traditional nomadic Mongolian tent. Her three children now have their own homes, while her husband helps with her clothes sales business, as well as running a private car repairing service in their town. 

Narantsetseg operates a clothing business which she began in 1993. She has been able to create a strong customer base, having sustained her business successfully for more than 10 years. She is very careful about her clothes design and quality, in order to attract customers' attention. Because of her hard work and good business sense, Narantsetseg has been able to improve her family’s quality of life and hopes that she can eventually help her grand-daughter's education. 

Narantsetseg is a hard working, creative woman who always hopes to improve her business in the future. She is requesting a 1,400,000 Mongolian Tugrik (MNT) loan in order to purchase a large amount of  clothes and uniforms for the upcoming new academic year.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and uniforms to sell.

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en:
Rudy C. is from the town of Bunawan. He is 56 years old and married with five school-aged children. To make a living, Rudy owns and operates a business venture raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale.

Rudy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rudy has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Rudy is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase seedlings and fertilizers. This will be his sixth loan from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace W. G. is forty years old, single and has one twenty-year-old son. Her business is located at the busy Mwembe Tayari market in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many tourist attractions including the Indian ocean white beaches. 

She has been selling items such as clothes, shoes and handbags to locals for the past ten years. She says that this business is profitable. Her major challenge is the high cost of the space she uses to sell her products. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of Kes 40,000 to buy more clothes and handbags to expand her business. She hopes to grow her business and to have her own business premises. She describes herself as a very outgoing lady!

loans.use: to buy clothes and handbags

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KUKULI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Ruth; ella tiene 35 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de fotocopiadora y venta de productos de belleza en forma independiente, el negocio de fotocopiadora atiende desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar y ampliar la tienda de fotocopiadora y también poder vender los productos de belleza en la tienda. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar papales al por mayor y productos de belleza.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the KuKuli community bank. The bank is located in the Cusco district, in the Cusco province and department.

The member is Ruth. She is 35 years old and is married and has four children. She alternates her daily activities between a photocopy business and selling beauty products independently. She tends to the photocopy business from 7AM until 7PM. The member wishes to improve and expand the photocopy shop and also be able to sell beauty products in the shop. She is requesting the loan to purchase paper at wholesale and beauty products.

She is thankful to those who are part of this dream through this means and promises to make her payments at the established deadlines.

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan to purchase paper at wholesale and beauty products.

loans.name: Purity Wambui

texts.en:
Purity Wambui N. is a 20-year-old single woman who supports her father, mother, and younger sister. They live in Uthiru just a few kilometers from Nairobi. She owns a boutique where she sells clothes. She has been in this business for two years and earns a profit of Kshs.7,500 per month.

Purity has never borrowed from any other MFI and was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend. She is applying for a loan of Kshs. 20,000 to buy more clothes to sell in order to offer a variety of clothes to her customers. She plans to use the profit generated to venture into shoe selling.

In future she hopes to grow her business and open more outlets, and be able to distribute clothes to other sellers.

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes for sale

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine K. lives in the Lubaga neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has five children, four of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her sister’s children). Justine has a retail shop.  She has been in this business for six years, and she works 7 days every week. Justine sells her products in a shop at retail. Justine has requested a loan of 500,000/-Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and bans of bread. She also generates additional income through her nursery school and selling passion juice. The main business challenges for Justine include seasonality and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler. Justine lives in a home that she owns with access to electricity but not piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise like sugar, salt, soap, and bread

loans.name: Naeima

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is a 36-year-old woman. She is married and has four children. She decided to open her own business in 2006. Therefore she opened a clothing and household products shop. She is well known in her area and has a good reputation.

She applied for a US$ 1200 loan to renovate her shop and install a rolling shutter, aiming to grow bigger and expand her business in the future.

loans.use: Renovating her shop and installing a rolling shutter

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 23-year-old single woman from Lebanon. This young woman lives alone to attend the university because her family home is far from her college.  

Despite her young age, she has proven to be a successful entrepreneur as a radio program director. She started this type of business in 2008 and she works on a freelance basis. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a laptop to be able to do the needed preparations for her occupation from her home instead of staying late at the radio station. This way, she will also be able to deliver  her service faster. In the future, she hopes to continue in this type of occupation and develop her career, and she dreams of having her own radio program.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop so she can do her work at home

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: Marcela, de 47 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo José de 49 años, que es profesor, pues su hijo mayor trabaja y vive independiente. Desde hace varios años esta dedicada mujer elabora  prendas de vestir; cose en su casa y entrega pedidos de polos y poleras, mediante intermediarios, que le pagan por la cantidad de prendas entregadas. Esta  labor la realiza en las tardes y esta muy satisfecha porque durante las mañanas trabaja en un colegio, como personal de limpieza, y también percibe un sueldo por esta trabajo. Sus oficios le permiten obtener regulares ganancias con las cuales ayuda a su esposo en los constantes gastos del hogar. Así pasan los días de Marcela que se esfuerza cada día por salir adelante; pues anhela en el futuro instalar un negocio propio de fabricación y venta de ropa, de esta manera espera salir adelante. Es el 11avo crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Marcela tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de tela que necesita para elaborar mas prendas; además quiere comprar dulces típicos, al por mayor, en el interior del país para traerlos a la ciudad y venderlos a mayor precio.
texts.en:
Marcela is 47 years old.  She lives in her own home together with her husband, 49 year-old José.  Her husband is a teacher and her grown-up son works and lives independently.  For several years, this dedicated woman has been making clothes which she sews in her home.  She delivers orders for polo shirts and t-shirts to middlemen who pay her for the quantity of garments she supplies.  She carries out this work in the afternoons and is very happy because in the mornings she works in a school as a cleaner and she makes a wage for this work too.

Marcela's work allows her to make regular profits with which she can help her husband with their constant household expenses.  This is how Marcela spends her days, working hard to get ahead in life.  In the future, she would like to set up her own business making and selling clothes.  In this way she hopes to get ahead.

This is Marcela's 11th loan from MFP and she pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner since she doesn't want to let down the people who are making this support possible as it will allow her to continue working.  Marcela plans to invest her loan in buying the fabric which she needs to make more garments.  She would also like to buy traditional sweets, wholesale, from the provinces so that she can bring them to the city and sell them at a higher price.

loans.use: To buy fabric to make more clothes and to buy traditional sweets from the provinces

loans.name: Las Rosas De Maria Group

texts.es:
LAS ROSAS D. MARIA

Ysabel tiene recién 3 meses siendo presidenta D. la Alcancía Comunal “LAS ROAS D. MARIA” a esta conformada por 7 personas q se conocen por que todo el grupo son vecinos (viven en las misma calle)y le pusieron ese nombre a su Alcancía Comunal por que antes se reunían en la casa D. la señora María ex miembro D. la Alcancía  Comunal 
Y tenia un jardín con rosas por eso le pusieron el nombre “LAS ROSAS D. MARIA”
Ysabel tiene 36 años es madre soltera tiene 2 hijos que son dependientes por eso la señora Ysabel tiene ya 3 año trabaja en lo que es venta D. DVD y tanbien venD. golosinas D. esa manera ayuda a su pareja con los gastos del hogar Ysabel invertirá el préstamo que le brindara Edaprospo-Prosperidad en compro D. peluches para venderlos por la fista naviD.ñas pero su sueño es poner un salón D. belleza o abrir un restaurante y con la ayuda D. Edaprospo-prosperidad lo lograra.
texts.en:
MARIA’S ROSES

Ysabel has only been the President of the “LAS ROSAS D. MARIA” communal bank for three months.  The bank has 7 members who know each other because they are neighbors (they live on the same street).  They named their communal bank that way because they used to meet at María’s house, a former communal bank member, which had a rose garden, thus the name: “LAS ROSAS D. MARIA.” 

Ysabel is 36 years old and a single mother of two dependent children.  Because of this, Ysabel has been selling DVDs and snacks for the last three years.  In this way, she can help her partner meet household expenses.

Ysabel will use the loan she’ll get from Edaprospo-Prosperidad to buy stuffed toys to sell during the Christmas season but her dream is to open a beauty salon or a restaurant and with Edaprospo-Prosperidad she will accomplish it.

loans.use: To buy Christmas stuffed toys to sell.

loans.name: Munhbayar

texts.en:
Munhbayar M. is 29 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in the Uvs province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest daughter attends a local primary school while his wife stays at home with their youngest daughter. Munhbayar operates a taxi service using his own car in his town. He started his transportation business in 2004 and has gained a lot of experience as a driver. For the future, he plans to purchase another car and rent his old car to other people for profit. Munhbayar is a modest man and says, "All I want is to have my own fence for my family." 

He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a car for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a car

loans.name: Margaret Carmen

texts.es:
Margaret tiene 28 años y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Ella después de hacer sus actividades del hogar se dedica a su trabajo, ella es técnica en enfermería y trabaja en el hospital Antonio Lorena de la ciudad del Cusco. Margaret requiere el préstamo para uso personal. 

Margaret pertenece al banco comunal “Renovación” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal está conformado por personas emprendedoras y trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Margaret is 28 years old and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru. After doing the household tasks, she works and is a nursing technician at the Antonio Lorena Hospital in the city of Cusco. Margaret needs the loan for personal use.

Margaret belongs to Asociación Araiwa’s Renovación Communal Bank in Cusco, Peru. The communal bank is comprised of enterprising and hardworking people who always look for opportunities to get their children ahead in life.

loans.use: Personal use

loans.name: Jeana

texts.en:
Jeana A. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old. Jeana is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a retail business, buying and selling dried fish and squid in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jeana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Jeana is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish and squid to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like dried fish and squid

loans.name: Jorge Denis

texts.es: Jorge Denis tiene 32 años, tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de dissel. El se dedica a este negocio hace más de 5 años. Por lo que es muy conocido en su zona, ya que tiene una gran variedad de clientes que solicitan este tipo de productos, Su negocio se encuentra en un lugar muy estratégico y céntrico de la localidad, es muy trabajador y siempre disfruta de realizar su trabajo.El financiamiento es  para comprar mayor cantidad de dissel, ya que actualmente la gasolina está muy cara. Su deseo es brindarles una mejora calidad en sus servicios.
texts.en:
Jorge Denis is 32 years old and has three minor children under his care.  For the last five years he has had a business selling diesel fuel.  He is very well-known in the area and has many customers who order all kinds of products.

His business is in a very strategic, central area of the town.  He is a hard worker and enjoys what he does for a living.  He plans to use the loan to buy more diesel fuel since gasoline prices are now very high.  His wish is to provide the best quality of service possible.

loans.use: For working capital

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en: Merlita G. is from the village of Salinas Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 50 years old, married and has four grown-up children. To make a living, Merlita raises crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, her main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Merlita has been in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 40,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per harvest. In 2011, Merlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 41 years old and married with three children.

Elisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of goods to sell.

Elisa has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from cake/puto (rice cake) making.

Elisa aspires to send her kids to school and to repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her store

loans.name: Mirian Elizabeth

texts.es: Mirian Elizabeth R. D. P. D. cuarenta y cuatro años D. edad vive en casa propia con su compañero D. vida y sus cuatro hijos en el departamento D. Usulután. Ella posee una tienda en su residencia la cual tiene mucha demanda porque siempre tiene lo que el cliente necesita, además para Mirian "la mejor atención al cliente" es su lema,  y siempre está a disposición D. satisfacer a las personas. Su tienda necesita abastecerse D. mas productos, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar bebidas, granos básicos, cereales, golosinas, entre otros. Mirian tiene confianza en que al crecer su negocio le ayudara a darle un mejor futuro a su familia y así también solventar las necesidades D. su hogar.
texts.en: Mirian Elizabeth R. D. P. is 44 years old.  She lives together with her life partner and four children in her own home, in Usulután department.  Mirian has a store in her home which is very popular because she always has what her customers need.  Mirian's motto is 'best customer service' and she is always ready to keep her customers happy.  She needs to stock her store with more products and so she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to buy soft drinks, basic grains, cereals, candies and other products.  Mirian believes that, by growing her business, she will be able to proviD. her family with a better future and also cover her household needs.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, basic grains, cereals and candies

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.en:
Ignacio P. is from the town of Sta. Rosa, Gamu, Ilagan, Isabela. He is 42 years old. Ignacio is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Ignacio owns and operates a business venture in the transportation sector providing motorcycle transport services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating tricycle transport services. Ignacio has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Ignacio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Ignacio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair existing vehicle for better service. Ignacio is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Ignacio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories for his motorcycle transport service.

loans.name: María Eulalia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres De Lucha se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 22 y 18 años de edad, el menor de ellos aun  vive con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella tiene un local en su casa en el que se dedica a la venta productos Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), otros cosméticos y ciertos tratamientos para el cabellos y tinturados. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 17h00. Mientras ella se encarga de su negocio el esposo se dedica a la venta de repuestos y refacciones para automóviles, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y  trabaja de lunes a sábados. Tanto los cosméticos como los repuestos de los vehículos los van a comprar a Guayaquil cada vez que necesitan. Nos cuenta que tienen seis años dedicados a estas actividades.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, repuestos y refacciones de vehículos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace  dos años y le gusta porque les ayuda con el negocio.
 
Sus sueños son tener un mejor negocio y mas grande.
texts.en:
The Mujeres De Lucha [Fighting Women] community bank meets every two weeks in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for being a very commercial area and for its traditional festivals of San Pedro and San Pablo and for its people's cheerfulness.  

Here we meet María. She is 44 years old and married. She has two children, aged 22 and 18. The youngest still ives with her. Her husband is a merchant.  

She has a locale in her house where she sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accesories), as well as other cosmetics and certain hair treatments and dyes. She works every day from 8:30 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. While she runs her business, her husband sells car parts. The way she makes her sales is from door to door, Monday through Saturday. They buy the cosmetics and the car parts in Guayaquil as they need them. She tells us that they have been doing this for six years.  

She is going to use this loan to buy perfumes, jewelry, cosmetics, and car parts. She has been in the community bank for two years and she likes it because it helps them with the business.
 
Her dreams are to have a bigger and better business.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, replacement parts for cars.

loans.name: Cristo Rey Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL CRISTO REY

Idina una persona muy cooperativa que tiene muchos años siendo parte de la Alcancia Comunal CRISTO REY, cuyo nombre fue elegido porque tienen mucha fe en Cristo.
Idina mas conocida como Dina, como le dicen sus vecinas y miembros de su grupo, se dedica a la venta de ropa al por menor, ya sea ambulatoriamente o a pedido de sus amigos, vecinos, clientes, etc, ella aprovecha esta temporada en la cual hace mucho frio para vender su mercaderia de temporada como chompas, casacas.
Idina sueña con tener una tienda propia en un mercado muy concurrido para asi tener mas ingresos para su casa y asi dejar comodidades a sus hijos y consentir a sus nietos
texts.en:
Christ the King Communal Bank

Idina is a very cooperative person who has been a member of the Cristo Rey (Christ the King) communal bank for many years; the name was chosen because they have much faith in Christ.

Idina, better known as Dina, as her friends and group members call her, sells clothes at retail either as a street vendor or to order from friends, neighbors, customers, etc.  She takes advantage of this cold season to sell seasonal merchandise like sweaters and jackets.

Idina dreams with having a store of her own in a very busy market in order to earn more income for her house and provide more comfort for her children and to be able to coddle her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Marvin Santiago

texts.es:
Marvin Santiago  vive en la Cuidad de Managua, se conoce como una persona honesta, excelente y eficiente en la empresa que labora.
Don Marvin acudió a las oficinas de ceprodel a Solicitar un préstamo para hacer mejoras de su vivienda. Para compra de materiales de construcción   como cemento, piedra, arena, piedrín y para el pago de mano de obra.
El señor Marvin  nos manifiesta que gracias a los créditos con ceprodel  a mejorado su casa de habitación para poder darle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Marvin Santiago lives in the city of Managua. He is known to be an honest, excellent, and efficient person in the company where he works.

Marvin approached the offices of Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) to request a loan to carry out home improvements. He will purchase construction materials such as cement, construction rocks, sand, gravel, and to cover the labor expenses.

Marvin tells us that it is thanks to loans from Ceprodel that he has been able to improve his home and to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Farida's Group

texts.en:
Farida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who operates a rickshaw and provides transport services to his passengers. He is very good at driving and has been in this profession for the past 15 years. 
 
Farida is the mother of three sons and a daughter. Her eldest son is also a rickshaw driver. Her second son has a tie & dye business and the youngest son is a goldsmith by profession. Her daughter sews clothes for her neighboring clients to support her family financially. Farida herself is a housewife and performs her duties by staying at home. 

With the loan, her husband will repair his rickshaw to help him provide better transport services to his passengers. Farida is confident that an investment will help his business grow and save his business assets. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Farida.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.en:
Juan lives with his wife and five children in Choluteca, Honduras. 

He has made a living for the last seven years by selling basic grains out of his home. 

Juan is requesting a loan of HNL 8,000 to purchase bulk supplies of grains.

loans.use: to purchase bulk supplies of grains.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Imelda has been in this business for 20 years. Imelda earns more income from raising pigs.

Imelda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Deonila

texts.en:
This is Deonila, 60, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Genaro. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
