Deonila operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Deonila earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. she also earns extra income from a room that is being rented beside her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 9000 in sales monthly.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 26,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Deonila hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items and other products for retail

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en:
Zamira, 38, is a resident of Tup. She is married and has three children; the youngest is seven. Zamira’s husband drives a cab in order to make a living, while she runs a small dairy business and an apparel stall. Every morning the livestock yields up to 15 liters of milk, which she sells for 8 soms per liter. After finishing this, later in the morning, she heads to a local bazaar to start retailing clothing. 

In 2005 Zamira used to retail food products, however due to low results, she switched to retailing clothing. Thanks to these financial inflows, the family budget can cover tuition payment for Zarina’s older son and provide the entire family with basic needs. Her initial investment was 12,000 soms, and currently the business is generating 3,000 soms per month. Zamira addressed Kiva lenders for financial assistance, because she needs to stock her small shop with summer clothing and school uniforms for the upcoming start of the academic year. She is thankful to all lenders who make such a big contribution to the development of her business. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase summer clothing and school uniforms.

loans.name: Baasanjav

texts.en:
Baasanjav is 56 years old and lives with his four children and wife in a ger (a traditional Mongolian housing tent) in the Hovd province of Mongolia. His four children are high school students and his wife is currently unemployed. Baasanjav started to trade spare car parts at the local market in 2002. Before this he used to trade cars with other partners. Now, he transports spare parts from the city of Ulaanbaatar and the Mongolia western border to sell them in his hometown. 

In addition to his main business, he also trades wood frames of bow and arrow and wooden home furniture. His daily income is between 60,000 MNT to 120,000 MNT and he is planning to expand his business activities. He is a diligent man who is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase spare parts from Ulaanbaatar city.

loans.use: To purchase spare car parts

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 26-year-old man who lives in Gaza city located in Palestine. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. 

Mohammad has started a new project on his own which is in the field of plumbing. He needs to purchase plumbing equipment to use in his work, but because of the salary he gets, he hasn't enough money, so he wants to take out a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. 

When Mohammad takes out this FATEN loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will purchase the plumbing equipment that he needs to start working on his new project. That will add another source of income and improve his living conditions. Mohammad is photographed in the FATEN branch.

loans.use: to purchase plumbing equipment.

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en: Tsetsegmaa is 42 years old and lives with her four children and husband in a ger in Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband works as a security guard at the Oyu Mandal LLC's Children's Summer Camp. She started her business in 2011 by opening a fast food service. Before that she was a taxi driver. Currently her eldest son is a taxi driver. She pays 100,000 MNT for the building's rent. Her fast food service is located in a crowded place and that gives her a net profit between 20,000 MNT to 30,000 MNT. She is a diligent woman who says "After my son graduated from the driver's training course, I gave my car to him and started a new business." She is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase food supplies for her cafe.

loans.use: To purchase food supplies

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is hard working. She wants to expand her business, but she lacks the necessary capital. That's why she is requesting this loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase groceries such as canned goods, biscuits, noodles and other ingredients to sell in their village.

She is 36 years old, married and blessed with three school-aged children. She has been running her general store for a year. Her husband works as a farmer in the village where they live. 

She wants to expand her business and repair the store. She hopes to grow her business with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as canned goods, biscuits, noodles and other ingredients to sell

loans.name: Akmal

texts.ru: Акмал возраст 27 лет, холост. У Амала дилерский центр, который находится в центре города. Он занимается этим делом 3 года и имеет опыт работы. Рядом с его центром много госучреждений и других объектов, поэтому  у него в дилерском  центре всегда многолюдно. Его работа всегда востребована. Он хочет получить займ на сумму $3000 США  для покупки компьютера и расширения бизнеса. Акмал надеясь на вашу поддержку, заранее благодарит вас за помощь.
texts.en: Akmal is 27 years old, single.  He has a dealer center, located in the town center.  He has been involved in this business for three years and has work experience.  It is always crowded in his dealer center because there are many government offices and other sites near his center.  His work is always in demand.  Akmal wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 to purchase a computer and expand his business.  Akmal relies on your support and thanks you in advance for your help.

loans.use: to purchase a computer and expand his business

loans.name: Mirjael Jonatan

texts.es:
Mirjael de 24 años de edad, es soltero, reside en casa de sus padres, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada  en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura. Es una zona agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

El cuenta con un terreno agrícola en donde suele sembrar plantas de limón, él ya tiene varios años de experiencia en esta actividad y durante este tiempo ha llegado a conocer mucho sobre el manejo de cultivos. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades los utiliza para solventar la economía diaria de sus gastos personales.  Tambien cría y comercializa aves corral, permitiéndole tener otro ingreso para  ayudar a sus padres.

Mirjael desea comprar fertilizantes para así brindar mantenimiento a su terreno de cultivo para instalar una nueva plantación de limón y alimento balanceado para sus aves de corral. De esta manera obtendrá una buena cosecha. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Mirjael is 24 years old, single, and lives at his parents' house, which lacks basic utilities.  It is located in the rural area of the District of Tambogrande which pertains to the Department of Piura.  It is an area mainly of agriculture, livestock, and arts and crafts.  

Mirjael has a plot of land where he grows lemons.  He already has a few years of experience in this line of work and has come to learn a lot about the growing and caring of plants.  He uses his earnings to pay for his daily expenses.  

He also raises and sells hens, which gives him an additional bit of income to help his parents.  Mirjael wishes to purchase fertilizer so that he can maintain his plot of land, grow more lemon trees, and obtain a better harvest.  Also, he wants to purchase balanced feed for his fowl.  In order to achieve his goal, he has asked for a credit of 1,500.00 Soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer, so that he can maintain his cultivations, and a balanced feed for his hens.

loans.name: Ana Lisseth

texts.es: Ana Liseth tiene 23 años, su actividad es el destace de cerdos. Hace más de 4 años. Inicio trabajando con su Mama quien también se dedica al mismo negocio, pues debido a su situación económica se vio obligada a generar ingresos para las necesidades de su familia, sin embargo no cuenta con el monto de dinero necesario para hacer la compra de los cerdos, es por tal motivo que hoy solicita un préstamo que le permita comprar cerdos.
texts.en: Ana Liseth is 23 years old.  For more than four years her job has been butchering pigs.  She began working with her mother, who also works in the same business, since her economic situation obliged her to generate income for her family's needs.  Nevertheless, she doesn't have the necessary amount of money to buy the pigs.  This is why she is now requesting a loan that will allow her to buy pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Neoun

texts.en:
Neoun is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean sites. 

She is a farmer, and her husband raises pigs to resell. This couple works so hard every day for incomes to help cover the family expenses. 

Neoun is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a motorbike for the children to commute to work in the city. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. 

In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Liboria Feliza

texts.es:
Liboria de 34 años, Con las fuerzas que le da Dios Trabaja como empleada domestica en una casa. 
No tiene horarios fijos para trabajar, y el único problema que se le presenta es la delincuencia que observa cuando va de su casa al trabajo.

Esta felizmente unida con su esposo y no tienen hijos. Con su prestamo quiere comprar cemento, arena, bloques para construir mejor su casa. Su meta es poder terminar de construir su casa por el cual solicitaron el préstamo.
texts.en: Liboria, 34, with God’s strength, works as a domestic employee in a house.  She does not have fixed work schedules.  The only problem she faces is crime she observes going to and coming home from work.  She is happily united to her husband; they have no children.  She wants to use her loan to buy cement, sand and concrete blocks to better build her house.  Her goal is to be able to finish building the house and this is why they asked for the loan.

loans.use: to buy cement, concrete blocks and sand.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
Nieves de 44 años, es una mujer carismática y afable. Vive con su pareja, Pablo, con quien tiene un hijo de 12 años en una casa propia en la ciudad de La Merced. Nieves asimila rápidamente. El negocio que tiene lo aprende ayudando a su cuñada quien se dedica a la venta de carne.
De esa manera, Nieves inicia sus labores desde las 4 de la tarde. Para ello compra aves de corral como: gallinas, pollos y patos, los que beneficia y despluma. 
“Trabajo sola, una vez que terminó de desplumar y desviscerar a los animales los meto a la congeladora para repartirlos al día siguiente”, explica. Para este negocio, viaja 2 veces a la semana a la ciudad de Huancayo, de donde trae las aves a menor precio.
“Cuando compro el kilo me sale a 12 soles, pero lo vendo a 19 o 20 soles. Si se gana bien”, comenta.
Con el pasar de los años y la continuidad de su negocio, Nieves espera alquilar e instalar un kiosco en el óvalo de la ciudad, así ya no tendrá que llevar su producto a las manos de sus clientes. Éste sería su primer préstamo de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. “Mujeres al éxito”, es el nombre de su banco comunal y se siente muy entusiasmada de pertenecerlo. De recibir el dinero del crédito, lo invertirá en la compra de aves de corral como: gallinas, patos y pollos; y como la demanda sube en fiestas navideñas, también adquirirá pavos, para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Nieves is 44 years old and is a charasmatic and affable woman. She lives with her partner Pablo with whom she has 1 child, 12 years old, in her own house in the city of Merced. Nieves learns quickly. She learned the business helping her sister-in-law who sells meat. Thus Nieves starts her work from 4 in the afternoon. For this she buys poultry such as hens, chickens and ducks which benefit from being plucked. "I work alone. Once I've finished plucking and eviscerating the poultry I put them in the freezer for distribution the next day," she explains. For this work, she goes twice a week to the city of  Huancayo where she gets poultry at a better price. "I pay 12 soles a kilo but sell it for 19 or 20 doles. It's good money," she says.

With the passing of time and the continuity of her business, Nieves hopes to rent and fit out a kiosk in the city oval so there will be no need to deliver her product straight to her customers hands. This will be her first loan with MFP so she agrees to be punctual with her repayments. "Mujeres al Exito" is the name of her communal bank and she is very exicted at belonging to the group. On receiving the loan she will invest it in the purchase of poultry such as: hens, ducks and chickens and as demand grows with the Christmas season she will also buy turkeys to continue her business.

loans.use: to buy poultry such as chickens. ducks, hens and turkeys.

loans.name: Trerk

texts.en:
Trerk, 64, is widowed and resides with two daughters and four grandchildren in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. 

She is unemployed, but she stays home and looks after her grandchildren. Her daughters are employed at the garment factory. 

Trerk is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for her daughters to drive to work. In the future, she would like to build a new house and send her grandchildren to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her daughters to drive to work.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 46 años, es casada, tienen dos hijos. Vive con su esposo y sus hijos en Ibarra, Provincia de Imbabura al Norte de Ecuador. Rosa es una persona amistosa muy responsable en su trabajo ya que le gusta hacer sus actividades diarias.

Rosa trabaja sola en la crianza de animales como cuyes, cerdos para criarlos y despuén sacarlos a la venta en las ferias libres o a clientes que ya se ha ganado por su autoestima y sus animales de calidad. Es el séptimo crédito que realiza en Fodemi, el mismo que va a invertir en la compra de cuyes, cerdos para comercializarlos entemporada de navidad y fin de año ya que en este mes las ventas se incrementan y de la misma manera los ingresos económicos que le permitirá mantener a sus hijos dándoles un buen estudio y buena alimentación.

Su sueño es poder construir corrales para sus animales.
texts.en:
Rosa, 46, is married and has two children.  She lives with her husband and children in Ibarra, a town in the northern Ecuadorean province of Imbabura.  She is a friendly woman, hard-working and responsible, and she likes what she does.

Rosa operates a business raising and selling animals: pigs and cuyes, for example.  She sells them at local markets or to long-standing customers who come to her because they know her animals are of good quality.  This is her seventh Fodemi loan and she will use it--like her loans before--to buy more animals.  She wants to ensure that she can meet the extra demand for her animals over the holidays.  The income from the business will allow her to provide her children with a healthy diet and pay for their school fees.

Rosa would like to build a pen to keep her animals.

loans.use: to buy cuyes and pigs for her animal sales business.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lillian is 26-years-old, married and blessed with 3 children. Lillian sews table clothes in Nyakach West trading centre and has been in this business for the last 4 years earning a monthly income of kes 2,000.

She is applying for her second loan with KADET ltd of kes 30,000. She plans to use the funds to purchase stock textile material for her business. With the anticipated profits she will educate her school going children.

Her dream is to improve her business and look after the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for the business.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: Tessie is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. Tessie makes and peddles corn snacks like binake and tilaob. She has had this business for five years. Tessie has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making snacks like binake and tilaob to sell. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011 and, in the future, hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks like binake and tilaob to sell

loans.name: Germaine

texts.fr: Germqaine est une jeune commercante agee de 25 ans, celibataire et mere d'un enfant qui va deja a l'ecole. elle fait son commerce depuis 4 ans et diversifier ses produits.

loans.use: renforcer son fond de roulement

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
El comité San Isidro pasa al sexto ciclo en forma excelente, el grupo demuestra muchas ganas de crecer dentro del programa, demostrando solidaridad y unión.  Todas ellas son muy trabajadoras y tienen muchas ganas de salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Silvina, quien por medio de su ejemplo trata de mostrar a sus compañeras que si se puede. Ella tiene una despensa bien surtida en su casa, y con ello y sus ingresos ayuda a su familia dándoles todo lo que necesitan para una vida sin privaciones. Ella se define a si misma como una persona que desea salir adelante y crecer.
Silvina solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas, lácteos, enlatados, productos a granel y demás insumos que son los que más salida tienen para poder seguir dando a sus clientes una buena variedad.
texts.en:
The group San Isidro enters its sixth cycle in great shape; the group demonstrates a lot of desire to grow within the program, showing solidarity and unity.  All of the women are hardworking and have a lot of will to continue moving forward and to help their families. 

One of the women is Silvina.  Through example, she tries to show her group members that they can do it.  She has a small, well-stocked store in her home; through this and her income, she helps her family in giving them everything they need for a life without deprivation.  She defines herself as a person that wishes to get ahead and grow.

Silvina requests this loan in order to invest in the purchase of drinks, dairy products, canned products, bulk items, and other goods that are in high demand, so that she can continue giving her clients a good variety.

loans.use: to buy drinks, dairy products, canned products, bulk items, and other goods.

loans.name: Jose Humberto

texts.es: don jose desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza de ganado bovino y adicional a eso tambien se dedica a la venta de cocos por las diferente colonias, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra sacar adelante a su familia, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, Don jose esta solicitando un credito para la compra de una novilla para poder seguir con la crianza de ganados  ya que esa es su fuente de trabajo y asi poder obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Don Jose has been making a living raising cattle and other animals for several years.  He also sells coconuts in the different nearby towns.  With these jobs he is able to earn enough to move his family forward.  He lives in his own house with his wife and their four children.  

Don Jose is requesting a loan to purchase a heifer so that he can continue raising livestock.  This work is his main source of income and so in doing this, he will be able to earn more revenue and give his family an improved quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.en:
My name is Jose Luis, in my neighborhood, I am known for having problems walking and I use crutches. On account of my physical condition, I could not find work in any business. So I decided to sell candies on the side of one of the boulevards of the city Comayaguela. I need to supply my business to increase my earnings and so that I can help my family in their food and school costs of my children.

Loan Use: Purchas of juices, churros, candies, chiclets and other items.

Me llamo Jose Luis, en mi colonia me conocen ya que tengo problemas para caminar uso muletas, por mi incapacidad fisica, por no tener empleo en ninguna institucion decidi vender dulces a la orilla de uno de los boulevares de la ciudad de Comayaguela. Necesito surtir mi negocio para incrementar mis ingresos y poder ayudar a mi famiia en sus gastos de alimentacion y estudios de mis hijos.

loans.use: Compra de jugos, churros, confites, chiclets y otros

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en: Khalida is originally from Republic of Georgia; she has lived in Lokbatan since 1990. In 1995 she opened her family business with her own resources. In 2005-2006 she borrowed two times from the Normicro Baku branch a total of $2,850 and has expanded her business considerably. Now she plans to borrow an additional $1,200 to expand her business further. Her husband is pictured here.

loans.use: To increase inventory variety

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en: Mariana is a 35-year-old mother of five children from the village of Toamua, Samoa. She joined the SPBD program in 2004 and she is still an active member. She started off her business with selling ice cakes and sausage sizzle, and now she operates a small grocery store from her home. Mariana is a hard-working and very dedicated mother, as demonstrated by showing more improvement in her business as well as her home. She opens her shop from Monday to Sunday and earns $300 (approximately USD120) in profits, or more, per week after paying off all business related expenses. She is looking forward for her next loan to rebuild her house and also to upgrade her business.

loans.use: Fill in stock and buy materials to rebuild her house

loans.name: Jaime Benigno

texts.es:
Jaime is married and has two daughters, a 5 and 7 years old; and a 10 years old son. He used to worked in a company but was laid off after personal re-adjustment and in order to get some income began helping his brother who used to sell hats, when he noticed the profit was good, he decided to work by himself and started his own business, selling tattoos and then added selling hats with great results.

In order to offer better quality products, Jaime is requesting a $200 loan to buy merchandise, he promises to repay in 6 months. Jaime knows that with your help he will be able to improve his business and his family’s well being, so he thanks your support.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Jaime es casado y tiene dos hijas, de 5 y 17 años de edad, y un hijo de 10 años. Anteriormente él trabajaba en una empresa pero por reajuste de personal quedó desempleado y para obtener un ingreso comenzó a ayudarle a un hermano que vendía gorras, al ver que tenia buenas utilidades, decidió independizarse y emprender su propio negocio, inició vendiendo calcomanías y después incluyó la venta de gorras, obteniendo muy buenos resultados.

Para poder ofrecer productos de mejor calidad, Jaime solicita un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Jaime sabe que con tu ayuda podrá sacar adelante su negocio y mejorar el bienestar de su familia, por lo que agradece mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: Buy Merchandise

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Arsenia. My main activity is the making and selling of Tortillas. I have my own business called Tortillas "LAS RIQUÍSIMAS" (The Delicious). I have a good clientèle and experience in this type of business.

Thank God, with the income from this business I can help my husband with the family expenses, and the most important of this all is that it allows me to see for my family.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Hola mi nombre es Arsenia, mi actividad principal es la elaboración y venta de Tortillas, cuento con un pequeño negocio llamado Torillas"LAS RIQUISIMAS", cuento con buena clientela y experciencia en este tipo de negocio, gracias a Dios con los ingresos de este negocio puedo ayudar a mi esposo con los gastos de la familia y lo mas importante de todo esto es que que me permite atender a mi familia.

loans.use: Purchasing corn and firewood

loans.name: I Wayan Buda

texts.id:
To be a farmer has been his profession since he graduated from highschool, now he is 60 years old. But Wayan Buda, born in Tused village (West Bali) is still able to manage and work on his 50 are (about 5000 square meter) farm, inherited from his parents. Long beans has been the main producer of the farm, which depends on rainfall as main water source. Besides a well that Wayan Buda digged to help with watering during the dry season. In his current activities, Wayan Buda is often assisted by his 2 sons, I Putu Nugraha Adi and I Kadek Ari, who both finished highschool but are still jobless. Except work that does not need extra hands, he did all by himself, like: planting, fertilize and spraying pesticides. For one long beans planting season, Wayan Buda needs a capital of about Rp3,000,000 to 4,000,000 (about US$330-440), this depends on fertilizer, and pesticides cost to be sprayed. Harvest Income during the 3 months is about Rp5,500,00-Rp6,500,000 (about U$630-730), so that nett profit is about Rp600,000 (about $66)/month. With the loan, Wayan Buda could plant long beans 2 times. Especially with the new water pump he just bought, Wayan Buda is not afraid about water issues, which was a holding factor during planting time.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Menjadi petani sudah ditekuninya sejak baru tamat SMA, kini 60 tahun telah usianya. Tetapi Wayan Buda laki-laki asli kelahiran desa Tuwed ( Bali Barat ) ini masih mampu mengurus dan bekerja di ladang seluas 50 Are yang merupakan warisan dari orang tuanya. Sayur kacang panjang merupakan sumber penghasilan utama dari ladang /sawah yang menghandalkan air hujan sebagai sumber pengairannya ini. Di samping sebuah sumur yang dengan sengaja di buat oleh Wayan Buda untuk membantu pengairan di musim kemarau. Dalam melakukan aktifitasnya saat ini , Wayan Buda sering dibantu oleh dua orang anaknya yaitu I Putu Nugraha Adi dan I Kadek Ari yang telah tamat SMA dan sekarang masih menganggur , kecuali pekerjaan yang tak membutuhkan tenaga kerja masih tetap di kerjakannya sendiri seperti : menanam , memupuk dan menyemprot hama . Untuk sekali masa tanam sayur kacang panjang, Wayan Buda memerlukan modal kurang lebih sebesar Rp. 3.000.000.- s/d 4.000.000.- , ini sangat tergantung pada harga pupuk dan banyaknya biaya obat untuk penyemprotan. Sedangkan hasil panen selama 3 bln yang di peroleh sebesar Rp 5.500.000,- s.d Rp. 6.500.000 sehingga keuntungan rata –rata yang di dapat Rp. 600.000.- / bulan . Dengan pinjaman yang didapatnya, kini dalam setahun Wayan Buda bisa melakukan proses penanaman kacang panjang 2 kali. Apalagi dengan dukungan sebuah mesin pompa air yang baru saja di beli ,Wayan Buda tak khawatir lagi dengan masalah air yang selama ini menjadi faktor penghambat waktu penanaman.

loans.use:
To buy long bean seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and maintenance expenses

Membeli bibit kacang panjang, pupuk, obat - obatan dan biaya perawatan

loans.name: Houngnameto

texts.fr:
Mrs. Houngnameto A. is 40 years old and the mother of six children. With her husband, she works in agriculture and for the past several years has been involved in converting cassava into gari (a creamy-white, granular flour made from fermented, gelatinized fresh cassava tubers). She often buys cassava on credit from the fields. Once she has produced and sold the gari, she repays her loan. This system does not allow her any significant profit margin. This is why she is requesting a loan of $250 to buy cassava in bulk for the production of gari. This would give her financial independence.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Houngnameto A. est âgée de 40 ans et mère de six (06) enfants. Au côté de son mari, elle exerce l’agriculture et depuis quelques années, elle s’est attelée à transformer le manioc en gari. Elle achète souvent à crédit le manioc dans les champs. Après la production et la commercialisation du gari, elle rembourse son crédit. Ce système ne lui permet pas de dégager une marge de revenu importante. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit de $250 pour acheter en quantité du manioc pour la production du gari. Ceci lui permettra d’avoir une indépendance financière.

loans.use: To buy cassava in bulk for the production of gari

loans.name: Dilara

texts.en: Dilara N. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. She is 45 years old, married and has three children. She is selling women clothes in Beylagan city bazaar. She has seven years experience at this business. Dilara needs a loan of $1200 to buy more kinds of clothes and expand her business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Katogo C(Iv) Group

texts.en:
Justine is 48 years and divorced with five children. Justine and Swabula have retail shop business. With the extra business profits, Justine wants to expand her business and become a wholesaler. She also wants to build for her children a permanent residential house. Sumaya, Jane and Agnes all sell second hand clothes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To increase stock in the retail shop

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.ru:
Nazokat B., 25, is married with two children. She has a secondary school education. Nazokat does not work outside the home, but raises milk cows as a side business. She uses the milk for her own family and also sells to retailers. Nazokat has been involved in this business for about five years. She is applying for a loan to purchase another milk cow. This will increase the volume of milk produced, increasing her income. Additionally, Nazokat's business supplies the local markets with fresh milk. She plans to repay her loan within a year.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Боболиева Назокат 25 лет, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее. Домохозяйка. занимается животноводством. Разводит коров для того чтобы получать молоко. Получаемое молоко использует для семьи и на продажу. продает молоко розничным реализаторам.Занимается этим видом бизнеса около 5 лет. Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы купить еще одну дойную корову. Это даст возможность увеличить объем получаемой продукции, тем самым увеличив доход. Кроме того ее бизнес позволяет обеспечить рынки свежим молоком.Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
With a lot of effort and great sacrifice, Mrs Margarita A. and her husband run a farming business in the municipality of Achuapa. The business is their core source of income that provides for the caring of their three small children, one of which needs more attention due to his young age.

At present, Mrs Margarita A.’s family does not have electric power at their home since they live in a far away locality. However, Mrs A. has acquired a solar panel that will allow her to have enough electricity to use two lamps and a television set. Upon acquiring this debt very responsibly Mrs A., is seeking the support of Ceprodel so she can obtain a loan to repay the panel. Having this source of electricity will allow the Altamiranos to improve their living conditions at home and so their children have a better environment for their school work.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

Con mucho esfuerzo y gran sacrificio en el municipio de Achuapa la señora Margarita A. se dedica al negocio agropecuario junto con su esposo esforzándose diariamente para llevar a su mesa el sustento de sus tres pequeños hijos de los cuales uno de ellos (el menor de edad) necesita mayor cuido y atención por su corta edad.

Actualmente la señora Margarita al suplir la necesidad de no tener energía eléctrica en su casa de habitación por vivir en una localidad alejada, ha adquirido un panel solar que le permita tener acceso a dos lámparas y un televisor. Al adquirir esta deuda muy responsablemente acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario que le permita el pago de la deuda y así aprovechar el panel para realizar sus labores diarias y permitir que sus hijos tengan mejores condiciones para sus estudios.

loans.use: To Pay for a Solar Panel for the Home

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Trần Thị Thấm, 50 years old, lives with her husband, a son and a daughter, both are still in school. Her everyday activities include brewing rice wine and grinding bean to sale. They are hard work but earn her regular income. Her husband is a farmer who helps her in his spare time. Since her joining the TYM Fund, she uses the loans to invest in her businesses. Her monthly income is about 200USD. She is applying for a loan of 950USD to buy a new mill and also more rice for brewing.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Trần Thị Thấm, 50 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 2 con 1 trai, 1 gái. 2 con của chị đều đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Công việc hàng ngày của chị là nấu rượu và xay đậu bán. Công việc tuy khá vất vả nhưng giúp chị Thấm có thu nhập thường xuyên. Chồng chị là một nông dân chuyên chăn nuôi, làm ruộng. Anh rất chịu khó giúp đỡ chị trong công việc nhà khi có thời gian rảnh rỗi. Từ khi T. gia Quỹ Tình thương, có thêm vốn đầu tư vào sản xuất nên nguồn thu cũng tăng lên đáng kể. Thu nhập một tháng của gia đình chị Thấm khoảng 200USD. Sử dụng vốn hiệu quả, vòng này chị Thấm xin vay 950USD để mua thêm máy xay mới và gạo nấu rượu phục vụ bà con.

loans.use: Buy new mill and rice for brewing wine

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Mr. Joseph U. is 38 years old and married with five children. He sells cooked food in Benin City in Edo State in Nigeria. He learned his business from his mother and then started his restaurant in 2004. He needs a loan of $1200.00 to buy more food to cook and sell.

loans.use: To buy more food items to cook and sell in his restaurant.

loans.name: Dominga Del Rosario

texts.es:
Dominga Rodriquez works very hard as a seamstress, a business she runs from her home in the municipality of Sandino in the city of Managua. She began with very few materials, and over time has been able to grow her business. Today Dominga needs to invest in her business, so she is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to buy materials she needs such as fabric, thread, needles, buttons, etc.

The loan will not only help her business, but it also helps her take care of her daughter and granddaughter who depend on her.

La señora Dominga R. se dedica con mucho esfuerzo a su negocio de costurería atendido en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la ciudad de Managua.

Ella inició su negocio con pocos materiales de trabajo y a medida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo a mejorado su negocio en su sector.

Hoy en día atraviesa la necesidad de mejorar su negocio y para ello busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito con el cual comprar los materiales de trabajo como lo son hilos, telas, botones, etc. Con este crédito se beneficia tanto ella como su familia compuesta por su pequeña hija y nieta a la que mantiene.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MATERIALS SUCH AS  FABRIC, NEEDLES, THREAD, BUTTONS, ETC, TO GROW HER SEAMSTRESS BUSINESS.

loans.name: Rosa Milagritos

texts.es:
Ms. Rosa Milagritos is unmarried, 42 years of age, studying education and intends to complete her degree. She lives with her parents in the district of Victor Larco Province de Trujillo, La Libertad.

The entrepreneur has a telephone booth at home and is working on a Wawasi (child care). She has the function of being a mother caregiver. She decided to contact Manuela Ramos for the benefits, received a loan which she invested in painting and fixing the telephone booth.

She belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Palmeras”. With this loan of $375 which she will repay within 6 months, she intends to purchase another phone line to improve the service offered to her customers. Thanks to her efforts, she succeeded in becoming independent, and she now shares the profit with her parents.

Her goal is to have a kindergarten, to settle in, and to continue to invest in her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

La señorita Rosa Milagritos es soltera, tiene 42 años, estudia educación inicial y piensa terminar la carrera. Vive con sus padres en el distrito de Víctor Larco Provincia de Trujillo, La Libertad.

La empresaria tiene un locutorio en su casa y trabaja en un Wawasi (cuidado de niños), tiene la función de ser madre cuidadora. Decidió ingresar a Manuela Ramos por los beneficios, recibió un préstamo de S/. 300.00, invertido en el locutorio, pintar el local y arreglarlo.

Pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS PALMERAS”. Con el préstamos de S/. 1,000.00, que cancelará en un plazo de 06 meses; tiene pensado adquirir otra línea telefónica para mejorar el servicio que brinda a sus clientes. Gracias a su esfuerzo logró independizarse, superarse y el beneficio ahora lo comparte con sus padres.

Tiene como meta, tener un jardín de niños, ambientarlo y seguir invirtiendo en sus estudios.

loans.use: To purchase a telephone line

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco is 37 years old and has been married for 12 years to Carmen, who is 33 years old. They have three children of 12, 10, and 7 years respectively. All of them attend school and are enrolled in the first levels of Basic Education.

Francisco began to work in tailoring when he was very young, due to his older brother, with whom he began this activity and who he worked with for 15 years. Francisco learned everything that he knows and puts in practice today from his brother. He worked for several years in the city of San Pablo, in Brasil, until 7 years ago he became independent of his brother and opened his own tailor shop in Paraguay. The shop currently makes all types of clothing with the help of all his family.

He has 10 industrial machines, which are extremely useful in order to be able to get the best benefit out of the machines. Thanks to the efforts that he puts into his work, he is able to meet all the expenses of his family and little by little improve their quality of life.

At the moment he needs a loan in order to buy fabric and threads of many types due to a large demand for the products he wants to make.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisco tiene 37 años de edad, está casado hace 12 años con Carmen que tiene 33 años. Tienen 3 hijos de 12 , 10 y 7 años respectivamente, todos ellos asisten a la escuela y están cursando la etapa primaria de la Educación Básica.

Francisco comenzó a trabajar en costura desde muy joven , a partir de los 15 años se inició en la actividad con su hermano mayor, de quien aprendió todo lo que hoy día sabe y pone en práctica. Trabajó por varios años en la ciudad de San Pablo(Brasil), hasta que hace 7 años logró independizarse de su hermano y abrió su propio taller en Paraguay. En dicho taller actualmente confecciona todo tipo de ropas con la ayuda de toda su familia.

Posee 10 máquinas industriales, las cuales aprovecha al máximo para poder sacar mayores beneficios de las mismas. Gracias al esfuerzo que pone en su trabajo, puede solventar todos los gastos de su familia y así mejorar día a día su calidad de vida.

En esta oportunidad necesita de un crédito para la compra de telas e hilos de todo tipo debido a que tiene una gran demanda de sus productos que desea cubrir.

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Mrs. Khorn Lei Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This Village Bank loan consists of ten members living in Preak Samraong Village in Kandal Province who plan to use the loan for a variety of purposes. For example, Mrs. Khorn L., the Village Bank President and a vegetable farmer growing corn on her 0.2 hectare field, is requesting a loan to purchase more corn seeds to cultivate. Her husband, Mr. Bon Bundara, is a construction worker who can earn $2.50 per day to help support his family. 

Khorn is 28 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school while the youngest one, three years of age, is yet too young to attend school.

loans.use: To purchase more corn seeds to cultivate.

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Mrs. Un R. is a breeder in Pour Village in Kampong Cham Province. She raises two cows and two pigs. Since the business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy four more pigs for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Phan Bunthoeurn, is a fisherman who can gather a little fish and he also makes a small income to support his family.

Mrs. Un R. is 47 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factoR. while another one is a construction worker. Another two are attending the local school, while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is at the age of five.

loans.use: To buy four more pigs for breeding.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia pertenece al Banco Comunal Cruz D. Motupe, distrito D. Independencia,  provincia D. Huaraz, departamento D. Ancash.

Tiene 57 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Claudia afirma que su mayor logro ha sido mantener su negocio durante 30 años. Su puesto D. venta se encuentra ubicado en el jr. 13 D. diciembre 237, Huaraz, en un puesto provisional que queda en la calle. Inició su negocio en la ciudad D. Paramonga y por sus hijos vino a la ciudad D. Huaraz para poder educarlos, junto a su esposo emprendió el viaje, empezando así en Huaraz con un poco D. verduras, que poco a poco fue creciendo y ahora ella junto a su esposo venden sacos D. ajíes y ajo que lo trae desD. la costa. La mayor dificultad que ellos han tenido, es que han sufrido robos en su puesto D. venta y también en sus viajes cuando realizaban las compras D. sus productos. 

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,200.00, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará sacos D. ají ya que el ají es muy costoso porque cada kilo cuesta casi veinte soles.
 
Claudia afirma que le gustaría recibir charlas para saber llevar mejor su familia y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Claudia belongs to the Cruz D. Motupe Community Bank in the Independence district, in the Huarez province, in the Ancash region.

She is 57 years old, is married and has four children. Claudia confirms that her greatest achievement has been running her business for thirty years. Her stall can be found on Jr. 13 of December 237, Huarez in a provisional spot on the street. She began her business in the city of Paramonga. She came to Huarez so that her children could be educated. Along with her husband, she undertook the journey, beginning in Huarez with some produce that gradually grew. Now, with her husband, she sells bags of peppers and garlic that is brought from the coast. The greatest difficulty that they have had is that they have suffered burglaries of their stall and also on the trips they've maD. to purchase their products.

With this loan of S. 1,200, which will be repaid in six months, she will purchase bags of peppers since pepper is very expensive since every kilo costs almost 20 soles.

Claudia confirms that she would like to receive advice in order to know how to take better care of her family and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase bags of peppers at S. 20 per kilo (more or less).

loans.name: Nkokonjeru Model Two Group

texts.en:
Annet M. is the leader of Nkokonjeru Model Two in Lugazi. She is 43 years old, and married with 4 children who are all in school. Annet has a retail shop business where she sells spare parts for generators, saw milling machines, boda bodas, and so much more. The loans have been so helpful in recapitalizing this shop and the profits have helped Annet in opening up another business in poultry. Here, Annet keeps layers for eggs and this helps her to bring in a daily income from the sale of eggs alone. She has a hope that in future, she will be able to sell the layers and buy others to replace the current ones.

She has spent 8 years in the shop business and 2 years with poultry, and her family and business life is far better off as a result of the loans. Annet needs a loan for both businesses, to buy more spare parts and feed for the layers.

loans.use: Buying machine spare parts and feeds for the chicken.

loans.name: Elenoa

texts.en: Elenoa V., 36, is married and has four children.  She has many years experience in the plantation business. Her husband is working and helps run the business.  She sells to the villagers and public people three days per week. Elenoa has had two previous loans with SPBD, which are her only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.  She plans to purchase chemicals, pesticides, fertilizers, and vegetable seeds for maintaining the good growth of her plantation business.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, pesticides, fertilizers, and vegetable seeds for plantation business

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana María Dávila C. tiene la edad de 32 años, su estado civil es soltera, Doña Ana tiene 2 hijos su edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 10 años que cursa el 5 grado de primaria y su hijo menor de 8 años cursa el 3 grado de primaria, los propósitos de Doña Ana son de mantener su actividad económica por lo que para ella es muy importante, sus deseos son de garantizar a sus hijos un futuro lleno de estudios por lo que para ella como Madre le gustaría ayudar a sus hijos a que logren ser unos futuros profesionales por que hoy en día la situación esta muy difícil y esta  es una  gran oportunidad para sus hijos, sus sueños son de propiciarle mejoras a su vivienda ya que tiene ciertos desperfectos y le gustaría realizarlos.


La actividad económica es la venta de comida y refrescos, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación situada en la siguiente dirección de la cuarta sección 2 cuadras el oeste 1 ½ al norte, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 3 años, Doña Ana inicia este negocio surge por la necesidad de obtener una fuente de ingreso para mantener a su familia ya que es ella quien se encarga de pagar las deudas de su hogar por lo que decidió incursionar en el negocio de la venta de comida por la que empezó a elaborar comidas como: gallo pinto, queso frito y arroz con pollo por lo que sus primeros clientes fueron sus vecinos ya que estos le dieron la pauta para seguir adelante y así logra obtener su fama para con su clientela, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que será utilizado para la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, pollo, azúcar y algunos utensilios de cocina ya que todo esto es necesario para la elaboración de su comideria y además podrá ofrecer la variedad de comida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ana Maria D. C., 32, is single. She has two children, a 10-year old son in the fifth grade and an 8-year old son in the third grade. Ana's goal is to keep her business going, something that's extremely important to her. Her greatest wish is that her sons get a good education because she would like to see them adopt professional careers. Things are tough these days but her boys have a chance to get ahead with a good education. She would also like to improve her house because it needs repairs that she would like to make.

Ana operates a business selling food and cold drinks. Her business is located in her house and she's operated it for 3 years. She started the business because she needed a source of income to support her family and pay household debts. She decided to set up a food business and started making dishes such as: "gallo pinto" (a traditional Central American dish made with rice and beans), fried cheese, and chicken and rice, first for the neighbors who had pointed her in the right direction for getting ahead and, as her fame grew, a wider customer base. The loan will be used for working capital to buy basic supplies such as rice, beans, chicken, sugar and cooking utensils, all the things Ana needs to make her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Rosa,

texts.es:
Hasta los veintiocho años Rosa se desenvolvía como una gran ama de casa; sin embargo, llegado a sus veintinueve años ella afirma haber sentido la necesidad de trabajar y sentirse productiva, no solo por ella , sino también por sus dos hijos de nueve y dos años.
A raíz de esto, ella decide abrir en un local dentro de la casa de sus padres, unas cabinas públicas de Internet. En solo un año ha crecido este negocio, de tal modo que también ofrece el servicio de fotocopiado, venta de útiles de oficina y, por el verano, también vende helados.
En unos años ella desea seguir creciendo para luego mudarse a un local mas grande. A la par de su negoció ella también ofrece servicio de diseño grafico, practicando los cursos que llevó cuando salió del colegio.
Helados por ser temporada de verano
texts.en:
Until she was 28 years old Rosa was just a great housewife, however, when she turned 29 when she felt the need to work to make money and to feel productive. She wanted this not just for herself, but for her two kids who are 9 and 2 years old. So she decided to open a business in her parent's house where people come and pay to use the Internet. In only a year her business has grown and she now also offers photocopier services. She also sells office supplies, and during the summer she sells ice cream. In aditon, she offers services in graphic design since she has taken classes in graphic design. Looking forward to the next two years, Rosa hope that her business continues to grow so that she can move her business to a bigger space.

(Translated by Ashlee and Alexis of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ice Cream to Sell During The Summer

loans.name: Cravcenco

texts.en: A. owns arable land in the Prut valley. The soil is perfectly suited for growing potatoes. A. raises pigs also. He holds other land where he grows grain. He sells potatoes and pork at the wholesale market in the Cahul town. This is the first loan borrowed by Antolie from Microinvest. The purpose of the loan is to buy potato seeds and film for greenhouse. His business is profitable because of permanently increasing demand for agricultural products.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and film for greenhouse

loans.name: Vy`a Raity Group

texts.es:
El comité está integrado por 18 señoras de la compañía Potrero de la cuidad de Tobati.  Actualmente el comité se encuentra en el octavo ciclo consecutivo de su crédito.

Las 18 señoras manejan un crédito promedio de guaranies 480.000 por cada integrante, a travez del apoyo educativo y financiero que les brinda el programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya de Cooperación y Desarrollo. 

Los miembros del Comité Vy`a Raity agradecen a la Fundación Parguaya por el apoyo constante que se les brinda a travez del mencionado programa y esperan como siempre cumplir bien sus responzabilidades y seguir trabajando con la Institución para combatir la pobreza.

1.	Maria Griselda S.       Artesania en madera      
2.	Maria Aida L.            Venta de ropa                 
3.	Nelly L.                     Artesania en madera       
4.	Lilian Mabel S.    Artesania en madera       
5.	Saturnina S.              Artesania en madera       
6.	Rosalina S.                Artesania en madera      
7.	Elvia Mariela S.    Artesania en madera      
8.	Alicia S.  Vargas         Artesania en madera      
9.	Liz Maria R.           Artesania en madera      
10.	Juana M. Gomez      Artesania en madera     
11.	Ursulina S.                  Artesania en goma        
12.	Silvia S.            Artesania en goma        
13.	Claudia N.                 Artesania en goma       
14.	Waldina C.             Artesania en madera    
15.	Gloria Mabel N.     Empleada domestica    
16.	Liliana F.                Costurera                      
17.	Carmen B. N.      Venta de merceria         
18.	Laura Maribel R.          Artesania en madera
texts.en:
The group is made up of 18 women from the Portrero Company in the city of Tobati. The group is in its eighth loan cycle. The 18 woman manage a loan of an average of 480,000 PYG ($93) per member. They have this loan by means of the educational and financial support offered by the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya de Cooperación y Desarrollo. The members of the group Comité Vy`a Raity are grateful to the Fundación Parguaya for the constant support offered to them from this program. They hope, as always, to meet their responsibilities and to keep working with the Institución to fight poverty. 1. Maria Griselda S. Wood Crafts 2. Maria Aida L. Sells Clothes 3. Nelly L. Wood Crafts 4. Lilian Mabel S. Wood Crafts 5. Saturnina S. Wood Crafts 6. Rosalina S. Wood Crafts 7. Elvia Mariela S. Wood Crafts 8. Alicia S. Vargas Wood Crafts 9. Liz Maria R. Wood Crafts 10. Juana M. Gomez Wood Crafts 11. Ursulina S. Rubber Crafts 12. Silvia S. Rubber Crafts 13. Claudia N. Rubber Crafts 14. Waldina C. Wood Crafts 15. Gloria Mabel N. Domestic Employee 16. Liliana F. Seamstress 17. Carmen B. N. Haberdashery 18. Laura Maribel R. Wood Crafts

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nails, wood, glue, blades, saw, rubber, and to buy material for sewing

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Чураева Рано занимается шитьем национальных одеял – курпачей. Рано 57 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Ее старшая дочь помогает ей в ее шитье. Кроме этого она сама занимается их реализацией на рынках по Канибадаму. Основной доход семьи складывается от торговли, поэтому Рано старается каждый день выезжать торговать. Сейчас у Рано в планах приобрести новый ассортимент тканей, также у нее есть заказ на курпачи. Новый займ собирается погасить в течении 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Rano C. sews traditional blankets – kurpaches. Rano is 57 years old; she is married and has 3 children. Her oldest daughter helps her with the sewing. In addition, Rano herself sells them at the markets in Kanibadam. The main income of her family comes from sales and this is why Rano tries to go out to sell every day. Right now Rano has plans to acquire a new assortment of fabrics, she also has an order for kurpaches. She plans to pay back the new loan over 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics

loans.name: Bunny

texts.en: Bunny K. is 23 years old and resides in the Battambang province. She has been operating a grocery store to earn a living and is able to make US$5 of profit every day. Her husband is a local teacher at the primary school and he can make US$5 in a day. This couple has one young child. Bunny would like to take out a loan to purchase groceries in bulk so that she can have a special discount and also to meet her clients' demand.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Kiganda Central Nalubega Florence Group

texts.en: N. Florence is aged 28 and is a single mother of three children, all schooling. She sells new clothes and she has been in her business for over seven years. She is using the loan to purchase more clothes to sell: that’s ladies, gents and kids clothes. She is a hardworking woman whose dream is to develop her business and construct a house.

loans.use: To purchase more new clothes to sell

loans.name: Messia

texts.en:
This is 44 years old Messia M. from Mbeya. She is married with four children, between the ages of 14 and 20. She also supports two dependents who are orphans. Messia has run a charcoal business since 1996; Charcoal comes from small, black pieces of dry earth used to cook meals. Women cook food in small coal pots. Because there is such a high demand for charcoal across the country, being a charcoal seller is quite lucrative! She works at the business for nine to 12 hours per day, six days a week. Messia earns about $60 a month. She requests a loan in order to purchase more charcoal in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Messia thanks you for your support!

-------------------------- ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Purchase charcoal in bulk.

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es: Doña María Y. tiene 28 años de edad, es casada de oficios Costurera, “Confección de Blusas” cuenta con un taller de 3 maquinas, habita junto  sus 3 hijas, ella y sus hijas se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 18 años de elaborar Blusas en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Xenajtajuyup del Cantón ChiY., del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijas, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Maria Y. is 28 years old, married, and has three daughters. She is a seamstress who produces blouses in the three-machine shop she operates from her home, where she works with her daughters and two other employees. She has made use of her sewing skills for the past 18 years. Her business is located in the Paraje Xenajtajuyup del Cantón ChiY. village in the district of Totonicapán, Guatemala.

Now that customer demand has increased, she does not have sufficient capital to expand her business. This is why she has applied for a loan from Asociación ASDIR. She intends to buy raw materials so that she can increase her sales, as well as provide for her daughters and improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Happy Group

texts.en:
Deborah O., 25 years old, is married and the mother of a child, who attends school. Deborah is an achiever and works tirelessly to help her husband provide food for the family. Because of her hard work, she was elected the group leader. The group was given the name ‘Happy’ trust bank. She is the one sitting in front in the group photograph.

Deborah prepares and sell cakes to her customers. She mostly vends her wares at the community market. Most of her fellow group members are also petty traders in the market. She is requesting the loan to buy a bulk supply of goods in order to enhance her profit. She dreams of providing better care for her child from the increased business proceeds. In her group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support each other in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To buy stock in bulk for her cake vending business.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Фотима - женщина, которая кредитуется несколько лет. Она торгует на оптовом рынке «Солор» конфетами. Сейчас, в сезон разгара свадеб, она хочет пополнить ассортимент своего товара.  Фотима хочет получить займ в сумме 7000 сроком на 8 месяцев. Она благодарит KIVA за поддержку и понимания.

loans.use: Закуп конфет

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica B. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Msamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Jessica is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Jessica owns & operates a business venture in the food sector selling fish. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying & selling fish in the local community. Jessica has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jessica joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jessica is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jessica from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Jumoke

texts.en: Jumoke is 63 years old and married with six children. She sells crates of drinks and hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Isily

texts.en:
Mrs. Isily B. is from Sitio Napulo, part of Barangay Cervantes in the city of Escalante. She is married with two children, seven months and four years of age. After her marriage Mrs. Isily B. joined NWTF-Project Dungganon and started her and her husband’s fishing boat business with 3,000 PHP.

Now their small business is stable, and they need additional capital for expansion. Mrs. B. is now requesting a seventh loan through NWTF, this one for 6,000 PHP to boost the working capital of their fishing business.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live lives that they can finally call honorable ones. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: For additional capital for her fishing business

loans.name: Eval Antonio

texts.es:
Eval Antonio  Hernández T. es un joven señor de 21 años de edad el cual vive con su esposa y sus dos pequeños hijos en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Desde muy joven Eval se ha dedicado a la ganadería de doble propósito aprovechando tanto la carne como la producción de leche.  Comenta que es muy buen negocio ya que el logra vender sus  productos a los vecinos de su comunidad quienes se muestran muy satisfechos con la calidad de los productos que ofrece. 

Eval considera que gracias al progreso de este proyecto, él y su familia han mejorado poco a poco sus condiciones de vida y espera seguir haciéndolo.

Actualmente Eval desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢685.000 (seiscientos ochenta y cinco mil colones), para comprar 2 vacas más y así  poder incrementar la producción. El sabe que contar con un mayor número de vacas más es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo. Sin embargo, el deseo de ser un microempresario exitoso y sacar adelante a su familia mejorando las condiciones de vida, lo motiva a esforzarse con gran esmero. 

Eval es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.

loans.use: Compra de dos vacas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase fabric

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and hire help for her corn harvest.

loans.name: Sroin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sroin K., 44, and her husband, Mr. Nheb Eng, 48, married in 1982 and have two sons. One son is married and lives separately and the other attends school. The family lives in a small village across the MeK. River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sroin K. and her husband are rice farmers. She is asking for a loan of US$ 800 to purchase a water pump and pipe to use on her rice farm.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump and pipe to use on her rice farm

loans.name: Martha Guadalupe

texts.en: For many years Martha Guadalupe has had a clothing sale business which she started because she needed to cover the household expenses when her husband abandoned her. Martha will use this loan to buy merchandise such as clothing for men, women and children and also cosmetics and shoes. Her goal is to maintain her business and to better meet the needs of her clients in the future. She says that every day the price of items increases and as a result fewer people can afford to buy things. Martha Guadalupe has two children, a 24-year-old son who is in school and a 27-year-old daughter who has her own family.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Chiltoma Group

texts.es:
El grupo Chiltoma está integrado por Nubia Auxiliadora Obregón G., Consuelo del Carmen P. G. y Matilde Patricia G. ellas desean que este nuevo año sus negocios prosperen y tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Nubia de 23 años trabaja arduamente desde muy tempranas horas en el mercado oriental vendiendo frutas y verduras. De la misma manera  Matilde de 38 años quien también vende frutas y verduras.
 
Consuelo por su parte se dedica al engorde y crianza de cerdo, pelibuey y gallinas con lo cual paga los estudios universitarios de sus dos hijas.
texts.en:
The Chiltoma Group has three members: Nubia Auxiliadora Obregón G., Consuelo del Carmen P. G. and Matilde Patricia G.. Their plan for the New Year is to improve their businesses and their quality of life. Nubia is 23 years old. She is hard at work early each morning, selling fruits and vegetables at the eastern market. Matilda is 38 years old; she also sells fruits and vegetables. Consuelo breeds and raises pigs, hens and pelibüey sheep. She's putting her two daughters through college.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Munguntsetseg

texts.en:
Munguntsetseg is 41 years old  and lives with her husband and two children in the Arkhangai province in Mongolia. She and her family live in a “ger,” which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. 

Munguntsetseg started her mobile household goods retail business in 2001, with working capital of 1.000.000 tugrugs. To make a profit, she buys a variety of household goods for wholesale prices, drives across the province and sells them at a retail price. Her husband also operates his own business, but helps her if needed. 

As result of Munguntsetseg's hard work and good customer service, her working capital now exceeds 12 million tugrugs. She has purchased a larger Korean truck for her husband's transportation service. Munguntsetseg hopes to expand her business in the future. She is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrugs loan to purchase more household goods, which she can sell at a profit.

loans.use: To purchase  more household goods

loans.name: Djalal

texts.en:
"I am very thankful to Kiva lenders for their help in improving my business."

Djalal is applying to Kiva for his second loan. As you know from his first loan, he runs a taxi business and this has not changed. However, he changed his car and now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy spare parts for this car.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Emilie

texts.fr: Émilie S. est âgée de 53 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de WANGO depuis 8 ans et a eu à bénéficier successivement de 16 prêts qu'elle a bien gérés et remboursés régulièrement. Elle fait du petit commerce de produits halieutiques et d'huile de palme. Son objectif est de participer aux différentes charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Émilie S. is 53 years old, married and the mother of seven children, all under her care. She has been a member of the Wango “Banc Villageois” loan group for the past eight years and has been granted 16 successive loans, all of which were well managed and regularly repaid. She runs a small business selling seafood and palm-nut oil. Her aim is to participate in managing family expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her business

loans.name: Rafaela's Group

texts.en: Rafaela T. is from the village of Baringin Sur, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 44 years old and is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Rafaela is married and has seven school-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising pigs for fattening and chickens for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Rafaela joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feeds. This loan will be her first from ASKI. Rafaela plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feeds

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 50 years old, married, and has five children. Her husband is a commercial driver. Caroline sells foodstuffs, like tubers of yam and plantain, during the day. In the evenings, she has a bar where she sells drinks. She loves this business because she is able to support her husband in meeting their family's basic needs.
Caroline is requesting a loan of 120,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell. Her hope is to grow her business. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks

loans.name: Meldred

texts.en:
Meldred H. is from the village of Poblacion, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 43 years old. Meldred is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living she sells "UKAY-UKAY" (secondhand clothing) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $90 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Meldred joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Meldred is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional clothing to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothing to sell

loans.name: Petty Trader Group

texts.en:
Musa D. is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Petty Trader Group. In the photo, he is the one holding the sign. He is 27 years old and is single with a 5-year-old child who is in the 1st grade. He also cares for a sibling. He is presently a high school graduate.

For seven years Musa has been running a provisions shop on Carey Street in downtown Monrovia, the capital of Liberia. He started by selling boiled eggs from cash received from a contract he did for someone. He sometimes faces problem with the police because he sells close to the street.

Musa takes good care of his goods in order to encourage customers to continue buying from him. His goal and dream is to grow his business, build a house and care for his son.

Musa plans to use his 9,000 Liberian dollar portion of the group loan of 45,000 Liberian dollars to buy additional provisions for sale.

loans.use: To buy additional provisions to sell

loans.name: Dương's Group

texts.en:
Hà Dương T. (20201010007) is a 31 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Hà is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ngân Cầu nhóm 02 (2).

Hà is single and does not have any children. To making a living, Hà owns and operates a food service business. Hà has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 3.800.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2009, Hà joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hà has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA. She is now requesting a new loan of 7.392.000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20201010011) is a 36 year-old female who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her food stall business.

2.  Nguyễn Thị C. (20201010006) is a 49 year-old female who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her food stall business.

3.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20201010005) is a 49 year-old female who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.

4.  Nguyễn Thị L. (20201010013) is a 35 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business providing recycling services.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hà Dương T. (20201010007) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở tH.nh phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Hà là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các tH.nh viên.
