Mặc dù mỗi tH.nh viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các tH.nh viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ngân Cầu nhóm 02 (2).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ thực phẩm cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hà thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hà kiếm được khoảng 3.800.000 VND.  Vào 2009, Hà đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hà đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20201010011) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


2.  Nguyễn Thị C. (20201010006) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


3.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20201010005) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


4.  Nguyễn Thị L. (20201010013) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ tái chế.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có T. nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nos

texts.en:
Nos K., 39, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for its clay and ceramic products.

K. buys chickens for resale for a gross income of about USD 30 per day. Her husband buys lotus seeds for resale, earning a gross income of USD 25 per day to help cover the family expenses.

K. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase more chickens to sell and to expand her current business. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

In the future, K. would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to sell

loans.name: Musuq Wasi Group

texts.es:
Flor D. Maria es presidenta del Banco Comunal Musuq Wasi que significa Nueva Casa en quechua, las socias son D. la Comunidad D. Santo Domingo que se encuentra a 20 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, es un pequeño valle en donD. se produce verduras y también se dedican a la crianza D. animales menores.
Flor D. Maria vive en la casa D. sus padres y su mayor sueño es tener una casa propia para su hijo, Flor es soltera y tiene 1 hijo que esta estudiando, Flor D. Maria se dedica a la crianza D. cuy en su casa tiene 40 galpones, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su papa, sus ventas los realiza a los restaurantes. Además Flor D. Maria se dedica a la siembra D. verduras, hortalizas y sus ventas los realiza en el mercado D. abastos D. la ciudad.
Su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. semilla y abono. Flor D. Maria desea ampliar sus galpones y tener una empresa, su hijo sea un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Flor D. Maria is the president of the community bank Musuq Wasi, which means "new house" in Quechua. The bank members are from the community of Santo Domingo, which is located 20 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. It is a little valley where they produce vegetables and also raise small animals. Flor D. Maria lives in the house of her parents, and her greatest dream is to have her own house for her son. Flor is single and has one son, who is a student. Flor D. Maria raises guinea pigs. She has 40 cages at her house. She carries out this activity with the help of her father. She makes her sales in restaurants. In addition, Flor plants greens and other vegetables and sells them in the public market in the city. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of seeds and fertilizer. Flor wants to add to her cages and have a business, and she wants her son to have a good career.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Madame Amy N. est sociétaire  à la caisse de CSP. Elle est mariée  et mère  de 2 enfants. Elle est engagée  comme femme de ménage  dans une école  privée  dans la localité  de Guediawaye. Elle a choisi cette option pour pouvoir aider son mari et sa famille dans les dépenses  quotidiennes. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 200 000 frs. L’objet du  prêt est d’acheter un lit pour son foyer conjugal. Ce financement constituera  un soutien  pour son mari a équiper  leur chambre.
texts.en:
Mrs. Amy N. is a member of the CSP group fund. She is married and has 2 children. She is employed as a housekeeper at a private school in the Guediawaye locality. She chose this option to be able to help her husband and family meet their daily expenses. She is seeking a loan of 200,000 frs. The goal of this loan is to buy a bed for her household. This loan will help support her husband in furnishing their room.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Social needs

loans.name: Sabougnouman 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe Sabougnouman 5 sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Fatiana, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont   l’arachide,   le petit mil et le haricot. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne et le premier a été bien remboursé.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, KIATOU D. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1  hectare  d’arachide et du haricot.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla et Fana après les récoltes à une clientèle composée de revendeurs. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25000FCFA en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Sabougnouman 5 group are married women, who average 36 years of age with five children each. The majority of them live in polygamous families in Fatiana, one of the villages of the prefecture of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro region, which is the second administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with the aim of better organising their activities at the beginning of the winter season. The crops they cultivate include peanuts, pearl millet and beans. They are on their second farming loan, and the first was paid on time. With this new loan, Kiatou D. is planning to buy intrants, before the price increases, and small equipment, as well as paying the labor costs of maintaining around a hectare of peanuts and beans. The produce, once harvested, is sold in the towns of Dioïla and Fana, to a customer base made up of men and women. They are expecting to make an average profit of 25,000FCFA at the end of the season.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of intrants and small equipment, as well as labor costs

loans.name: Zeesee

texts.en:
Zeesee B. is 45 years old and lives with her husband and four children in their own ger (the traditional nomadic housing tent) in Hovd province, western Mongolia. Her husband is a gardener while her youngest daughter attends a local high school.

Zeesee began her business in 2005 with the help of her daughter and, since then, her business has been stable. With her business earnings she was enabled to rent a stall at a local market and increase the number and variety of her products.

Zeesee is requesting a 1,900,000 MNT loan to purchase a large number of plumbing parts to sell before the upcoming winter season.

loans.use: To purchase a large number of plumbing parts to sell

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy C. is from the village of Brgy. Tuao North, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 52 years old. Judy is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Judy raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for breeding. Judy has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2008, Judy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Judy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. 

Judy is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the third loan taken out by Judy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

location.town: Brgy. Tuao North, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Josephine 2

texts.fr: B. Josephine 2 et née en 1966 à Adjohoun, dans le département de l'Ouémé. Josephine 2 habite depuis près de vingt deux ans, le quartier Minontchou à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à HOUNKANRIN Jerôme, Josephine 2 a quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés et qui sont toujours à la charge du couple. Josephine 2 assure avec l'aide de son mari, les différentes charges de la famille, grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Josephine 2 a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au cours secondaire. C'est une aide soignante qui mène comme activité secondaire, la vente de tissus, de vêtements et des plats, par le système de distribution. Josephine 2 s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Josephine 2 exerce cette activité                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     depuis une dizaine d'année et a déjà obtenu trois crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus importante de sa clientèle, Josephine 2 désire élever davantage le niveau de son activité et mieux répondre à sa clientèle. C'est la raison pour laquelle Josephine 2 sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un quatrième prêt.
texts.en:
Josephine 2 B. was born in 1966 in Adjohoun, in the OUémé department. For about 22 years she has been living in th eMinontchou district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Hounkanrin, Josephine 2 has four children, all of whom go to school and are still in the couple’s care. Josephine 2 takes care of the family expenses together with her husband, thanks to the revenue from her enterprise. Josephine 2 left school at the high school level. She works as a nurse aide; as a secondary activity, she sells fabrics, clothing and dishes, through a distribution network. Josephine 2 stocks up in Dantokpa at the international market of Benin. She has been in this line of business for about a dozen years and obtained ALIDé loans three times in the past, always repaying them properly. Faced with an ever increasing customer demand, Josephine 2 would like to expand her business and better respond to customer needs. This is why she is seeking a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing clothing and fabrics of the Vlisco brand

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios T. is from the village of Unidos. She is 61 years old. Remedios is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Remedios owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from cultivating fruit trees and harvesting its fruit for sale. Remedios has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Remedios joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remedios has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Remedios is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Remedios from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business.

loans.name: G.s. Larios Group

texts.es: El señor Carlos tiene 35 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos, los cuales son menores de edad. El señor se dedica a la compra-venta de ropa nueva y usada, los cuales distribuye de manera ambulante y principalmente por encargos. Los problemas que enfrenta muchas veces es que las ventas a veces están buenas, a veces no. Cabe señalarse el señor ya tiene 5 años de dedicarse a este negocio, el cual inicio vendiendo ropa usada, se compraba en ese tiempo surtida, era poco debido a que no tenía mucha clientela, luego se fue ampliando. Otro integrante del grupo es don José Antonio, tiene 32 años de edad es casado y tiene dos hijos que tiene 7 y 5 años respectivamente. Su esposa trabaja en San Marcos como domestica, el ya tiene dos años de tener este negocio por lo que ya posee una clientela bien establecida. Y la última integrante es doña Jeanette, se dedica a la venta de frutas, también vende elotes cocidos y tortillas. Ya tiene más de 5 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, primeramente inicio con recursos propios y fue debido al impulso de su mama que ella estableció este negocio con el objetivo de mantener a su hija. Ella solicita este crédito con el propósito de invertir en su negocio.
texts.en: Carlos is 35 years old. He is married and has two minor children. He buys and sells new and used clothing, which he distributes as a street vendor and mainly via orders. The problem that he faces often is that sometimes the sales are good and sometimes they weren't. It's worth noting that he has been doing this business for five years. He started it selling used clothing. Back then he would buy a variety of clothing. It wasn't much because he didn't have a lot of customers, but it grew.  Another member of the group is José Antonio. He is 32 years old, married and has two children who are 7 and 5. His wife works in San Marcos as a cleaning woman. He has had his business for two years and has an established clientele. The last member is Jeanette. She sells fruit. She also sells cooked sweet corn and tortillas. She has been doing this activity for more than 5 years. She started with her own resources and it was due to an impulse that her mother had that she started this activity in order to support her daughter. She is asking for this loan with the purpose of investing in her business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anarkul's Group

texts.en: Anarkul U. is the leader of this group. She is 49 and married to a farmer. The family has three children: the eldest of them is working and the rest are school pupils. The family is engaged in cattle breeding. They are keeping cows and bulls and they make some profit selling dairy products. This business has been running for 10 years. During this time, Anarkul’s family has managed to obtain a house. With this loan, she wants to purchase a cow to raise and to further increase profits from selling dairy products. In the future, the family wishes to buy a house in Tokmok city and then to open their own milk factory. Shayirgul T., 30, is divorced. She has to bring up her kindergarten-going daughter alone. This mother raises money by selling fruits (apples, pears, peaches and grapes). She started her business 2 years ago, following her friend’s advice. The purpose of her loan is to increase the circulation of her commodities. In the future, Shayirgul intends to purchase a big house and then to open her own shop. Gulushkan A. is the group’s treasurer. She is 39, a widow. She takes care of two daughters: the elder one is a schoolgirl and the younger one takes preparatory lessons. This mother makes her living by working in a private lavatory. Out of her earnings, she has managed to widen her house and build an outhouse. The purpose of her loan is to purchase hardware in order to finish her house repairs. Gulushkan is aiming to give proper education to her daughters and also to open a trade outlet for selling foodstuffs. Elenora A., 26, is married. Her spouse raises money by working in a construction organization. The family is engaged in cattle breeding and sells meat products. With five years of working hard, they have managed to purchase a house and two cows. Elenora hopes to get a loan in order to buy a cow to sell dairy products. In the future, she is planning to obtain a flat in Bishkek city, then to increase her cattle stock. ====================================== Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). Mol Bulak is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Help Your Friends Group

texts.en:
Selena J., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Help Your Friends.  She is 34 years old and unmarried, and has four children between the ages of 3 and 16 years. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial difficulty.

For nine years, she has been operating a beauty salon on Ashmun Street in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 10,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 41,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more shampoo, hair driers and other hair products. 

She describes herself as a kind and friendly woman whose dream is to improve her business to international standards.

loans.use: To buy more shampoo, hair driers and other hair products.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 37 years old. She is married and has six children between the ages of five and eighteen. All her children go to school. Her husband works as a farmer.  Grace sells cows. She has had this business for a period of fourteen years. 

She is requesting this loan to buy more cows to sell.  With the profit from this business she will buy a refrigerator. 

She says that her business is successful because it sustains the family needs and pays school fees for her children.  She would like to export cows in the future.

loans.use: To buy more cattle to sell

loans.name: Peou

texts.en:
Peou V. is a 41-year-old, married mother. She has a small shop in the local market in Phnom Penh City. She always gets up early in the morning in order to travel to the market. She sells rice and meatball to people who have no time to cook for themselves and can come to eat at her shop.  

Her husband is car taxi driver in around city and other province. The main incomes in her family come from her husband’s business. This family normally earns an average of $12 per day to help cover their family’s daily living expenses. The couple has only one child who is still a student in school. 

Unluckily, an existing car often has broken down during use. Because of that, Peou V. has decided to seek a loan, which she will use for her husband to fix the broken car.

loans.use: To fix the broken car.

loans.name: Ma Luisa

texts.es: La señora Ma Luisa M. A. es divorciada y desde entonces ha sacado a su hija adelante y para apoyarse con los gastos vive con una hermana que le ayuda. Ma Luisa quiere hacerle mejoras a su vivienda como lo es resanar las paredes, pintar para esto el necesita el apoyo para poder realizar su proyecto.
texts.en:
Sra. Ma Luisa M. A. is divorced. Since then she has wanted her daughter to get ahead. A sister lives with her and helps with the household expenses.

Ma Luisa wants to improve her home by spackling and painting the walls. She needs assistance in order to complete this project.

loans.use: Repair the walls of her home

loans.name: Segundo Orestes

texts.es:
Segundo de 33 años, trabajaba en una empresa pero por su discapacidad lo liquidaron y tuvo que conseguir otro medio de ingresos para poder mantenerse él a sus dos hijos y su esposa (su esposa le ayuda en el negocio, sale con Segundo en la foto).

Viviendo en una zona urbana llamada suburbio el comenzó a trabajar como vendedor de lotería pero necesitaba más ingresos por eso decidió iniciar la venta de “corviches” ( hecho con platanos, pescado, cebollas muy típico en ecuador). En la actualidad trabaja desde la mañana rayando los platanos hasta que su esposa los cocina y él en las tarde sale a recorrer las calles en su bicicleta desde las 16h00 hasta las 19h00pm todos los días

El tiene muchas aspiración con su ventas de corviches por eso quiere continuar en el negocio comprando con el préstamo una maquina industrial para rallar los platanos. En el futuro desearía quiere que su negocio se agrande y con la ayuda de la maquina industrial espera vender “bollos” (hecha con platanos, pescado muy parecido a los corviches pero con su contextura mas suave y grande).
texts.en:
Segundo is 33 years old.  He used to work for a company but he was paid off because of his disability and he had to find another way of making money to support himself, his two children and his wife (his wife helps him in the business and appears with Segundo in the photo).

Segundo lives in an urban area called Suburbio.  He started to work selling lottery cards but he needed more income so he decided to start selling 'corviches' (traditional Ecuadoran deep-fried stuffed pastries made with bananas, fish and onion).  He currently works in the morning shredding the bananas which his wife then cooks and then, in the afternoon, Segundo goes out on his bicycle from 4.00pm to 7.00pm to sell them.

Segundo has many aspirations for his 'corviche' business.  He would like to keep going with his business and use his loan to buy an industrial machine for shredding bananas.  In the future, he would like to expand his business and, with the help of his industrial machine, he hopes to also start selling 'bollos' (a product made with bananas and fish that is very similar to 'corviche' but bigger and with a softer texture).

loans.use: To buy an industrial machine

loans.name: Vuth

texts.en: Vuth M. is 39 years old and lives along the river in Siem Reap, Siem Reap Province.  Vuth M. and her husband are currently local fishermen.  They depend on catching fish in and around Tunle Sap Lake.  That is the core place where the fish shelter.  They have been fishing for a long time and earn at least $7 a day.  This profit is used to cover the family's living expenses and especially to make sure the five children get the highest education.  Vuth M. is applying for a loan in order to buy machines and nets for fishing.

loans.use: To buy machines and nets for fishing.

loans.name: Paquita María

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Jorge de la ciudad de Portoviejo, ciudad hermosa de verdes  montañas y paisajes  encantadores, encontramos el lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal San Jorge.
 
La señora Paquita es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución y por las facilidades para los créditos. Tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero tres aun viven con ella, tres ya son profesionales y el ultimo está  estudiando derecho. Su esposo tiene un taller.

Ella junto a su familia tienen un taller de fundición y elaboración de productos de  aluminio, ella se encarga de las compras de materia prima, así como también de llevar la contabilidad de las ventas que se realizan y sus esposo junto a tres operarios que trabajan con ellos se encargan de elaborar los productos que luego son entregados a comerciantes al por mayor para que estos los vendan en distintos lugares del país, ellos elaboran: exprimidores de limón, hornos, cucharas y otros productos, nos cuentan que ya llevan varios años que se dedican a esta actividad y que gracias a Dios les ha ido muy bien.
 
Este crédito es para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de los productos. Sus sueños son tener un taller mucho mas tecnificado y mas grande.
texts.en:
The members of the San Jorge communal bank meet fortnightly in the citadel of Portoviejo, a beautiful city with green mountains and lovely scenery.
 
Paquita is a founding member of the communal bank. She likes the benefits offered by the institution as well as the credit facilities. She is 48 years old and married, with four grown children, three of whom still live with her. Three of them are already working and the youngest one is studying law. Her husband owns a workshop. 

She and her family own an aluminium foundry. She is responsible for the procurement of raw materials as well as for keeping records of all sales. Her husband and the three operators he works with are responsible for the developing products that are sold to wholesalers, who then sell them in different parts of the country. They make lemon juicers, ovens, spoons and other products. They have been in this line of business for several years and they are thankful to God that everything has gone well.
 
The loan is to buy raw materials to manufacture products with. Her dream is to have a bigger, more modern workshop.

loans.use: Buy aluminium and other raw materials.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta G., a married woman who lives in Brgy. Mantija, Danao City, Cebu, earns her living by operating a general store business. Her husband, Nonelon G., 46, works as an OFW to earn his living. They have four children who are between 3 and 17 years old.

Julieta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 11,400, thereby uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000 with which she intends to buy stocks for her general store so that she can continue to save up for future improvements and expansion of her business. Julieta G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team."

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Beker Francisco

texts.es: Beker Francisco es padre de familia, tiene cinco hijos, el señor realiza una actividad comercial de una pulpería, tiene10 años de trabajar en este negocio, gracias a su esfuerzo a podido salir adelante el y su familia, por lo que busca la manera de cómo ganarse la vida y mantener a su familia de una manera decente. El está muy contento con este negocio que es su principal fuente de ingresos ya que siempre se preocupa por mejorar cada en el servicio de su negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para comprar golosinas, refrescos, pan, galletas, gaseosas entre otros. Su deseo es seguir adelante con este negocio.
texts.en: Beker Francisco is a father of 5 children and he has a convenience store business. He has 10 years in the business and it is thanks to his efforts that he has been able to support his family. He is always in search of ways to earn a living and to support her family in a decent way. He is very happy with his business. It is the primary source of income so he always wanting to improve his service. The loan that he requests will be used to purchase sweets, soft drinks, breads, cookies, and other products. His wish is to keep up with this business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for resale.
